notes: That portion of this area between Poplar Avenue and the drainage canal is known as "Roosevelt Field".  It is one of the best sections of the city for sales, rentals, and mortgage lending, according to real estate men.  Houses therein are small, but reasonably new, bungalows predominating.  Both in this part of B3 and east of it, are found the so-called "average" people with a pride in home ownership and integrity toward obligations.  All lenders, including insurance companies, fight for loans in this area.  The virtue in this area is not in its appearance, for it would rate probably third grade from that standpoint, but in its stability.  The high school to the north is a big advantage.
source: Mr. Nixon, Mr. Burns, Mr. Brady, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Smith, Mr. Lightner.
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Schools, (nearness to high school) close in
detr_influences: A wide variety of type of houses, some of cross streets not paved.
relief_fam: 12 cases - 6 direct, 3 work, 2 medical and 1 service

notes: This small area is typical of a section of the outskirts of any city.  The houses are small, of varying designs, and in no way pretentious.  The area has a substantial class of occupants - modest people with an integrity toward their obligations.  There is not a single relief recipient in the area.  The section adjoining this area south of Lincoln Avenue is about to be developed with small houses, similar to those in the area.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Brady, Mr. Chester, Mr. Baurle, Mr. Smith, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Adjoining good areas - suburban influence - close to good schools, utilities, etc.
detr_influences: Several unpaved streets - occasional stench from canal in west portion

notes: This area is the older but sunstantial part of what is known as "College Hill" and is typical of that "Best"  section of 10 and 15 years ago, relinquishing preference to a newer area "farther out".  In the area are many fine, large homes comparable in every sense with those of any "A" area.  Many of its houses, however, are becoming obsolete.  Two-story houses predominate.  The area is well kept up and will be a choice section for a long time.  It has a high percentage of home ownership and is not a rent area.  Many oil men located in this area, paying high prices for large homes.
source: Mr. Nixon, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Smith, Mr. McFall, Mr. Chester, Mr. Lightner.
name: Wichita, Kan
desc_terrain: Level to rolling.  No abrupt changes.
favor_influences: College Hill Park, good schools, churches, community center, restrictions.
detr_influences: None

notes: This small area is divided into two distinct parts as to type of construction.  That portion west of Bluff is Longview Terrave Addition where all houses are large 2-story structures.  That section is symmetrical.  East of Bluff one story houses predominate.  Most of the new building is in the eastern portion.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC., Mr. Brewer, Mr. Brady, Mr.Burns, Mr. Wright, real estate men.
name: Wichita, Kan
desc_terrain: Level to slightly rolling.  Highest point in the city.
favor_influences: Highest ground in city - highly zoned and restricted
detr_influences: None - Calvary Cemetery on the west is a sufficient distance from the western part of the area to be not a detrimental influence
build_type: west of Bluff 2-story, east of Bluff 1&2-story, all singles

notes: This is a highly desirable area of fine houses with a high degree of uniformity in construction and architecture.  Lincoln Heights Addition extends from Oliver to Crestway, Douglas to Kellogg and Eastlawn Addition from Delrose to Crestway, Douglas to Central.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Brady, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, real estate men.
name: Wichita, Kan
desc_terrain: Rolling in vicinity of College Hill Park, balance level
favor_influences: Good transportation - highly restricted and zoned - has good churches, schools, business center, etc.
detr_influences: None
build_constr: No. of 2nd, west of Broadyview, 1-story brick and frame; balance 2-story brick

notes: This is a section of smaller and more modest homes than are found in neighboring B1.  It is a desirable area for an "average" class.  The railroad tracks on the north have not made an appreciable difference in the saleability of the property.  The cemeteries on the north are hidden from view of this area.  That portion of it east of Hillside Avenue has larger and more up-to-date homes than that west of Hillside.  The best high school in the city is within walking distance of the area, a distinct advantage.
source: Mr. Nixon, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Bouric, Mr. Brady, Mr. Smith, Mr. Chester and Mr. McFall
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Reflection from adjoining A6.  Has good schools, all restrictions, near Country Club.
detr_influences: Close to railroad and cemetery.  Traffic on this railroad, however, is rapidly diminishing.

notes: When the University of Wichita changed from a denominational school 10 years ago to a municipal university, this area began to improve in residential desirability.  Living in the area are a number of university professors, retired men and business men.  Real estate men expect the area to improve.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brady, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Waigand, Mr. Burns, Mr. Chester, Mr. Wright, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: University of Wichita on the north end of area - Fairmount Park on east (yet undeveloped)
detr_influences: Distance from business district - age of the majority of properties.
inhab_type: College professors, retired professional men, business

rentdemand2: too far out to be in great demand
notes: This area is distinguished from D3 only in that its houses are scattered.  It is an area of small frame, 1-story houses, many of them old.  There are many small trucks and gardens in the area.  It is typical of the sparsely built up areas on the outskirts of any city.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Chester, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, Mr. McFall, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Linwood Park, suburban influences, schools, etc
detr_influences: No sewers in southern part of area, stench from city sewage disposal plant south of city noticeable at times in eastern part of area.
relief_fam: Direct 47, work 26, medical 14, WPA supplement 8, total 95

notes: An old section of Wichita.  The northern part near the business district, long ago degenerated to a section of rooming houses, flats, etc..  The houses are too old to be in sales demand. Home Ownership therein is a necessity rather than a desire.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Chester, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, Mr. Bourle, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Schools, proximity to business district
detr_influences: Heavy traffic way on north and south on Broadway, encroachment of industry and commercial, north end - old people's home in southwest, no sewers in southern portion.
relief_fam: direct 97, work 40, medical 24, WPA supplement 21, total 182

notes: An old, run down part of the city.  It is typical of the older sections of any city adjoining the business and industrial area.  Some parts of the area have good rental demand and real estate men are able to move some properties at fair values considering the security.  Most of the houses are small, ill-kept, frame structures.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Chester, Mr, Brady, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Burns, Mr. McFall, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: All utilities, schools, close in
detr_influences: Encroachment of business and industry, canal on east end with attendant stench, occasional bad odors in southeast portion from city sewage disposal plant south of the city, old and run down sections in north and west portions of area.
relief_fam: Direct 94, work 91, medical 40, WPA supplemental 27, total 252

notes: Single family, 1-story homes of brick and frame construction predominate.  Desirable residential area, classed as moderate priced homes.  Area on both sides of "Sleepy Hollow" between Rutan and Bluff, Edgemont and Murdock, was built up during past 8 years by Walter Morris & Co.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Brady, Mr. McFall, Mr. Wright, Mr. Essex, realtors.
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Golf course nearby.  It is rumored that the Wichita Country Club has sold its ground and that it will be opened to residential tracts in which event it will be a very choice area - all utilities, schools, etc.
detr_influences: A water tower at Belmont and Murdock is unsightly.  It was spoken of by real estate men as the only detrimental influence.

notes: This area has been under feverish development during the last 12 months.  At the present time, 36 houses are under construction.  All mortgage men are fighting for loans in the area.  When building was begun on a large scale last year, about 90% of the financing was on FHA plan, but insurance companies are taking much of the business on their own plans.  That portion of this area east of Parker and the section east to Wheeler will be annexed to Wichita City within a few weeks.
source: Mr. Nixon HOLC, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Brady, Mr. Burns, Mr. Smith, real estate men.
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: An area under development with suburban influences, all utilities, schools, community center.
detr_influences: None
price1929: Development of this area except for a few houses was begun in 1936
rent1929: Not a rent house in area

notes: That portion of this area west of Woodlawn Blvd. is known as Woodlawn Heights.  The remainder is known as Eastborough.  It is Wichita's most exclusive residential section.  Its development has been steady within the last three to four years excepting one or two houses built six years ago.  This section is being developed by the Eastborough Estates Corporation and the developers have imposed many restrictions.  This is the only residential section of the community approaching country estates in its development.  There is practically no speculative building.  Several houses are now under construction.
source: Ralph D. Nixon, HOLC Property Review Appraiser, former Wichita real estate man
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: This is a suburban development of fine large homes.  The area is highly restricted, has bus transportation to the city, paved highways leading into the city and is favored with lower taxes than city property.
detr_influences: This area was opened for residential development about 10 years ago.  Shortly thereafter, oil was discovered upon it and the Derby Oil Co. acquired leases upon the ground.  This delayed residential development.  Many of the walls in the western portion of the oil area have dried up.  The east end of the tract still has a number of producing wells which are a detrimental influence from a residential standpoint, but the wells are drying up and the derricks are being removed as rapidly as this occurs.  Within the next 2 yrs. oil production will undoubtedly have played out.
inhab_type: Business & professional people of higher income brackets
lowprice: This area is not in the speculative market.  All houses home-owner built

notes: This development, known as Beverly Manor, was begun during 1936 by D.D. Bourland.  The oldest house therein is ten months old.  A dozen houses have either been built or aer under construction.  The area is highly restricted and has all utilities.  Although it has prospects of being a highly desirable, exclusive section, several local real estate men believe that sales will be slow largely because of the type of architecture.  These real estate men stated that several prospects condemned the style of houses.  The area will undoubtedly be under developed for the nect few years.  Recently Harry Free, experienced prompter, took charge of the development.  He is trying to interest speculative building contractors in the area.  He said that the subdivision has 220 residential lots & 22 business lots fronting on Kellogg Ave; that 12 houses have been built of which 11 were FHA.
source: Ralph D. Nixon, HOLC property review appraiser and former Wichita real estate man; D.D Bourland; Mr. Brady and other real estate men.
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Suburban atmsophere, potentially an exclusive section
detr_influences: Distance from schools only apparent unfavorable factor

desirability: static - as low as it can be
notes: This large area contains the negro concentration of Wichita.  In the north end immediately south of the packing house and stock yards district, are a number of Mexicans.  Property in the area is poor, shacky, and typical of negro properties.  North of Murdock and east of Washington the district becomes one of scattered frame shacks.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. McFall, Mr. Wright, Mr. Essex, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: The heavy negro concentration of Wichita.  Old, poorly kept, and terribly run down - drainage canal with attendant stench.  Railroad tracks - packing house on north end.
inhab_type: Negroes, some Mexicans, low class whites
relief_fam: Direct 238, work 271, medical 63, WPA supplement 76, total 410
pop_inc: slowly; population increase would be only through lack of birth control among negroes and poor whites

notes: Another very old section, distinguished from adjoining D-6 in that its houses are small and in much poorer repair. When the northeastern portion of D-6 was the swank section of Wichita 40 years ago this was probably the second best area. It is inhabited by working people, old people.
source: Mr. Nixon, H.O.L.C., Mr. Wright, Mr. Essex, Mr. McFall, real estate men.
name: WICHITA, KAN.
detr_influences: Railroad on eastern end- adjoins negro area, with a few negro families herein- packing house at north end-

notes: This area was the swanky or very best area of Wichita 35 to 50 years ago.  It is now the apartment house and rooming house section.  Most of the houses therein (see photographs) are the large old houses of the better type.  This type of property is typical of similar sections in all large cities, offering a resale problem.  Real estate men report values of this type of property drop precipitously after such a house is vacated by members of the family who have occupied it for one or two generations.  This area is a very choice rental section of Wichita, due to the type of property and the proximity to the business district.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. McFall, Mr. Wright, Mr. Essex
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Walking distance from business district - Riverside Park - schools, utilities, etc.
detr_influences: Encroachment of business, industrial, wholesale area - Negro concentration on western part

notes: An old section inhabited by substantial class of people.  The area has a good resale record particularly in the section nearest North Riverside and Oak Parks.  Wellington Place between 17th and 19th is a high-grade spot, occupied by a small group of prominent business men, largely through tradition.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brady, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Schools - close to park and close to business section - all utilities
detr_influences: Proximity to poor D6, D7, D9 - occasional stench ffrom packing house area in north
inhab_type: Laboring, wage-earners, few business and professional

desirability: static - as poor as it will be
notes: This area of scattered houses in the northeast section of the city is occupied by a rather substantial class of low income people.  That portino lying north of 15th St. would have been classed as undeveloped but for the fact that there are about 20 HOLC loans in that particular section of D1.  Nearly all of the houses have a garden.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Wright, Mr. McFall, Mr. Essex, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Close to University of Wichita - adequate school facilities
detr_influences: A very scattered section - very few restrictions - lack of sewers in most of the area - many unpaved streets - adjoins negro area - southern portion adjoins two cemeteries

notes: An old section, occupied by a rather substantial type of people. Fairly good sale and rent section because of stockyards, mills, packing plant to the northeast. Properties are reasonably well kept up. The laboring people living in the area are the better class.
source: Mr. Nixon, H.O.L.C., Mr. Wright, Mr. McFall, Mr. Essex, real estate men.
name: WICHITA, KAN.
favor_influences: Schools, park, transportation facilities, business center.
detr_influences: Adjoining packing plant, stockyards. An old, poorly kept area.

notes: An outlying section of cheap, small one-story houses. Laborers, farmers, and truck-gardeners live therein.
source: Mr. Nixon, H.O.L.C., Mr. Essex, Mr. McFall, Mr. Wright, real estate men.
name: WICHITA, KAN.
favor_influences: New high school across river on 18th- suburban influence-
detr_influences: An outlying sparsely settled area with dirt streets, inadequate sewers.

notes: This small area is one fo very modest homes.  The area is only a little more than one-half built up - another typical area on the outskirts.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brady, Mr. Smith, Mr. Chester, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Close to high school - adjoins river and better section to the south

notes: Some houses built in south part of this area by JJ Jones and others by Mr. Keller on Shady Way Drive facing the river sold up to $12,500 in 1929.  2-story brick and frame construction.  Adjoins area A7 which has some of highest lot values in this section of city from residential standpoint.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Essex, Mr. McFall, Mr. Wright, Mr. Brady, realtors
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: High school nearby - close to Oak Park, Central Riverside Park and Sim Park (golf) - close to river - all utilities, community center nearby

notes: Mostly woods and bushes--practically no homes.
source: J. D. Carneal
name: Richmond, Virginia

notes: This is virtually a new area.  It was opened for development in 1930 and sue tot he economic depression which followed (struck Wichita in 1931) there was virtually no activity until late in 1935 and early in 1936.  There is considerable new building in the area at this time.  Being close to Arkansas River, Sim Park, Central Riverside Park, and the comparatively new high school, makes it a very desirable section.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC; Mr. Brady, Mr. Smith, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Brewer, Mr. McFall, Mr. Chester.
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Sim Park (golf), Central Riverside Park (best in city), close in, close to high school.

notes: This area adjoining the packing house, railroad shop, stockyards, and flour mill district and is one made up entirely of small, ill-kept frame houses occupied by the low grade type of workers. Despite the shacky nature of the properties, there is good demand for it by the workers. This area contains the Mexican concentration of Wichita.
source: Mr. Nixon, H.O.L.C., Mr. Wright, Mr. Essex, Mr. McFall, real estate men.
name: WICHITA, KAN.
favor_influences: Schools, churches, etc.
detr_influences: Packing house on east end, railroad, etc. While these are unfavorable factors from one angle, it is the workers in the adjoining plants that make the district as to saleability rentability, etc. Sewers are inadequate in area.

notes: This area is known as "Riverside".  For many years this and College Hill have been the choice residential sections.  Riverside is highly desirable, despite its age, because of its location near two parks, but more particularly because of the scenic setting and atmospheric relief afforded by Arkansas River.  It compares as to desirability with B1, although a little older than B1.  Properties fronting on the river are considered the choicest in the city and sell for as high as $15,000 despite their age.  The eastern portion of the area needs some rehabilitation.  The western part is newer and more up-to-date.  A substantial class of people, including some of Wichita's leading families, live in this area.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Brady, Mr. Baurle, Mr. Smith, Mr. Wiegand.
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Sim Park (golf), Central Riverside Park (largest and best in city), Arkansas river (affording coolness and scenic beauty), and traditionally a high class area
detr_influences: Some termite trouble in west end.  Section is aging.
build_type: Western part - 1 family, 1 sty.  East - 1-family, 2 sty.
build_constr: Frame, brick, stucco in order named

notes: This area is kown as the "retired farmers section" of Wichita, because of the preference farmers have shown for it.  Most of its houses are the alrge two-story type. Real estate men report good sale ability, but state that it is poor from a lending standpoint.  Special improvement taxes were paid out years ago.  It is a very good rent area.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brady, Mr. Chester, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, Mr. Brewer, real estate men
name: Wichita, Kan
favor_influences: Schools, churches, stores, utilities, etc.
detr_influences: Aging and rapidly declining, surrounded by fourth grade areas.

notes: The western one-half of this area is scattered with good modest houses and many gardens. Local institutions will lend therein. The eastern part is much older and poorly kept up. There is some sales activity in the western portion. This is part of the west-end concentration of retired farmers.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Brewer, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, Mr. Chester, Mr. Brady, real estate men.
name: WICHITA, KAN.
favor_influences: Sim Park, business district of West Douglas, suburban atmosphere in western part.
detr_influences: Industrial and wholesale district near east end, business and industrial encroachment, railroad.

notes: The portion of this area surrounding C-6 for two and three blocks on the north, east, and south is part of the west end concentration of retired farmers. The outlying parts are inhabited by workers, with small frame houses, many poorly kept, predominating. There is some sales demand, better than most of the other "D" areas of the city, and a good rental demand. there is a little building of small frame houses (see pictures) in the east end.
source: Mr. Nixon, HOLC, Mr. Chester, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, Mr. Brady, Mr. McFall, real estate men.
name: WICHITA, KAN.
favor_influences: School facilities, utilities, etc.
detr_influences: Railroad shops, city and county shops, county farm and city work house all nearby.
inhab_type: R.R. shop workers, laborers, clerical, retired

notes: This area is one of scattered small frame shacks, occupied by a poor class including shop workers, laborers, etc. The exception is the portion east of Elizabeth and north of Walker, which has respectable small homes. Considering the type of district the sales demand has been good, due largely to the proximity of the Santa Fe Shops.
source: Mr. Nixon, H.O.L.C., Mr. Brady, Mr. McFall, Mr. Chester, Mr. Lightner, Mr. Smith, real estate men.
name: WICHITA, KAN.
detr_influences: No sewers in western and southwestern portions, railroad shops, "squatters" on south-end are undesirable element, city work house on south.

notes: Development suspended during the depression, but the area is the probable recipient of the next favorable trend.

name: Battle Creek, Michigan

notes: Very old part of the city.
name: Battle Creek, Michigan

notes: A good substantial district.
name: Battle Creek, Michigan
desc_terrain: Flat. Lies within the city limits.

notes: Village of food factory workers.  Some R.R. shop employees.
name: Battle creek, Michigan
Battle Creek, Michigan
desc_terrain: Level. North end rolling. All lies inside the City limits.
favor_influences: Best people of the City.

notes: Community of Grand Trunk Railroad shop employees.

notes: Considerably less average age than most of the rest of the city. As a district, it is, if anything, showing a degree of improvement
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: Adjacent to industry. Thrifty class of people, very largely home-owners.
detr_influences: Far from center of city.
inhab_type: Native white; white collar adn laboring

notes: Small houses with intermingling of somewhat larger ones, practically all of great age and very poor stateof repair.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: None in particular.
detr_influences: Age and obsolescence.

notes: Only a very few houses to date, but there seems ample proof that it is the beginning of a desirable deevlopment.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: Near Junior College. Ample room for desirable development which seems to be the trend.
inhab_type: Native white; white collar and skilled mechanics

notes: A small collection of new and modern houses of attractive types. No record of sales because they were all built on order. No rentals.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: All city facilities. Convenience to Junior College, etc.
detr_influences: Small area limited by old and poorer surroundings.

notes: Physically this section should be given a D or fourth grade rating, as age and very poor condition of the great majority of the houses therein would not deserve anything better. However, next to the best sections A-1 and B-1, brokers report this is the most active in the city and properties most salable and on this account, only a third grade rating is given with this qualification.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: Convenient to business center, high school, Junior College, etc.
detr_influences: Great age and poor physical condition.
inhab_type: Native white; white collar and laboring class

notes: Among the least attractive portions of the city. Generally poor type of dwelling, of very substantial age.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: None in particular.
detr_influences: Age and obsolescence.

notes: The Dow chemical plant is now operating a unit in the extreme north-eastern section. This has brought a few people to the neighborhood. There is some talk of further expansion of this plant which may eventually be of additional benefit.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: Proximity to Dow Chemical Plant.
detr_influences: Age and obsolescence. Distance from center of city.

notes: Completely undesirable; known as the "Red Light District."

favor_influences: None.

notes: Almost the oldest part of the city. Settled originally because of closeness to river industry. This industry has now been replaced chiefly by Chevrolet.

favor_influences: Near large Chevrolet Plant.
detr_influences: Great age and obsolescence.

desirability: Static to down as to present structures.

favor_influences: fairly convenient to all facilities. Room for future development, but no trend apparent at present.
detr_influences: Bisected by the Michigan Central Railroad.

newconstr_type: Singles: frame, brick and stucco, at $4,000 to $12,000
notes: Portions of this suburban village might deserve a better rating in view of the amount of new building in recent years. However, reports indicate that re-sales are difficult to make indicating that the future trend is not clearly determined.
name: "Essexville" Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: Some degree of movement of good type population to this district.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities and distance from the city.

notes: Very old central section. Along CenterStreet are a number of very large frame mansions about 50 to 75 years old-- original residences of the city's wealthy. Some are still so occupied.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: Close to center of city.
detr_influences: Great age and obsolescence.

notes: Physically this area does not rate a second grade. The age and condition of its structures make it decidedly third class. With the exception of Section A-1 however, it is the popular residential neighborhood of the city, and the part where such properties are in greatest demand.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: All city facilities. Convenient to everything.
detr_influences: Substantial age and obsolescence.

name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: All city facilities. The one substantial area containing really modern homesof higher grade.
detr_influences: None

notes: It is possible that as demolition progresses, some new homes may be erected in lieu thereof.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: Convenient to all facilities. Stable type of population.
detr_influences: Great age and obsolescence.

notes: Almost 100 percent Polish and Polish descent; a very thrifty class with great pride of home ownership. In spite of very modest types of dwellings, properties and grounds are well maintained. Rentals are very few.
name: Bay City, Michigan
favor_influences: All city facilities. Stable population of home-owners.

notes: One of the earlier neighborhoods of the city; developed because of industries along the River, practically all of which are now closed. Facing Roosevelt Park on the south and west sides are about half a dozen comparatively new and modern housesotherwise the district is old and poor.
name: Bay City, Michigan
desc_terrain: South end. (Western portion along River). Level.
favor_influences: Adjacent to main highway.
detr_influences: Age and obsolescence.

notes: Labor commutes by automobile to and from Flint.
name: "Grand Blanc"- Flint, Mich

notes: Cheap construction. Laborers' homes.
name: "Whigville" Flint, Michigan

notes: Comparatively new section of cheap construction. Laborers' homes. Outside the city.
name: Flint, Michigan

notes: Cheap laborers' cottages. Some as small as two rooms. Easternmost three streets are outside the city limits.
name: Flint, Michigan

notes: Cheaply constructed laborers' cottages. Area is outside the city limits.

notes: At the southern extreme of the area, Nolen to Thomas St. there are homes at above $12,000. From Nolen to Frank St. there are homes worth from $7500 to $10,000. Along the south side of Welch Avenue from Lavender St. to Dupont, there are homes of $7500 to $12,000 values. Between Welch and Stockdale, from Chevrolet to Detroit there are $8,000 to $10,000 homes. Along both sides of Hamilton St. Forest Hill St. to Detroit, there are $8,000 to 10,000 homes. Practically this entire area of 3,200 houses was built by a subsidiary of general Motors to house Company employees. The HOLC has 70 mortgages taken from the General Motors subsidiary. Information from R.W Cross Housing Division of General motors Corporation.
name: Flint, Michigan

favor_influences: All city facilities, schools, etc. Restricted.

notes: This development which is of good type was retarded by lack of transportation and easy access to good schools. This is being improved by the new school and better bus service. There is a tendency for some of the more prosperous of Polish descent to move into this section.

notes: West of Walnut and south of Lincolnway contains some foreigners, chiefly Polish. Portion bounded by River, Bartlett, Williams and Madison includes many business men who want proximity to business. Contains zone classifications "A", "B" and "C". The higher value ranges are limited to this area as well as the top rentals which are largely theoretical since none of these were for rent.

notes: On Olive, from Western to Huron, also on Moore fromMOnroe to Fort and Kaley from Huron to Grace are 1 1/2 and 2-story modern brick single family houses somewhat above te avergae for the district. This is the best of the foreign sections. Western section sparsely settled with a small development bounded by Western Ave., Sheridan Ave., Ford and Gladstone, developed about 10 years ago. It is in soft ground and deteriorating rapidly.

Balance of this section is fairly new development ona more moderate scale.

notes: On all paved streets running north of Mishawaka Ave. from Ironwood and Logan for one block contains better type houses of fairly substantial age. The section bounded by Mishawaka, 30th, 34th and the R.R. is a development about 10 years old comprising approximately 500 houses of comparatively cheap construction. Those in the first block north of Mishawaka Ave. contain 6-rooms; those in the next block, 5-rooms; and from there to the R.R. 4-rooms. They were originally sold at prices ranging from $3,200 to $8,000, and at present are selling from about $2,500 to $5,000. Approximately 50 percent or 250 of them have become rental units through the foreclosure route or lapse of sales contract. The firm which originally promoted the development still has 85 of these houses which were taken back and has dosposed of 10 in recent months.

favor_influences: Near Nakoma Plat. Good roads to city.
detr_influences: No city conveniences.

notes: Stone and brick houses predominate. Called Nakoma Plat. Led city in building last year and also this year. Property is considered good investment in this area, values have held up well, and future development will be very good. This plat was excellently managed. Paul E. Stark Company promoted the sales program of this plat. Substantial growth here. The Nakoma School is shown as situated in center of area.
source: J. H. Ottow. HOLC Loan Service Dept., 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Restricted, good schools, good transportation, now making Aboretum Park and wild game preserve to the east adjacent to Nakoma Country Club. Excellent view of property.
detr_influences: Main State and National highway runs through center of area. Southern part sloping to low.

notes: Has all necessary utilities and very desirable place to live.
source: J. H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. In mortgage business in Madison for 15 years. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: North edge of Nakoma and has all advantages of Nakoma. Restricted.
detr_influences: Adjoins low-priced plat to northeast - C3.

notes: That portion of area west of Western is outside city limits. Adjacency to Nakoma is desirable.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Good transportation, schools. The elementary school is situated on Monroe between Western and Gilmore.
detr_influences: Railroad to north and main arterial on Monroe Street.

notes: Outside city limits. Restricted. Plat is well located for future medium priced homes.
source: J. H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Adjacent to Westmoreland Golf Club and Municipal Golf Course.
detr_influences: Only about 25% developed, but future is good.

notes: Outside city limits. Convenient to city, fair transportation, fair as to schools. There is a quarry on the west but not considered detrimental.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: On south and west sides, the Frank W. Hoyt Public Park; and city reservoir and park. There is an elementary school on the northwest corner of Regent Street and Parker Drive.
detr_influences: No restrictions.

notes: Close to Municipal Golf Course and to The Edgewood, an excellent parochial academy. A desirable area in which to reside.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in the mortgage business in Madison Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has all modern conveniences.
detr_influences: Railroad on north

notes: Some apartments on Kendall and University also Allen Street- frame and brick, 3-6 rooms of 2-6 units. Surrounding A3 on south and east sides are some apartments and duplexes- well kept up. The northwest side of area is newer, i.e. from Allen Street west, the biggest development having occurred during the past 10-12 years in that section south of A3. An elementary school is located on Regent between Roby and Spooner, and a high school is located between Highland Avenue and Ash on Regent.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison Resident of Madison for 35 years
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Comparatively new section. Good transportation, schools, has every convenience.
detr_influences: Cemetery to northwest and west detrimental to lots adjacent thereto, although well separated with shrubs, etc.
build_type: 1-2 1/2 stories, single 5-10 rms and few apts on Monroe St.

notes: This is the southwest portion of Shorewood Hills and at bottom of hill. Has all modern conveniences and is a desirable community in which to reside. Outside city limits.
source: J. H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept., 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Adjacent to A1 and main thoroughfare to city.
detr_influences: Railroad running along southern boundary.

notes: Outside city limits. Cheap plat for low-priced homes. Proximity to Shorewood Hills regarded as favorable by those living in this area.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: On main arterial highway into city.
detr_influences: Railroad on north. Situated at foot of Shorewood Hills. Cheap plat.

notes: Outside city limits. Organized as a village community a few years ago and more interest in beautifying the tract is evidenced since then. It is known as Village of Shorewood Hills. The topography us excellent for a beautiful residential district. Near University of Wisconsin. Good growth and substantial community.
source: John H. Ottow. HOLC Loan Service Dept., 15 years in mortgage business in Madison, Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Outside city limits. Organized as a village community a few years ago and more interest in beautifying the tract is evidenced since then. It is known as Village of Shorewood Hills. The topography is excellent for a beautiful residential district. Near University of Wisconsin. Good growth and substantial community.
favor_influences: Adjacent to Lake Mendota, good school, good transportation, all improvements, restricted area, near Blackhawk Country Club Golf Course.
detr_influences: Narrow roads.

notes: Plat of University Heights. This is considered a very desirable place to reside for executives and others connected with the University of Wisconsin and will always have a good market value. There is, however, a tendency for fraternity houses and apartments to enter the area, but land values will always be good as the University anchors values here.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Adjacent to University of Wisconsin, every community convenience.
detr_influences: Some of hills in winter are not so well regarded and some object to tendency of sororities and fraternities to locate in area.
build_type: Single 6 rooms & up, duplexes and apartments

notes: One of the oldest areas on west side, developing on northwest edge into apartment for which there is a demand due to proximity to University. The Edgewood Academy, a Catholic school, is located on the west and is considered a favorable influence as is Vilas Park, a public park and see located in the south.
source: J. H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. In mortgage business in Madison for 15 years. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has every community convenience. Close to University of Wisconsin.
detr_influences: None

notes: Apartments are scattered throughout area- mainly frame. There is one large brick apartment of 25-30 units on the corner of Meund and Adams Streets. One of the older sections on southwest side. The elementary school is located on Hound Street between Mills and Breck Street.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: All modern utilities, transportation, churches, schools, etc.
detr_influences: Business and industry to east and bordering on foreign and negro section in area D2.
build_type: 1-2 stories, single 5-7 rooms, and apts of 2-6 units

notes: Most troublesome area in city. Predominating foreign population of Madison. Many Sicilians live in this area and are reputed as meeting their obligations fairly satisfactorily. The Italians resent being called Sicilians.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Near center of city.
detr_influences: Business, railroads, and industry.

notes: Apartments contain from 2 to 30 units with 3-6 rooms. Rooming houses and apartments predominate in northwest portion of area near the University and business center of city. East side from Bleunt Street is primarily home section. State Capitol Building is in center and University of Wisconsin at west end of area. There is a high school on Johnson between Wisconsin and Carroll.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has all conveniences. An elementary school is located on Johnson between Brooks and Park. Another school is located on Johnson between Broom and Henry and another is south of Tenny Park on Johnson between Dickinson and Thornton.
detr_influences: Older section of city- on down grade.

notes: Some apartments and rooming houses in eastern part of area. The western section of area on Monona Bay is primarily homes, faces Brittingham Park, and is newer than the eastern section. The east side is one of the oldest sections of the city and is rapidly going into apartments, rooming houses and industries. An elementary school is located on west Wilson between Broom and Henry.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Near center of city and Monona Lake and Monona Bay. Southwest part adjoins Brittingham Park.
detr_influences: Near industrial section, railroad yards and lines.

notes: That section bounded by Mifflin and Dayton, Blair and Patterson is primarily a negro section. That section bounded by Franklin an Blair, East Washington Avenue and Wilson Street is old but somewhat better class than other groups in this area with a few apartments. Area on Mifflin from Brearly Street east is a better section than the negro section. However, all sections of this area are poor.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has all conveniences.
detr_influences: Negroes. Proximity to business section

notes: Surrounded by industry and business.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has conveniences.
detr_influences: Railroads and industrial section.

notes: Two railroads traverse this area, but it is a more desirable place to live than C10. The business men in this section of Madison are extremely active in promoting and interests of East Madison and considerable friendly rivalry exists between East and West Madison.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in Mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: All conveniences. An elementary school is located on Rusk between Linden and Bashford. Another school is located on Atwood between Maple Avenue and Ludington.
detr_influences: Between industrial and business section of the east side.

notes: Washington Avenue is main arterial to city center. Some apartments scattered along east Washington Avenue of 2 to 4 units containing 3 to 5 rooms. Will remain a good area for many years for those engaged in industry. Due to the stabilizing effect and influence of the University of Wisconsin and the State Capital, the tendency of laborers and mechanics has been to buy properties probably beyond their means and endeavor to keep up with the west end of the city. Values thus are higher than they otherwise might be when compared with similar industrial areas in other cities. Resales are to this extent retarded.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: All conveniences. An elementary school is located on Johnson Street between 6th and 7th Streets, and a high school is on Washington between 4th and 5th Streets.
detr_influences: Center of east side industrial and business section. The Oscar Mayer and Company packing plant is located on Mayer Avenue in northeastern portion of area.

notes: Section of area west of North Street is more fully populated and has better type of dwellings. The section northeast of Mayer and Commercial Avenue is sparsely settled, of cheaper construction, and has a poorer class of citizens.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has conveniences. North side adjoins Madison Airport.
detr_influences: None

notes: That portion east of Daley Drive is outside city limits. The northwest portion inside the city limits is somewhat better in construction and in density of population.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in Mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has utility conveniences. There is a proposed elementary school northwest of Radke between Furey and Miller.
detr_influences: Not convenient to schools.

notes: South of Sugar Avenue is a public playground.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has all utility conveniences.
detr_influences: Adjacent to industry on east. Not convenient to schools.

notes: West end, from Schurs Avenue to Yahaba River, is filled-in land from lake. Better residential section of east Madison. Very popular place to reside.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Lake Monona, good schools, transportation, etc.
detr_influences: Some odor from lake at times.

notes: Outside city limits. Located across from Quaker Oats Experimental Farms, near Lake Monona, and is known as Morningside Heights. This is a cheap residential plat ranging from shacks to fairly decent homes. However, the future is promising and this area may be regarded as a border-line between 3rd and 4th grade. West, along Lake Monona shores, there are several fine homes.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Good schools and transportation.
detr_influences: No modern conveniences.

source: J. D. Carneal
name: Richmond, Virginia

notes: Outside city limits. Known as Morningside Heights. Close to Lake Edge Park. This section is improving and if inside city limits would be considered second grade. There are some fine homes, well kept up, in this area.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Close to Lake Monona, on main arterial highway, good school.
detr_influences: Lacks city conveniences.

notes: Outside city limits. Good elevation--facing east and south. Good roads.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: On main highway leading to center of city.
detr_influences: Lacks city conveniences.

notes: Better class of dwellings-facing on Sherman Avenue- close to industry. Outside city limits. City of Madison sewerage disposal plant is to southeast.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: On direct route to city. Near Maple Bluff Golf Course and excellent school.
detr_influences: Not restricted.

notes: Known as Village of Maple Bluff and Fuller Woods Plat and also as the Gold Coast of Madison. The lots along the lake shore have greatest value and lots east of this drop in value due to topography of land to east which is level and somewhat low, especially in original plat of Lakewood. All lots, however, are well drained. The Maple Bluff Plat and Fuller Woods Plat, southwest are newer plats. They have much natural beauty and developed at a better rate. This area outside city limits.
source: J. H. Ottow, HOLC Laon Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: The only first-class plat adjoining city where center of city can be reached without crossing a railway. Good schools, restricted, adjoins oldest golf course, The Maple Bluff Golf Club, overlooks lake shore.
detr_influences: If east wind prevails, odors from sewage disposal plant and Mayer Packing Plant to east in C-10 are noticeable. However, this is being remedied. The round house of the Chicago and Northwestern Railroad is to the east at Commercial Avenue and smoke sometimes drifts over the area.

notes: One of the older sections of city. Scattered along main streets are some apartments from 2 to 15 units of 3 to 6 rooms, brick and frame construction. Due to proximity to lake, it is a desirable area to live in. The southeast portion of area is of newer construction--approximately 10 to 12 years. The northeast section is reserved for schools. An elementary school is located on Jenifer Street between Brearly and Ingersell Street, another school is on Williamson between Few and Baldwin.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in the morgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: On Lake Monona and City Park at southwest end. Has all utilities.
detr_influences: Odor from lake in summer, which is being gradually eliminated; industry and railroads in northern section.

notes: Mixed apartments and homes (homes predominate). One of the older sections of the city. A desirable place to live. Close to center business section. The east section of area adjoins Tenney Park. An elementary school is located on Gorham Street between Blount and Livingston Street.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Adjacent to Lake Mendota. Has all modern conveniences.
detr_influences: None

notes: Near center of city, excellent view of lake, boating, swimming. Mendota is the best of the 4 lakes and commands best frontal prices.
source: J. H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept., 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Lake shore; good roads, schools, and transportation.
detr_influences: Main highway to south and west.

notes: Outside city limits. Near public golf course to south. Dwellings near golf course and/west side of Oregon Road are of better class, but on a whole the area is a cheap plat.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: On direct route to city. Transportation OK
detr_influences: Lacks modern utility conveniences.

notes: Lack direct approach to city, must go around Monona Bay. An elementary school is located on Potter Street Between Rowell and Lake Street.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison. Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Near Olin Park and east side of area is on the shore of Lake Monona. Has all conveniences.
detr_influences: None

notes: Close to downtown center. Have to cross arterial streets and railroad to get to schools.
source: J.H. Ottow, HOLC Loan Service Dept. 15 years in mortgage business in Madison, Resident of Madison for 35 years.
name: Madison, Wisconsin
favor_influences: Has all utilities, excellent view of city proper, and is adjacent to Bay of Lake Monona.
detr_influences: Railroad to east and business section on west.

source: J. D. Carneal
name: Richmond, Virginia

notes: Cheap subdivision developemtns west and south-west of Indianapolis. A moderate number of good type homes scattered thru area on which local institutions will lend.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Mars Hill and Surrounding territory
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities. Poor transportation. Cheap class of property and citizens.

notes: Outlying section of better class laboring and mechanic type occupancy, desiring newer design of small house. Business development, most of inferior class, along Washington (National Road) Several cheap additions, but many fairly good houses in this section.
name: Indianapolis National & Rockville Road Suburban Section.
favor_influences: Section of moderate priced houses, not far from the City Center
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities. Poor transportation. Passing thru blighted area on way to City Center.

notes: A small section not greatly affected by the depression in which prices remained very stable adn will continue to improve as city facilities in this section are bettered. Building combination single house and bungalow types.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Speedway City
favor_influences: Small suburban town, incorporated. Near manufacturing plants.
detr_influences: Lack of proper sewage system. This is being corrected by new sewer. Limited school facilities also, which are being being corrected by additional building.

notes: Section immediately around Rhodious Park developed with some newer type bungalows. Section along Blaine from McCarthy and Morris and on th other streets west to Belmont and south Howard are best parts of this section, partially developed with newer type houses. Majority are home owners. Other sections affected by very low class native whites. Section from Howard to Minnesota and from Richmond to Hiatt - negro.
name: INDIANAPOLIS West Indianapolis
favor_influences: Close to factories for working people
detr_influences: RR yards, Stockyards, Factories. West part affected by overflow water from Eagle Creek
inhab_type: Native white - Laboring and white collar classes

notes: Local institutions will lend on moderate riced residences in northern section and along Warman Avenue.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Mr. Jackson & Haughville
favor_influences: Catholic churhc and school on Warman Avenue.
detr_influences: State Insane Hospital -- Factories, RR tracks and switching yards.

notes: South portion: older type, rentable and salable to better laboring class. North and west portion: newer type with foreign classes and their descendants employed as mechanics in shops and with RRs. Good demand for sale and rental when factories are operating.
name: Indianaplis Haughville Section
favor_influences: Proximity to RR yards and factories where most people in this district are employed.
detr_influences: In center portion of district, older type of houses. Northern portion lacks good transportation.

notes: Cheap subdivision. Oversold in very small lots.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Rainbow Ridge
favor_influences: Near local employment and speedway.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities. Cheap construction. Small lots.

notes: Section occupied by RR and shop men and mechanics. New High School (one only in the west side of the city) creates demand for sales and rentals in this section.
name: Indianapolis Mount Jackson
favor_influences: Proximity to new High School, near RR shops and yards and factory districts.
detr_influences: Surrounding cheap territory; State Insane Hospital to the west. Grade crossing of RR and blighted district on way to City Center.

notes: Section north of 10th and section on Elder, Lynn and Traub north of Michigan: greater part negro, balance low standard whites.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Strigntown & Haughville
detr_influences: Age. RR Yards. Factories

notes: North portion from Blake to Lacke and north to Indiana recently completed low-cost apartments for negroes. There is possibility that balance of this territory west of Blake and north of Michigan may be taken over by City, County and state for development as Park, overlooking hospital development on the west.
name: INDIANAPOLIS  Military Park
detr_influences: Blighted Area

notes: A very spotty section. Some parts in particular near Creeks and rolling land --  developed into large estates with prospect of continuing development of such types. Along Michigan Road a number of cheap subdivisions with non-modern type houses on average to large lots. Section west of Braodmoor Ave -- attempted development along new Blvd. which failed, -- somehwat over developed -- consdierable time for an active demand in this particular section. Small section called "Spring Hills, Inc." is subdivision on high land above the River, north of Ricerside Park -- an attempted likewise section in which several years ago an amount of extreme wealthy attempted to devlop into large estates, building houses from 150,000 to 300,000 with no demand for such types today. Immediately west of Riverside Park is abuilt-up section with some good and some cheaper type houses.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Michigan Road - Northwest Suburban
desc_terrain: Level to rolling, with hilly land along the River and Creek.
favor_influences: Number of estates develoepd particularly along Eagle Creek branches in the extreme northwest
detr_influences: Number of cheaper type subdivisions devleoped; lack of city facilities; lack of transportation
build_constr: Frame and Br Veneer from large Bungalows

notes: Attractive location for property known as "small estates," yet not far from city center.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Golden Hill
desc_terrain: Level to rolling. Small restricted section known as "Golden Hill"
favor_influences: Small restricted section of large lots and small estate tracts
detr_influences: Cheap section south. Cemetery to east.

name: Close-in Southeast Indianapolis
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Very old -- Numerous factories.
inhab_type: Native wthie - Laboring and Mechanic classes

notes: Small large-estate section. Particularly popular to a certain social group. Generally find buyer available if the present owner must sell.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Woodstock - Shooters Hill
favor_influences: Small section of high land overlooking White River. Developed into medium to large estates.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities, also transportation.

notes: Narrow strip - 42nd to 43rd Sts. from Boulevard Place west: solid white section but affected by several negro families in section south of 42nd St. From Maple Road to 42nd St. a number of negro families of the better type the majority is a white neighborhood. "East: Crown Hill and 32nd St. to Maple Road and Salem Street West, a number of older type homes. Several apartments on west side, particularly Boulevard Place -- in which a few negro families reside.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Crown Hill
favor_influences: Near good section of the City and Schools
detr_influences: Near cemetery. Several older type houses. Number of negro families of better grade.

notes: West of Illinois Street: Influenced by Butler University. 42nd & Central: New Catholic Church and School where such families with good incomes desire their children to attend grade schools. Other section north of this, newer type houses, mostly brick veneer, built within last ten years.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Northern Section
favor_influences: Site of Butler University in west portion. All city facilities.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Native white; executive and other white-collar type

notes: Section along Meridian Street: to large high class apartments. Along 28th, trend is to business and apartments. Extreme east section, along both sides of Winthrop Avenue, affected by Monon RR tracks. Along Pennsylvania Street and north of 38th: large older type good homes. Small section in extreme north east: cheaper type bungalows and some older type frame houses.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Northern
favor_influences: South portion near best High school. good schools -- Churches of all denominations. Transportation excellent. All sections enjoy all city facilities.
detr_influences: South portion: number of two-family houses and four to sixteen family apartments. Section along east edge near Monon RR tracks.
build_constr: Frame & Br. Veneer singles, duplexes; Br. Apartments

notes: In section from 19th to 22nd Sts and from west side of Delaware to west side of Central Ave known as "Martin's Place" - large older type well built residences, some converted into apartments and 2-fam. units, still in good rental and fair sales demand. Section from 22nd st. north to Fall Creek and from west side of park to east side of Broadway, large older type houses of fairly good construction, good rental and fair sale. Section north of Fall Creek from Penn St. east to College older type single family and 2-fam. units, still desirable rental, with fair sales demand. Section east of Fall Creek, north of 28th St. mixed 1 & 2 Fam. units, fair rental section, but very poor sales. SEction along Illinois St. -- mixed with old type one-two fam. singles, business property and apartments, fair rental but very poor sale. Balance of section mixed with large old, fine residences, to cheap older type frames, declining, except for possible development of apartments on Delaware, Pennsylvania, Central, Park and Broadway.
name: INDIANAPOLIS North Central
favor_influences: Near good schools and churches of all denominations. Short distance from City Center.
detr_influences: Older type houses. some very large -- used for rooming house purposes

notes: Blighted Area
name: INDIANAPOLIS
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Age. Almost solid negro. Industrial

desirability: Generally down except for better negro portion.
notes: North of 24th St. to 29th and from west side of Capitol Ave. to Clifton (except for small section south of Roache) and west of Northwestern Ave -- a former good whtie section in whcih better class negroes now reside. However, there still remain a number of white families scattered thru this district. South of 25th, east of Northwestern and south of Roache, west of Northwestern, --  older and cheaper negro houses. Section along 29th and 30th: white neighborhood affected by negro infiltration. Section along Grayson Avenue-Capitol Avenue, also affected by negro infiltration. Section along Kenwood and Illinois -- are larger 1-2 fam. old houses occupied by lower class whites and are used partly for rooming houses. Local lending institutions will lend mortgage money to negroes of better class. Extreme northeast section is a small addition built up of very cheap houses across from Crown Hill Cemetery.
name: INDIANAPOLIS North Indianapolis
favor_influences: Portion is desirable residential neighborhood for better class negroes.
detr_influences: Age and inhabitants

notes: South portion: majority white. North portion: East of Harding -- decided infiltration of negroes. Local institutions will make loans on better class properties in this section.
name: INDIANAPOLIS West of Fall Creek (Riverside)
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Poor transportation, thru blighted area to City Center. RR tracks.

notes: Section along Bellefountaine, Guilford and Winthrop, south of 22nd now 80% of negro. Extreme north section along McPherson-white section, mostly rentals. Number of these houses have been remodelend into cheap small apartments.
name: Indianapolis Older North East Section
favor_influences: Good Transportation
detr_influences: Very old type houses becoming occupied on the east portion by negroes. New RR tracks and switching yards.

notes: South and center portion older white neighborhood now occupied 100% by negroes. East portion cheap to fair newer type houses. Section around Douglas Park and north of 30th -- better class negroes
name: Indianapolis Northeast (negro)
favor_influences: Negro Park and Municipal Golf Course.
detr_influences: Older type houses. RR tracks and factories. Part of section occupied by lower type negroes.

notes: Very old section. Alleys occupied by negroes. Some factories scattered thru the district.
name: Indianapolis Northeast Central
favor_influences: Near center of city
detr_influences: Very old. Some remodeled into cheap apartments and rooming houses. Part is factory district.

notes: Extreme north section: negroes. Center portion: poor sale but fair rental-- near car barns and high school. South portion: large older type houses. In an old Catholic Parish
name: Indianapolis Old section near Arsenal High School.
favor_influences: Arsenal Techincal High School. Good Transportation. Large Catholic Church in south portion.
detr_influences: Very old type houses. Factories and RR tracks.

notes: Section known as "Woodruff Place" small incorporated town. Enjoys all city facilities and police protection. This section at one time was high class residential, now being remodeled into small apartmetns and very desirable rental for that class. Section: east side of Randolph and east side of Hendrick place,-- development about 20 years old of good type singles and two family units. Good rental and fair sales. Other parts, older types and somewhat depreciated.
name: Indianapolis Woodruff Place and surrounding territory
favor_influences: Number of schools and churches. Good transportation-short distance-to City Center.
detr_influences: Older type houses. Number of 2-family units. Women's Prison affects rent and sales on Randolph and Hamilton Avenue from New York to Michigan only.

notes: This section good because of desire of families of depcreciated sections to move into this part of City particularly because of High School and Church influence.
name: INDIANAPOLIS St. PHILLIPS
favor_influences: Largest Catholic Parish. Close to good Public High School.
detr_influences: Several older type houses, but mixed with majority of better type.

notes: Best residential section: from Oxford St. east to east side of Tuxedo and along south side to Brookside Parkway. Several newer type houses mixed with some of the older types; very good rental; fair saoles section; however, an over development along both sides of Brookside Park. Extreme west and northwest: older type houses; only fair rental and sales.
name: Indianapolis Brookside Park
favor_influences: Large well developed city park and parkways along small creek. Number of grade schools and Protestant Churches.
detr_influences: Except fro 10th Street, -- poor transportation. Number of older type houses particularly in west end. Extreme northwest side borders on colored section.

notes: Small section, eastern part of city, with many old and new type houses. Always has been fair rental, but slow sale. Affected by RR tracks.
name: Indianapolis East Section near Belt RR
detr_influences: Near RR switching tracks; coal and lumber yards.
inhab_type: Native white- Laboring and white collar

notes: Section from Michigan to 10th Street on Denny and Chester and part of Grant Street, sales and rent very active. These are the three very desirable streets in this section. Section from Washington to Michigan; older type, cottages, singles and doubles; fair sale and good rental. Extreme north section: Number of cheaply built, though quite modern, homes.
name: Indianapolis Tuxedo Park and Section north
favor_influences: Good transportation, except in north section. Varied number of schools and churches.
detr_influences: Proximity to Belt RR tracks. Some small factories along said tracks. Number of older type houses from Washington to Michigan. Number of cheaper class properties in extreme north section.

notes: Small section built around new Catholic Church and School. Very desirable to young couples of ordinary means.
name: INDIANAPOLIS - Little Flower
favor_influences: Near new Catholic Church and School; also good grade school and Protestant Churches.
detr_influences: Poor transportation -- bus service to downtown

notes: Best residential section east part of Indianapolis. Section along Pleasant Run Parkway, east of Emerson Avenue, developed with good type frame and brick veneer singels from new to 20 years old. All well kept. Section from Ritter east and south of 10th -- developed with frame and brick veneer bungalows and singels, from new to 15 years old. Section from 10th north of 12th Street and from Emerson Avenue to and including Hawthorne Lane, newer type frame and brick veneer bungalows. Section along north side of 10th Arlington -- not built up but next in line for eastern section of City. Section from west side of Kenmore Road to Edmondson and from Washington Street to south line of Shelby St. -- brick veneer and frame bungalows and singles. West part of which is built up nearly 100% and east part being devloped. Section east of Emerson to Pleasant Run Boulevard and from Michigan St. north to said Boulevard, 100% built up, good type frame and brick veneer singesl and bungalows from 8 to 18 years old. A very excellent sale section.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Irvington
desc_terrain: Eastern part of the City -- mostly level lots and streets
favor_influences: Boulevard along creek. All city facilities. Near public park. Newer development of good type house, fairly well restricted.
detr_influences: Section along 10th Street -- trasnportation not good and far from Schools; "Hower" School is to be built in this Section. Other parts excellent transportation and school facilities.

notes: Small section west of Emerson between RR tracks, very poor sale and rental. Section east end of Irvington, south of Washington on Webster, Cutherwood and Sheridan, negro. Also scattered along east side Arlington Avenue. Greenfield Ave. extreme south end of Ritter and east part of Burgess Avenue, also scattered negro. Section north of Minnesota on both ways from Emerson, built up chiefly with non-modern cheap houses
name: Indianapolis So. Irvington & Adjoining Territory.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities and transportation in most parts. Bordering on RR tracks.
inhab_type: Native white- Laboring and white- collar clerical

notes: Good old section of Irvington. A former very good residential suburb. Older -- but good single houses mixed with two-family doubles more recently constructed. Along Washington Street: apartments, business and family units.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Irvington
favor_influences: Older but good section of former fine residential section of Irvington. New stores, churches and schools.
detr_influences: Several large older type houses.

notes: Section developed with small semi-modern and modern type houses-- section only partially developed, bordered by good and cheaper sections. Considerable spotty possible development along Madison Avenue not of good type which affects the entire neighborhood.
name: Indianapolis Madison Avenue Suburban
favor_influences: Close to City Center
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities in most of territory. Poor transportation. RR grade crossing at Madison Avenue on way to reach City Center.

notes: Four negro sections: one west from Sherman Drive and south of Prospect-- heavy. Extreme west end from Lawton to Calhoun, Shelly to Draper. From Keystone to St. Paul, north of Woodlawn and along Pleasant Street-- scattered. East of Keystone to Perkins from Reformers Avenue to RR tracks -- heavy. Section bordering Southeastern Avenue from Trowbridge east to LaSalle -- mortgage money for home purchase available from local institutions.
name: Indianapolis Southeast Section
favor_influences: Near factories and shops for laboring and mechanic classes.
detr_influences: Lack of transportation in most part. Near RR tracks

notes: A very old section. Spotted with factories. Tax Assesments
name: Indianapolis Close-in Southeast
favor_influences: Near Center of City. Factories for working classes.
detr_influences: Very old houses. RR switching yards and industry

notes: Section occupied by mechanics and white collar type and also business men having stores within a short distance. Desirable section also for laboring and RR type of employee. In extreme southeast section number of newer type modern small bungalows.
name: Indianapolis Section East of Fountain Square
favor_influences: Short distance to City Center. Number of Churches: several Protestant--2 Lutheran and schools, and one Catholic and school.
detr_influences: Older type houses

notes: Old but good section. Nearly all home owners of German Lutheran type, desiring to be near to their Churches and Schools.
name: INDIANAPOLIS German Lutheran Section
favor_influences: Number of older German Type citizens near Lutheran Churches and Schools.
detr_influences: Older type houses; bordered by cheaper old class -- thru very old part of city to City Center

notes: North portion: Number of German Catholic families willing to maintain residences near large Catholic Church. South portion: Somewhat improved by development of Boulevard at Pleasant Run and elevation of Belt RR at Meridian Street recently completed.
name: Indianapolis South Side Section
favor_influences: North portion, large German Catholic Church. South portion, number of newer type houses. Good school and Protestant Churches.
detr_influences: North section: older type houses. South section: factories along belt RR and grade crossing of two RR tracks.

desirability: Will remain good for several years
notes: Section of south of Southern Avenue, newer type frame and brick veneer singles and bungalows in demand. Mechanics to white-collar type. Section east of Garfield Park to Shelby Street, and south of Raymond is beste residential section of South Side. Neighborhood business and professional men. Section east of Shelby Street around Catholic Church. Mostly mechanics. In thru this part are scattered about ten negro families -- better class, all home owners. West of Garfield Park not fully built up being developed with frame and semi-modern and modern bungalows -- mechanics and white collar type occupancy.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Garfield Park Section
favor_influences: Near Large Park. Good Transportation. Good grade of schools. Several Protestant and one Catholic Church and School.
detr_influences: Bordered by cheaper and older sections. Grade crossing - RR Tracks - to city Center.

name: INDIANAPOLIS Older part of South Side
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Very old especially in northern portion. Factories and RR tracks. Cheap construction in southern portion.

notes: Section developed mostly by gardeners with vegetable and flower greenhouses. Above sales and rental ranges do not include greenhouses which represent additional investments of from $7000 to $25000. The low grade additions in the area are shown in RED. Section west of the I.C. RR. : low and subject to high water
name: Indianapolis Bluff Road
favor_influences: Fairly close-in section from truck gardens and greenhouses.
detr_influences: Poor transportation and lack of city facilities. Cheap additions developed in this area.

notes: Section being developed by younger citizens of German descent, will greatly improve during the next several years. Large lots to acreage tracts. Number of truck green houses scattered thruout the section
name: INDIANAPOLIS St. Rock German Catholic Church Section
favor_influences: New German-Catholic Church and School (Branch of large old German -Catholic Parish) Not far from City Center
detr_influences: Lack of city facililties and improved streets

notes: Influence of Garfield Park, Churches, etc. in this section creates a good demand for mechanic and laboring classes, as well as lower bracket of white-collar class.
name: Indianapolis Garfield Park
favor_influences: Large city Park. Number of Protestant Churches. One Catholic Church and School.
detr_influences: Distance from transportation in east portion and several negro families. In west portion, several oldertype houses.

notes: Section developed in teh cheap-to-fair houses. Desirable for laboring classes.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Adjoining Garfield Park
favor_influences: Near city Park and factories. Fairly good transportation.
detr_influences: Older type houses. Near RR tracks.
inhab_type: Native White - Laboring and white collar

notes: Section developed with cheap to fair type houses on small lots to acre tracts for mechanic and laboring classes. Golf course shown on plat has no influences on the section.
name: Indianapolis Churchman Avenue and outlying sections.
favor_influences: Proximity to RR shops at Beech Grove-- near factory district in southeast Indianapolis.
detr_influences: Lack of complete city facilities in most of this territory. Poor transportation.

desirability: Static -- depending no employment in RR shops
notes: Best part of RR shop district. Excellent rental and sale section of small houses when RR shops are in operation.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Beech Grove - Incorporated
desc_terrain: Flat terrain. Contiguous to Indianapolis on the south. Inhabited chiefly by employees of CCC, St. Louis RR shops.
favor_influences: Convenience to emplyment in RR shops
detr_influences: One industry

notes: East part of Beech Grove, older type non-modern houses close to RR shops. Other part of this section, sparsely built up with cheap to fair type single family homes. Morgage money is available in this territory from local institutions.
name: Indianapolis Beech Grove
favor_influences: Adjacence to Big Four RR shops
detr_influences: Poor transportation. Lack of city facilities in most parts.

notes: College will develop some, and increase demand. Streets will be improved and grade school facilities bettered.
name: INDIANAPOLIS UNIVERSITY HEIGHTS
favor_influences: Small section near small College (Indiana Central) at southern edge of the city.
detr_influences: Unimproved streets - distance to grade and high school. RR Tracks.

notes: Section not far out, where working men and mechanics can have small additional ground for gardening purposes in additon to homes. A number of very good frame and brick veneer homes in this section. Most purchasers buy or build non-modern homes and imporve and modernize as finances permit.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Edgewood-Southport
favor_influences: Suburban section not far from city center. Good transportation.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities --  number of cheaper type houses. Few restrictions in most additions.

notes: This territory developed from cehap houses to good small estates. In a number of cases-over-development.
name: Indianapolis Old Shelbyville Road Southeast
favor_influences: Fairly close in suburban development
detr_influences: Lack of transportation and city facilities

notes: Five Points: German Luteran settlement, with church and school, except for cheap addition immediately to the east which is being poorly developed because of lack of drainage. Southeastern Avenue: developed with cheap frame to good brick veneer singles. Large tracts, mostly un-platted.
