Section Emerson Avenue: semi-modern and modern bungalows; one-half to acre tracts unplatted. In this section a number of employees of Beech Grove Big 4 RR repair shops. live.
name: Indianapolis Suburban Southeast Michigan Road
favor_influences: Proximity to Beech Grove Big 4 RR shops. Extreme southeast to Five Points, lots and tracts sufficient for gardening purposes. Luthern section with Church and School.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities; transportation; number of cheap additions developed in and near this section.

notes: Warren Park is a small separate Corporation. Development along Shadeland will be helped materially by extensions of Pleasant Run Boulevard following Pleasant Run to Shadeland AVenue adn north on Shadeland Avenue to connect with Kessler Boulevard-- part of this is now under construction. Neighborhing territory partly developed.
name: Indianapolis Warren Park and Shadenland Drive Section
favor_influences: Small suburban section, north and east of Irvington section of Indianpolis.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities and distance from City Center. Part of community is developed with cheap type of houses.

notes: Somewhat better than D-4 because of newer type of non-modern homes from laboring class of people. A small section frome ast side of Wallace to west side of Emerson and from south side of Nowland Avenue to south side of 16th partially built up-- very old cheap negro shacks.
name: Indianapolis Northeast
detr_influences: Cheap type houses. Lack of city facilities, transportation and schools.

notes: Developed with cheapertype houses--now non-modern type. When sold, are on very low payments
name: Indianapolis East of Brightwood
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Partially developed near RR shops and yards and factories. Lack of city facilities and transportation.

desirability: Only for laboring class and RR mechanics.
notes: Formerly residence fo employee of Big 4 RR shops which were mostly moved to Beech Grove about 20 years ago. North of 28th Street from LaSalle to Forest Manor: enwer type 1-2 fam. bungalows, desirable for rental and home purchase by laboring and mechanic types. Section from 25th south to Roosevelt Avenue from LaSalle to Olney-- older type houses, occupied by better class RR men and local business men. Section from Roosevelt Avenue north, east to Tacoma and along line of Ludlow Avenue, occupied by better class laboring people and mechanics. Those three sections have avilability of mortgage funds for home purchase from local institutions. Section along Massachusetts Avenue facing RR tracks-- occupied mostly by negroes.
name: Indianapolis Brightwood & Oak Hill
favor_influences: Close to factories, RR shops and yards.
detr_influences: Older type houses. Poor transportation.

notes: Suburban section, west part of which was recently taken into city limits. Section east of Sherman Drive to Arthington, known as "Forest Manor", part wooded lots and sparsely developed with brick veneer type of home. New highway, widening 38th Street and new bridge crossing Fall Creek at 38th Street gives access to downtown section without driving, as formerly thru a blighted area.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Northeast Park and Forest Manor Section
favor_influences: Moderate priced homes for working class and mechinic types, along 38th. West part recently taken into City with new grade school.
detr_influences: North section is known as "Brightwood" section. Distance from Center of City. Lack of city facilities. Possible heavy street improvement.

notes: Moderate price suburban section occupied by working class. Large lots. Will continue to develop about the same type of home in the future
name: INDIANAPOLIS Suburban - Northeast Pendleton Pike Section and north of 38th Street
favor_influences: Interurban service. Large lots to acre tracts. New highway developed on 38th St.
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities. Several cheaper type properties.

notes: Section of semi-modern and modern type houses, for mechanic and low wage white collar types. Section affected by high cost of street improvements. Will continue to develop with about the same type of contruction.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Montrose Section
detr_influences: Section of cheaper type houses bordering on good residential section. Bus transportation. Distance from City Center. Distance from high school.

notes: Section along new Boulevard and near best Golf Club which did not develop because of high land value. Can and will be developed with small and less expensive type homes than first planned.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Suburban - Highland Golf Club
desc_terrain: Part level; mostly rolling; few hill sections
favor_influences: Golf clubs. New Boulevard
detr_influences: Lack of transportation and city facilities. Access to center of city thru undesirable neighborhood.

notes: This section contains only about thirty large estates averaging in value in the hundreds of thousands of dollars. No re-sale value can be set.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Crows Nest - Incorporated
desc_terrain: Rolling, hilly. Small restricted area of larger estates
favor_influences: High land. Developed with larger type homes
detr_influences: Lack of transportation, city sewer and water

notes: A section built of mostly summer cottages. Used for six months of the year.
name: Indianapolis Rocky Ripple
detr_influences: Non-permanent homes predominate. Affected by high water of White River. Lack of city facilities.

notes: Older part of a former separate Corporation, now a part of Indianapolis. Only attraction is as residence for servants to residents of better class suburban development further north.
name: Indianapolis North Broad Ripple
detr_influences: Unimproved streets. Older type houses. Lack of city facilities in most streets. Distance from transportation.

notes: City facilities will be put in balance of this section, and will be developed with about the same type as has been in the past.
name: INDIANAPOLIS North Cliff
favor_influences: Small section, sparsely developed with fair-to-good type frame and brick veneer bugalows. Near new high school.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city -- lack of city facilities on all streets

notes: A section of high land north of White River, well platted. Mostly small estate type lots. Will be future best residential section
name: INDIANAPOLIS Meridian Hills - Etc.
desc_terrain: Partly level, partly rolling. All high ground, only partially developed. Section to become best residential part of the city
favor_influences: Large lots -- some well wooded. Very highly restricted.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers, city water and transportation

notes: A summer residential section. Developed in part by few cheap and some fair permanent residences.
name: Indianapolis Ravenswood & Haverstick
detr_influences: Subject to overflow of River. Majority summer residents. Lack of city facilities. Distance from transportation.

notes: Section along Allisonville Road and Millersville Road -- developed with some good brick veneer singles. Several small additions scattered thru this section with cheaper type houses. Towns of Millersville, Castleton and Allisonville vary -- old cross-roads towns -- with cheap old style houses.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Northeast Suburban: Braodripple, Allisonville Millersville
favor_influences: Topography
detr_influences: Lack of city facilities and transportation

notes: A highly restricted subdivision. On the market for several years in which the original owner attempted to control the purchasers. This and lack of access to the City affected development. However, new Boulevard along west bank of Fall Creek from city limits is now being constructed which will help this section very materially.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Brentonwood
favor_influences: Hihgly restricted subdivision. Large estate tracts with forests, trees and shrubery.
detr_influences: Lack of transportation and city facilities. Distance from city center and distance from good highways to reach city center.

notes: Section was affected by flood seepage; this has been improved by widening and straightening the channel of the White River. Will be further corrected by new sewer on whcih construction will start this year. There will be no assessment for this against the property.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Warfleigh
favor_influences: Small section developed with mdoerate priced homes bordering on teh best residential section
detr_influences: Previous floods. Lack of city sewers. Unimproved sterets. Distance from schools

notes: Some new construction west of N. Victoria Street of single $8000 homes, Trend of growth; west of A1. South of A1 ground is low; worth between $250 and $300 per acre.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of the National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Good schools. Adjacency to James Millikin University, Fairview Park and Sunnyside Golf Club.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Fine view of river. No homes for sale during depression. Close to colored district, D5, to west; but is not considered as troublesome to those living here.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of the National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
desc_terrain: High and level, but east of Monroe rolling and timbered.
favor_influences: Restricted to residential homes, $7500 minimum, and adjacent to Lincoln Park.
detr_influences: Greenwood Cemetery -- but not considered as detrimental by those living in this area.

notes: North of Kenwood mostly vacant but very desirable property. Good school and transportation facilities.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of the National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: The best area close to industrial plants on the east. Well laid out.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Mechanics and others working in industrial plants on the east.

notes: Good transportation facilities.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of the National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Close to 3 excellent schools.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Good clean neighborhood.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Good schools.
detr_influences: None (except for a few colored people on W. King and along Marietta to the east, in D3).

notes: A very desirable section and popular area in which to live.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Fairview Park, James Millikin University, Denis School.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Millikin Place is bounded on the west by N. Haworth Avenue, on the east by Pine Street, on the north by Willima, and on the south by Main. Situated here are exceptionally good homes costing from $30,000 to $75,000 with beautiful grounds, community heating plant, but today, however, only one is for sale at approximately 50 on the dolalr. Property here today won't bring 50% of cost. Some old large homes down fully 50%. Houses in the area are being bought for apartment house purposes.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Adjacent to downtown, Millikin University, and Art Institute.
detr_influences: None
build_type: Some apartments 2 units to 8, some duplexes, Single 5-8-10 rooms. $4000-$50,000

notes: Nelson Park and Lake Decatur have favorable effect.Some very fine homes in that part of area east of Jasper to 16th and north of Centrell Street. From 16th to 19th is probably the worst part of area with Polish and laboring class predominating. From 19th west, area is quite desirable with some fine homes scattered throughout.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Near several fine schools and Nelson Park. Close to Lake Decatur.
detr_influences: None.

notes: "Old Country Club Place" and subdivided into very expensive lots, a few fine homes $25,000 each, beautiful view; but will be a long time before it will built up -- too expensive for size of town. No houses for sale and none for rent. Lots sold in 1928 from $2500 to $9000, but can be bought today for 50 on the dollar. Known as South Moreland Place. Only subdivision on Lake for permanent residences. All propert yis in strong hands. Building restrictions are $7500 to $10,000. Should be "A" grade in next 10 to 15 years if city expands substantially.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Near Lake Decatur.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Apartment houses are scattered throughout but these are mostly duplexes of 2-4 units. Some fine homes on Church, Union, and Edward, north of Center Street and on Main north of Grand Avenue.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business inDecatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Adjacent to downtown district. Good schools and transportation.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Proximity to Lake Decatur and Decatur Park District makes this a desirable area in which to live, but it is on down grade. There were no restrictions provided on the ground bordering Lake Decatur when it was created and it is not the asset it might have been from a residential point of view.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur,
name: Decatur, Illinois
desc_terrain: Level, but south of Riverside Avenue to Lake Shore Drive and west of Jasper, it is hilly and rolling.
favor_influences: Lake Decatur, Nelson Park.
detr_influences: None

notes: The small section of area west of James Millikin Athletic Field is fairly well settled with some brick (in addition to frame construction) of single type 5-7 room houses currently valued at from $4,000 to $7,500/ It is a newer and better district than the balance of C2 area and adjoins Fairview Park.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Good schools, near James Millikin University, adjacent to downtown business distruct.
detr_influences: Colored folks in red area, D4, one of the oldest parts of the city.
build_type: Single 4-6-8 rooms, duplex 2-6 units, a number of apartments scattered throughout area of 2-6 units

notes: Industrial region and well located for this class of people.East of Jasper and north of Locust has been built up during last 15 years.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Torrence Park and close to industrial plants. Good schools.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Well located. Reasonably close to Nelson Park and Lake Decatur, especially on the eastern section. From 17th east on Prairie and William Streets extending to 22nd is a better class of buildings and inhabitants.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor. Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur,
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Good schools -- close to industrial district in business section
detr_influences: None
build_type: Single 4-5 rooms, a few apartments of 2-4 units scattered throughout

notes: There are some better homes and class of inhabitants on Torrence Drive in the southeast.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Close to an excellent school and James Millikin University.
detr_influences: Colored people in D5.
inhab_type: Mixed, business, professional, laboring and clerical

notes: West of Graceland there is a better class of homes and is somewhat newer in development.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor, Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Close to schools.
detr_influences: Railroads. Cheap homes.

notes: The northeast part of area in industrial district from Garfield Street north is about 25 years old; balance of area is from 35 to 50 years old- rapidly on down grade. Much rehabilitation necessary. Colored people are on Marietta and Sangamon east of Railroad Avenue.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor, Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Good schools and transportation facilities.
detr_influences: Railroads and industry.

notes: The west section of area is heavily industrialized. Mueller Company, one of the city's big manufacturing plants, is in this section, in fact most of D3 area from east to west is one of railroads, industry and business.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor, Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Heavily intersparsed with commercial and industrial encroachment.
detr_influences: The oldest part of the city with business section in center.
build_type: Some 8 room homes, very few apartments in area, Single 4-5 rooms
salesdemand1: Poor except for commercial purposes and land value

notes: At one time this was one of the best parts of the city. The City Water Works is located in southwestern part of area.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor, Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Adjacent to business section.
detr_influences: A colored district.
build_type: Very few apartments in area, Single 4-5 rooms
salesdemand1: Poor except for commercial purposes and land value

notes: A negro section. Only sales and rents are to colored people. Close to Lincoln Park.
source: George E. Odor, Realtor, Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Adjacent to good territory.
detr_influences: Colored people.

notes: The A.E. Staley Manufacturing Company owns the land (mostly vacant and in gardens) from Eldorado north.
source: Geroge E. Odor, Realtor, Member of National Association of Real Estate Boards, 30 years in real estate business in Decatur.
name: Decatur, Illinois
favor_influences: Close to industry. Almost entirely occupied by A.E. Staley Manufacturing Company employees.
detr_influences: Industrial section.

source: J. D. Carneal
name: Richmond, Virginia

notes: This is a good second grade section which is well protected against undesirable encroachment. Mortage money would certainly be available on favorable terms if the local institutions were in a position to loan. This neighborhood is distinctly suburban in character with houses fairly well spaced.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Quiet and clean neighborhood of good character with desirable housing. Homogenous as to development on fair size lots. Good transportation and schools.
detr_influences: None except distance to center of city.
inhab_type: White collar class, local business men

notes: A sparsely settled section of fair houses. Two new factories which have recently located in Altoona are convenient to this section.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Good schools and transportation. Fairly desirable section of modest homes. Area is clean and quiet.
detr_influences: Unpaved streets and no sidewalks. Distance to center of city.

notes: Altoona people are not receptive to row housing irrespective of cost. These houses are vacant to a large percentage in spite of the housing shortage. The development was an operation of a Philadelphia builder, but the section never received any local support.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Cheap rents. Near schools and transportation.
detr_influences: Heavy vacancy of units. Low class occupants. Vandalized houses in poor conditions. Lack of local demand for row houses.

notes: In point of desirability this is a first grade section, but in view of age and general appearance of the housing the section rates only good second grade. Area enjoys a good reputation and is similar in general character to section A-1, but ground values are lower and the housing is not kept in as fine condition. A foreign section backs up to Ruskin Ave properties, but is reputed to have little effect on this neighborhood.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Section enjoys a very good reputation. Desirable and well planned area of good houses on good sized lots. Good transportation & Schools.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: An outlying section free from objectionable influences. F.H.A. financing is not available because of small lots. Housing is similar in character to section C-8 although not as old nor as completely built up.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Quiet and clean neighborhood. Good schools; and transportation fairly desirable section of modest homes on small lots.
detr_influences: Distance to center of city. No sidewalks - many unpaved streets

notes: A small area of modest homes in desirable location well protected from objectionable influences. This is a fair to poor second class section.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Near golf course. Good transportation. Restricted as to price and improvements. Good view of mountains.
detr_influences: Unpaved streets. No sidewalk, distance to center of city.

notes: Only 2 sales in past five years have been made in this section. This section is a good first grade neighborhood well protected against undesirable encroachment. Houses are built on large lots and set well back from the street.
source: Chas. McVey-Property Management Broker HOLC, Paul H. Faris Local realtor and Correspondent Prudential Ins. Co.
name: Altoona, PA
favor_influences: The most desirable section of Altoona in point of location, class of people, homogeneity of development and freedom from objectionable influences. Good transportation and schools.
detr_influences: None except heavy traffic on Union Ave.

notes: This section is similar in general character to section A-1, although somewhat older and more extensively developed. Additional building will ensue in this neighborhood as general economic conditions improve.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Very desirable residential, well located and well planned, character of this area is very good. Good transportation and schools.
detr_influences: Heavy traffic on Union Ave. through the section.

notes: Few foreclosures with few distress sales which helped hold up prices. Some reconditioning is improving neighborhood. Favorably affected by proximity to section A-2.
name: Altoona
favor_influences: Good transportation and schools. Good reputation of area. Substantial neighborhood.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: About 10 houses fronting on 24th St. between Bell and Fourth Ave. are very high grade costing from $10,000 to $15,000 each which now range in price from $6000-8500. The four corners at second avenue and 18th St are $6500 houses in a $3000 neigborhood. Area is still attractive to RR trainmen and shopmen.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: All streets and alleys paved. Good schools, churches and transportation.
detr_influences: Section is becoming spotty with lower class foreign, Smoke and dirt from RR blown into the area. Small lots.

notes: Section was developed after the war. Buildings were built at rear of lots with intention of converting property to chicken coops or barms, but conversion has not taken place to any extent. Only one or two good houses in the area and these are distinctly out of place.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Clean, quiet suburban atmosphere
detr_influences: No sidewalks, no pavements, no water, no sewers, poor housing.

notes: Sewer connections have just become available recently and the sewer line now runs along Pleasant Valley Boulevard. It was built with P.W.A funds This is a small section developed by one man. Houses are fairly substantial but the surrounding neighborhood is poor. There was a good number of foreclosures in the area.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Quiet and clean suburban section of fairly good homes. Good bus transportation.
detr_influences: Surrounded by poor housing. Heavy traffic on Pleasant Valley Pike. Poor school accomodations.

notes: Sewers are now available in the section. A sparsely settled section lying at the bottom of the slope from Grant St. Houses are very modest and most residents have small gardens.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Large lots. Good schools and transportation. Clean area.
detr_influences: Distance to town. No paved streets, no sidewalks.

notes: Entire area was developed by an operation builder. The section is a very desirable residential area for shopmen in R.R. repair plants. This is a modest neighborhood of fair housing.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Good transportation - Near school, clean and quiet neighborhood
detr_influences: Crossing of high spreed throughfare to grade school. Distance from center of city.

notes: Residents must transport their children to city schools and pay tuition. Area is desirable residential neighborhood of substantial houses on large lots.
name: Jaggard St.-Sub Altoona
favor_influences: A small section of good grade homes all fronting on Jaggard St. Homogeneous in character and very desirable as residential.
detr_influences: No transportation. Poor school facilities. Residents pay tuition for city school privilege.

notes: This was a promotional development by a local operator who sold the lots to young business men of Altoona. The section has held up rather well and is considered a very desirable neighborhood. Heavy foreclosures in this area.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Quiet and clean suburban development of good character. Houses are substantially built on good size lots. Good transportation.
detr_influences: No shopping center. Distance to schools.

notes: Houses at present have no sewers, but a sewer line has just been completed along the Pleasant Valley Boulevard which will tend to improve the area. Neighborhood now is a poor second grade section.
name: East End.-Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Quiet and clean suburban section of modest homes. Houses are built on fair sized lots.
detr_influences: Distance to center of city. Unpaved Streets, lack of sidewalks.

notes: Area between 7th St. and Kettle St. including 8th & 9th Avenues has been purchased by Pa. R.R. for classification yard. Much of the property has been demolished and the balance will be soon.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Near employment. Paved streets and alleys. Good transportation Near schools.
detr_influences: Dirt and smoke from R. R. Poor class of populace. Housing in bad condition.

notes: An old section of Altoona which continues to enjoy a good reputation. Some converted houses in the area. Cheaper units are distress property. Financing through F. H. A. is not available because of small lots. Many old families still residing in original houses. A fair to poor second grade section which has restrained its residential desirability.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Good transportation and schools. Near center of city. Desirable section with good reputation.
detr_influences: Obsolescence - changing neighborhood. Small lots.

notes: A desirable section in good demand. Character of neighborhood is good. This is a good third grade section.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Desirable section of modest homes in clean neighborhood. Good transportation & schools, convenient to shopping center.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Considered desirable neighborhood in spite of dirt and smoke from RR. Many original owners and old families still located here.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Close to city-good transportation and schools. Recreation field in area.
detr_influences: RR smoke from Pa. RR main line. Obsolescence. Small lots.

notes: A very poor section of undesirable tenants. Negro is concentrated along RR tracks. There are a good number of shack type houses in the section.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Paved streets
detr_influences: Poor transportation. Mixed population. Poor housing. Smoke and dirt from R.R.

notes: Section has been cleaned up considerably in recent years through effors of a Catholic Priest. Hoodlums have been forced to leave the neighborhood, and the general character of the area has improved slightly. At present the housing is a poor third grade with some rather good units scattered throughout.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Near center of city. Good tranportation and school.
detr_influences: Hilly ground. Mixture of population. Section is very spotty. Small lots.
inhab_type: Mixture of all types Polish, Slave

notes: Section is attractive to RR executives at shops, particularly those at nearby Juniata.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Clean area with good transportation. Desirable residential neighborhood of high class people. Close to school.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Northeastern end of section is not convenient to high school or down town commercial area, but the general character of the section is uniform throughout. Considered very desirable by local RR men because of location. Houses are very modest and in good demand, although many old houses are scattered throughout, some in poor condition.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: West side of RR, and, consequently not subject to smoke of RR. Paved streets & alleys. Good schools & transportation. Pride of ownership in area.
detr_influences: Hilly topography. Small lots. Section is somewhat spotty with fair and good houses interspersed throughout.

notes: Lower end of section has less expensive units. Between 11th and 13th Streets from 22nd to 27th are houses in the higher price bracket which are very good second grade. Balance of the section is equally desirable although housing is less expensive.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Desirable section of substantial houses on good size lots. Restricted to $5000 houses minimum.
detr_influences: Distance to schools. Distance to car line.

notes: A fairly new section of good houses which held up rather well in prices. Section is strictly residential. Additional development is restricted to $5000 housing.
name: Whenwood - Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Good transportation and schools - Desirable section of good character.
detr_influences: None except distance to center of city.

notes: Heavy foreclosures throughout this neighborhood. Section is very spotty and the area does not have a very promising future. The general character of the neighborhood is poor. Topography is not conducive to good development.
name: Juniata-Sub Altoona, Pa.
desc_terrain: Hilly, not conducive to good development.
favor_influences: Cheap rents. Fairly convenient to Juniata railroad shops and yards.
detr_influences: No paving, No sidewalks. Poor transportation, poor topography. Many streets impassable in bad weather. Houses need painting very badly.
build_repair: Poor a few in fair condition

notes: Upper end of the section is better. Executives of two new factories (Glass plant & silk mill) are locating in this section. Houses are substantially built and well spaced.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: A desirable area of modest homes in a clean and quiet neighborhhod. Section enjoys good character. Convenient to two new factories along RR tracks.
detr_influences: Poor transportation and schools at lower end.
inhab_type: Business& Professional men Few RR Trainmen

notes: City water now throughout the area. A glass manufacturing plant and a textile manufacturer recently moved into Altoona near this section. Employment thus nearby is expected to make this section more desirable. The bulk of employees in the textile mill are women.
name: Altoona, Pa.
favor_influences: Two new factories recently moved into section. Good schools, clean and quiet section of fair character.
detr_influences: Poor transportation. Unpaved streets, no sidewalks. Distance to high school.

notes: Inhabited by employees of C&O Railroad shops. Area declining.
name: Richmond, Virginia

notes: Very good white-collar type section with average incomes. Along Washington Street both sides, trend is to apartments; some few business sites.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Lower Irvington - Emerson Heights
favor_influences: Stable neighborhood, lower Irvington and Emerson Heights Section
detr_influences: North part bus transportation; other portions, good transportation

desirability: Not good in north section; fair-to-good in west.
notes: North section nearly 100% built up -- older type houses with bungalows intermingling. Possibility of negro purchasers from territory south of 30th street. West section not fully developed -- newer type frame bungalows; will probably remain stable for several years with some new building.
name: INDIANAPOLIS North Indianapolis and Riverside Park
favor_influences: West section borders on largest park and golf course. North section: very good type of citizenry
detr_influences: Encroachment of inharmonious groups (negro). Necessity of travel thru blighted section to reach City Center. Distance from educational centers, particularly High Schools
build_age: North section: 25 years West Section: 18 years

notes: Considered the worst section in Philadelphia. During 1933-1934 rentals were not collected in lieu of upkeep of property; in some cases tenants were paid to stay. Speculators are not operating in this area.
source: W.R. Stinson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Nothing
detr_influences: No sewers- undesirable negro section of very poor property. Flood hazard- Vandalism. 8 feet below river level

source: W.R. Stinson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- close to industry
detr_influences: Concentration of undesirables. Low class whites and negro

notes: Influx of Jewish has discounted values- moved in during last five years. Well developed section originally- good construction. Better grade of property south of Baltimore.
source: W.R. Stinson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- fairly desirable residential section of homes in demand
detr_influences: None

notes: Portions was government built during war. Some industry in this section,
source: W.R. Stinson
name: Phila.
favor_influences: Good Transportation- fairly modern homes- close to industrial employment
detr_influences: Surrounded by poorer class sections

notes: Houses between 51st Street and 59th Street on Florence & Warrington Avenue were built and are settling badly. Infiltration of Jewish into area have depressed values. No demand for large houses in this section. Houses being converted into apartments. Baltimore Avenue is largely business as well as 40th, 52nd, 56th and 60th Streets.
source: W.R. Stinson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Close to town- Good transportation
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence- infiltration of boarding houses- converted dwellings. Many very large out of style houses of questionable value. Threatened with negro encroachment.

notes: Many boarded up houses in this section- general mixture of population- low class whites- Italians- negroes- Very narrow streets. Woodland Avenue principally business.
source: W.R. Stinson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good Transportation
detr_influences: Congested area of mixed population- very small houses of small value

notes: Section on Osage Ave. between 46th and 50th is very good. Infiltration of Jewish, Polish and Italian. Section around Cobbs Creek below Catherine St. in better than balance of the section- values $9000-$15,000 in this section and Osage Avenue section mentioned above. Section has passed its peak, but retains considerable value. Pine St. 5000 block is old 3 story rows. 52nd, 56th and 60th are already given over to business
source: W.R. Stinson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Direct transportation to center of city. Fairly desirable residential section-
detr_influences: Changing neighborhood- Section may be expected to undergo a transition period in the next five years. Converted houses along Walnut.
build_repair: Fair- Good on Osage Ave and Cobbs Creek

notes: Section is very spotty- still has some of original owners- some streets are better than indicated but influenced by down trend entire area. 40th, 52nd, 56th, 60th and all of Market Street is predominantly business. Elevated runs out Market St.
source: ADOLF CASPARD
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Close to center of city- good transportation
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence of property- concentration of Negroes and Italians.

notes: Italian section of West Philadelphia. Speculative prices prevail. Spreading out to north threatening values in B-1 section. Negro encroachment from south and east.
source: Adolf Caspard
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Close to better section. Direct transportation to center of city.
detr_influences: Concentration of Italian. Neighborhood is going down.

notes: Majority of houses do not have garage. Homogeneous character of population. Lancaster Avenue is largely business- also Lansdowne Avenue around 60th. Jewish have overflowed into this section from B18.
source: ADOLF CASPARD
name: PHILADELPHIA
favor_influences: Restricted above Lansdowne Avenue & Haverford Avenue. Very desirable second class neighborhood. Good transportation.
detr_influences: None, except possible encroachment from Section C-1.

notes: Lower part of section is threatened with Italian expansion- low grade green. Section is a bit spotty, but is definitely first grade. Minimum of traffic in this area, except on Lancaster Avenue and 63rd St., which is largely business.
source: ADOLF CASPARD
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Restricted- close to park- desirable residential section- location well protected against encroachment.
detr_influences: None

notes: Southern part of section is not quite as high grade. Twins are principally in northern section above Woodbine and Wynfield Avenues. Predominately Jewish for many years, except in northern part above Wynfield Ave.
source: ADOLF CASPARD
name: PHILADELPHIA
favor_influences: Close to City Avenue transportation- close to park and open country- restricted section- direct roads to downtown section.
detr_influences: Trolley transportation lacking.

notes: Mostly in Lower Merion Township-low taxes, although a good portion of the section is of considerable age, the entire area is considered the most desirable residential section of Philadelphia. Many large estates are mixed in the area and values on such are very high. Sections of the area are somewhat spotty, but the character of the entire section is extremely good.
source: SLOAN & LYNCH
name: SUB *PHILADELPHIA- Main Line
favor_influences: Desirable residential section of better homes on larger lots. Good schools, transportation.
detr_influences: None, except age of property which does not seem to effect general desirability.

notes: The oldest development on the "main line".
source: SLOAN & LYNCH
name: SUB-PHILADELPHIA-Narberth
favor_influences: Good transportation- low tax rate- desirable residential section.
detr_influences: Older property.

notes: Old houses are being remodled and new and modern improvements installed- population has refused to move from the district. Foreign born is definitely improving. Graded 4th grade because of age of property. Section is very unusual. Mills in section now running to capacity.
source: Francis E. McGill
name: Manayunk
favor_influences: Church influence in the section is holding population and tending to improve class of inhabitants. Several Catholic schools.
detr_influences: Some colored between Manayunk on East, Cotton on South, Terrace on West and Monastery Avenue on North. Negroes on Dupont between Manayunk & Mitchell Avenues.

notes: Prices increased only in past 6 months. Section is expected to retain desirability.
source: Francis E. McGill
name: Manayunk
favor_influences: Stability of inhabitants in point of staying in the section.
detr_influences: Trolley & subway fare in 13 cents to center of city.

notes: Rentals have not been increased in this section.
source: Francis E. McGill
name: Manayunk
favor_influences: Continuing to be developed as desirable section.
detr_influences: No- transportation only fair

notes: Similar in character to Section E-6 but may develop largely of less expensive houses.
name: Suburban Philadelphia, Pa.

notes: Most of the ground in this section is controlled by the Houston Estate. Development will be quite high grade but generally speaking people are not anxious to move to this particular area.
name: Suburban Philadelphia, Pa.

notes: Houses west of School House Lane are very large estates. No ground being sold for building. Some old houses have been remodeled.
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Very high grade section.
detr_influences: Only fair transportation.

notes: Concentration of industry - Section held up well during depression - good demand from good class of residents - Industry will diversified - Considered good section for third grade.
source: W. R. Hutzel
name: Philadelphia, Pa.
favor_influences: Good transportation, particularly eastern part, -Near to industrial plants of major consequence to entire Philadelphia area.
detr_influences: Nominal

source: W.R. Stinson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Desirable residential section- fair transportation
detr_influences: None

notes: A very spotty section of many type houses with varying population- one of the oldest developments of Philadelphia. Germantown is practically all business up to Haines Ave.
source: Doherty
name: Philadelphia- Germantown
favor_influences: Germantown section- good R.R. transportation
detr_influences: Negro encroachment- some Italian on Mt. Pleasant Avenue. Influx of less desirable element.
build_type: 2 story tows- twins- single- some three story rows

notes: Section is blighted and demolition is recommended- originally housed mill workers.
source: Doherty
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Heavy obsolescence of property- crowded area of low areas population.

desc_terrain: Same as D-4 except solid negro of good character.
same as D-4 except solid negro and Italian of fair character
same as D-4 except solid negro and Italian of fair character

notes: Better class negro in this section. Conversion of 3 story houses in here. Close to Gratz High School. Close to good industrial section.
source: W.R. Hutzel
name: Philadelphia, Pa.
favor_influences: New Industry- Good transportation.
detr_influences: Heavy concentration of negro- properties in poor condition.

notes: Broad Street is business. Italian encroachment is slow from the south.
source: HARRY HEIDELBERGER.
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- fairly desirable residential section- near large employers along Erie Avenue- large park in section.
detr_influences: Nominal.

notes: Principally a mill section in eastern end. Front St. is partially business. Cheaper rentals in southern eastern end. Philoo employs a large payroll here. Cuneo Press, Heinz, Crown Cork & Seal (Sub. of American Can) have new plants in the section. A third grade yellow section.
source: HARRY HEIDELBERGER.
name: PHILADELPHIA
favor_influences: Industrial employment nearby- fair residential area- elevated and subway transportation.
detr_influences: Textile industry in section is practically shut down.

notes: Front Street is principally business. Many industrial plants in the section. Broad Street and Germantown Avenue are principally business. Some rents have been increased in recent years, but no blanket increases have been instituted. Vacancies are being increased 10% where they warrant it. A fair 4th grade section.
source: HARRY HEIDELBERGER
name: PHILADELPHIA
favor_influences: Good shopping area on Lehigh Avenue and Germantown Avenue. Fairly close to commercial area- good transportation.
detr_influences: Obsolescence- some negro- some foreign.

notes: Broad Street is principally business. Only room for building is on property vacated by demolition. Some houses in the section are being held for sale- high vacancy predicated on houses unfit for use. Northern end of section is better. Section is very spotty with colored and white mixed streets. Foreclosures were heavy in this section. A poor 4th grade section.
source: HARRY HEIDELBERGER
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- close to business and industry- schools are ample.
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence- concentration of negro- many condemned properties- some vandalism.

notes: Some factories in the section. Predominance of lower class Jewish. Polish, Lithuanian, Slavs- general mixture of foreign. 40% 3 sty., 60% 2 sty. Market was lacking in 1933-35. Germantown Avenue, Girard Avenue predominantly business. A poor 4th grade section.
source: HARRY HEIDELBERGER
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Close to business- good transportation- schools are ample.
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence- concentration of foreigners and some negro.

notes: Section is spotty- some fairly good houses. Business is very poor in the section. One of the oldest developments of Philadelphia. Community known as "Fishtown".
source: HARRY HEIDELBERGER
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Fair section.
detr_influences: Very old houses- decadence of industry.
build_type: 2 & 3 sty. row- some singles on small streets

notes: Section is spotty- some fair streets. Richmond Street is practically all business. Employment situation has not permitted rental increases.
source: HARRY HEIDELBERGER.
name: PHILADELPHIA
favor_influences: Nominal- some industry along river.
detr_influences: Sewage disposal plant in section- disagreeable odor.

notes: Many textile mills are located here. Industry is somewhat stagnant in the area at present. Section is spotty with some properties in fairly good condition.
source: HARRY HEIDEBERGER
name: PHILADELPHIA
favor_influences: Elevated transportation- good business section on Frankford and Kensington Avenues.
detr_influences: Old section.

notes: A heavy shifting of occupants- principally industrial workers. Industrial workers in action in constant turmoil. A modest second grade section.
source: H.B. Wilson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Very good transportation- near employment. Modern houses- near parks.
detr_influences: Shifting type of population.

notes: Frankford Ave. is all commercial. Considerable industry at lower end. Foreigners concentrated west of Frankford Avenue. Some 3 story rows on main streets. Many old owners in the section.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- near employment- cheap rentals
detr_influences: Heavy obsolesence- Property in rundown condition- General mixture of population.

notes: Section West of Frankford Ave. between Orthodox & Cheltenham Ave. and east of Oxford Ave. is of better character and populated by better grade people with values and rentals slightly higher than the balance of the section.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- Industrial plants along river, employs large payrolls.
detr_influences: Obsolescence is marked east of Forresdale Avenue.

notes: Tyson Street frontage is good. A fair second grade section.
source: Rowland & Bamister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- desirable residential area of good people. Good schools (grade)
detr_influences: None

notes: considerable new building to go in here.
source: Rowland & Benister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- fairly modern dwellings. City Park- desirable populace
detr_influences: None

notes: new houses up to $6500 New construction in 1937 is well ahead of 1936. A good second grade section.
source: Rawland & Banister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Fairly new section of good character-good transportation-desirable population. Diversified employment of populace.
detr_influences: None

notes: Italian & negro located along R.R. tracks. Northern part of section not as well built up. Population has been located here for sometime. Negro concentration is affecting values along Welsh Road from Dittman Avenue to Frankford.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Sub. Holmesburg
favor_influences: Good transportation- near park
detr_influences: Negro section in center of section.
build_repair: fair to poor along R.R. trails

notes: Inhabitants are employees of C&O Railroad shops. Area declining.
name: Richmond, Virginia

notes: Has not spread out for sometime, but the poor neighborhood is affecting values in adjacent area.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Suburban atmosphere
detr_influences: A very poor section of obsolete houses in poor condition.

notes: New Houses range $8000-$15,000. Very desirable residential neighborhood. A good second grade section.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Boulevard frontage- restricted to twins or singles.
detr_influences: None

notes: Wider streets bring better rentals on houses. Rental shortage is reason for high occupancy.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Near Sears Roebuck Retail & Wholesale Store
detr_influences: Transportation is poor- no RR's. 10 cents bus fare to City.

notes: Sparksely settled area with street lay-outs. In view of the limited territory, the section appears to be the next for volumn building of two story dwellings to sell under 10,000 dollars.
name: Suburban Philadelphia, Pa.

homebuy: None except on Corinthian Ave. section
notes: The section between Corinthian Avenue and 22nd Street from Poplar to Brown was built 15 yrs. ago- values range up to $4,000. rents around $35-45.- Considerable business scattered through this section on main streets. Broad Street is all business.
source: W.R. Hutzel
name: Philadelphia, Pa.
favor_influences: Close to business- good transportation- subway, busses, trolley.
detr_influences: Negro concentration- heavy absolescence.

notes: Concentration of Jewish in Northern part- Germans in Southern part- Heavy speculation in this section in 1928-1929,- Strawberry Mansion section- heavy foreclosures- 29th Street is not in good condition for renting.
source: W.W. Hutzel
name: Philadelphia, Pa.
favor_influences: Near Park- close to business- good transportation- better 4th grade section.
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence- large properties.

notes: Section is principally Jewish- Depreciation will be slowed down by good transportation. A fair second grade section, but future is questionable.
source: H.B. Wilson
name: Phila.-Olney- Rock
favor_influences: Good transportation- fairly modern houses
detr_influences: Houses are being allowed to depreciate.

notes: German American population- Broad St. properties are not typical of section as a whole. Section is very desirable, but danger of Jewish encroachment is imminent. A fair first grade section.
source: H.B. Wilson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- very desirable residential section- well restricted- wooded section
detr_influences: None

notes: Most of building in eastern end. High type inhabitants. A fair first grade section.
source: H.B. Wilson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Desirable industrial section- good transportation. Thrifty class of populace- 2 perks in section.
detr_influences: No

notes: Many residents of Elkin Park commute to New York City.
source: David C. Snyder
name: Sub. Phila. Elkins Park
favor_influences: Good transportation - desirable residential area of good character.
detr_influences: None

name: Sub. Phila. Ashbourne
favor_influences: Desirable section of good character, bus and train transportation.
detr_influences: None except some spotty streets

notes: Sparsely settled area whose immediate development questionable but because of its location will undoubtedly take its character from Ashburner.
name: Suburban Philadelphia, Pa.
Sub. Phila.- McKinley
favor_influences: nominal
detr_influences: Some colored in section.

notes: Section is very spotty, not restricted as to type. Property is owned by population of German descent making section more desirable. A fair second grade section.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Lawndale-Cheltenham-Fox Chase-Rockledge
favor_influences: Transportation is good-fairly desirable medium class residential.
detr_influences: No sewers in greater portion of section.

notes: Somerton is about 15-16 miles from center of city. Sections are desirable to people interested in country homes
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Somerton-Bustleton
favor_influences: Quiet suburban developments- fairly desirable country homes of modest character
detr_influences: Transportation to Bustleton is fair-to Somerton good.

notes: Property on Lincoln Drive in quits high grade but does not warrant a 1st grade rating- values range up to $20,000. Western part of the section below R.R. has larger houses. Twins showed greater shrinkage than singles. There appears to be little danger of the less desirable element encroaching from yellow and red sections.
source: Doherty
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Fairly desirable residential section- although somewhat old. Good transportation.
detr_influences: Grade schools in Chew Avenue section have about 15% negro children. Many of the streets are very spotty- some backing up to poorer property.

notes: Property around R.R. station not quite as high grade. Singles average $20,000, Twins average $10,000. High grade area recently developed. Not quite as accessible as west Germantown section.
source: Doherty
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Direct rail transportation- Homogeneous development of desirable residential area.
detr_influences: No

notes: Shifting of population. People moving further out. Southern end of section has the smaller houses. Buyers still looking for bargains. Practically all available land is held at $20,000 an acre. Direct roads to center of city. Many large estates in this section.
source: Doherty
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: The finest residential section in the city. Very good schools- Near parks- electrified train transportation.
detr_influences: None

notes: Two story houses in the field under $10,000.
name: Suburban Philadelphia, Pa.
favor_influences: Not known at present

notes: New houses in the section predominate. A good second grade section. Section has been built principally in past five years. The entire area is operation building. Building is moving northeast. Considerable room for expansion. The most active building section in city about 450 units being buily in first months of 1937.
source: in first four months of 1937. H.B. Wilson
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Fair transportation
detr_influences: None

name: Sub-Phila-La Motte
desc_terrain: High grade negro-more land around houses-good transportation
favor_influences: obsolescence

notes: Section between Cliveden and Germantown- Willow Grove Turnpike and Oakdale & Mt. Carmel Ave. is very good.
source: David C. Snyder
name: Sub. Phila.- Glenside
favor_influences: Sewers- good transportation- good schools- highly desirable residential section- high elevation.
detr_influences: Almost solidly build- no room for expansion.

notes: $15,000-25,000 houses predominate
source: David C. Snyder
name: Sub Phila
favor_influences: Highly desirable, well restricted residential area.
detr_influences: No sewers.

notes: Need underdraining throughout
source: David C. Snyder
name: Sub. Phila
favor_influences: Desirable residential section
detr_influences: No sewers- removed from R.R. but near trolley

notes: Section has been static, but is expected to improve. No sewers in the section, although plans are under way to eliminate cesspools.
source: David C. Snyder
name: Sub. Phila- Glenside
favor_influences: Good transportation- train and bus- fairly desirable residential section.
detr_influences: Surface water in upper end of section.

notes: Italians of foreign born predominate. Section is very spotty with a general mixture of all types of houses.
source: David C. Snyder
name: Sub. Phila.
favor_influences: Train service
detr_influences: Mixture of population of poor class.

source: David C. Snyder
name: Sub. Phila.
favor_influences: High- wooded section in part- desirable residential section - fairly good transportation.
detr_influences: Some unimproved streets- no sewers.

desc_terrain: Same as D-2 except further away from center of city.

name: Sub-Phila-Willow Grove
desc_terrain: Section is the same as C-2 but is further out from center of city.

notes: Small streets principally 2 story rows. Newer houses are at extreme southern end. Section east of Broad Street is considered fairly desirable. New houses sold readily but buyers are from this section and not of high calibre.
source: Jas. H. Livezly.
name: South Phila.
favor_influences: Good transportation- near employment- subway transportation to Snyder Avenue.
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence.

notes: No great demand for property in this section at any time. Many negro families doubled up. Section has been slowly deteriorating for years. Italians are slowly driving negroes out. Small streets are principally 2 story rows. Considerable industry and small business in the section.
source: Jas. H. Livezly
name: South Philadelphia
favor_influences: Good transportation- close to commercial and industrial area.
detr_influences: Negro encroachment- heavy obsolescence.

notes: Good many apartments of high calibre located here. Highest type residential section in town- many occupants maintaining homes here for occupancy during Season.
source: James H. Livezly.
name: Rittenhouse Square Sect. Phila.
favor_influences: Near commercial area- High class inhabitants-
detr_influences: Encroachment of undesirable element from South.

notes: 2 story rows principally on small side streets and southern end. New construction is up to $6,000. Girard estate is between 18th & 21st from Porter to Passyunk Ave. and is of better grade.
source: Jas. H. Livezly
name: South Philadelphia.
favor_influences: Broad St. Subway to Snyder- Girard Estate in center of section is holding up values around it.
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence.

notes: Inhabitants are employees of C&O Railroad shops. Area declining.
name: Richmond, Virginia
Richmond, Virginia
favor_influences: Rigid restrictions
detr_influences: None

notes: Bungalows of cheap construction intermingled with small boathouses assuming squatter privileges.
source: See explanation
name: Bellmawr, N.J
desc_terrain: Level ground inclined to run swampy due to neglected creek. Development has been of cheapest character.
favor_influences: Near Blackhorse Bike and Crescent Boulevard
detr_influences: Squatter type of people of questionable reputation.

source: See explanation
name: Bellmawr, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land, sparsely developed with small homes.
favor_influences: Black Horse Pike which is the main highway to seashore resorts, runs through this area.
detr_influences: South westerly section occupied by poor type of resident.

notes: West Collingswood Heights barely escapes a "D" classification due to cheap construction, type of resident and lack of municipal improvements.
source: See explanation
name: Haddon township (West Collingswood Heights) Gloucester Heights-Mt. Ephraim, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land. Fairly large plots but sparsely Improved with small homes.
favor_influences: About 5 miles south of Camden with excellent transportation
detr_influences: Poor construction of homes in the West Collingswood Heights section as well as Gloucester Heights which has attracted an undesirable element. Only some utilities.

notes: This tract was intended to have been an exclusive development but due to the depression, nothing has been done since 1930.
source: See explanation
name: Crescent Park-Brooklawn, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land sparsely built up and laid out in fair sized lots.
favor_influences: Nearness of fair sized comunity.
detr_influences: Development laid out in 1924 with streets, curb, gutters, city water, but development has become static due to in/accessibility and poor transportation

source: See explanation
name: Brooklawn, N.J.
desc_terrain: Low level land with irregular plat lines due to lay-out of borough.
favor_influences: Good transportation on two important highways and only five miles from Camden.
detr_influences: Between Westville and Gloucester where low land values prevail.

notes: Due to lack of Civic pride large percentage of physical depreciation has occured
source: See explanation
name: Gloucester, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land with small lots, 20 x 90 completely built up with very old and small dwellings.
favor_influences: Near city of Camden and places of employment. Excellent transportation.
detr_influences: Age and obsolescence of dwellings.

source: See explanation
name: Gloucester, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land - solidly built up with old dwellings on small sized lots.
favor_influences: About 3 miles south of Camden. Good Transportation.
detr_influences: Age of structures.
inhab_type: Shipyard and Mill Mechanics & office workers

notes: Old town without zoning or concentrated shopping center.
source: See explanation
name: Gloucester, N.J.
desc_terrain: The only section of the town remaining at all desirable. Land is low and flat.
favor_influences: Excellent transportation - reasonable rates proximity to Camden and Philadelphia
detr_influences: Section is part of town over 300 years old.
inhab_type: Minor business executives aand insurance employees

notes: Complete section built in 1917 by the United States. Shipping board to house shipbuilders of New York. Shipbuilding Corporation during late war. Sold as a complete unit in 1922 and resold by group purchasers to indivdidual home buyers.
source: See explanation
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level and containing small, brick dwellings of pleasing English architectural design
favor_influences: Laid out in village fashion with all modern facilities such as community shopping center, recreation center, parks and adequate transportation.
detr_influences: None

source: See explanation
name: Collingwood (West) N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land containing many large on Sizeable plottage
favor_influences: Excellent transportation and easily accessible to center of Camden and Philadelphia
detr_influences: None

source: See explanation
name: Woodlynne, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level and solidly built up area of small homes.
favor_influences: Southern part of Camden City, posessing its own shopping district, schools, churches, etc.
detr_influences: Poor pride of ownership shown in some sections of town.

source: See explanations
name: Collingswood
desc_terrain: Level land, containing large houses on large plottages with spacious lawns and a good degree of landscaping.
favor_influences: Zoning restrictions, excellent transportation and close proximity to Metropolitan area of Philadelphia
detr_influences: None

notes: Bank failures caused untold hardship in entire community-However, sound improvement has been evidenced during past year resulting in considerable betterments in both values and rentals
source: See explanation
name: Collingswood, N.J.
desc_terrain: Rolling land improved with many large dwellings on large plottages.
favor_influences: Excellent trasnportation, first class community shopping district, high type schools, churches, and parks. Only three miles from Camden City. No manufacturing plants.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Business men, executives, professionals & skilled mech.

source: See explanation
name: Westmont (Haddon Twp) N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land containing plots 50 x 125 improved with moderately priced homes.
favor_influences: Excellent shopping center, good bus transportation and all major improvements
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: small business men, shopforemen, senior clerks, etc.

source: See explanation
name: Haddonfield N.J.
desc_terrain: A small, quiet and attractive country town located in rolling terrain.
favor_influences: In its day one of the finest residential distructs in South Jersey.
detr_influences: None

notes: Restrictions and high real estate values prevent an encroachment of lower class of occupants
source: See explanation
name: Haddonfield, N.J.
desc_terrain: Rolling land containing large homes on large plottages. Landscaping is most attractive and pride of ownership extremely high.
favor_influences: Zoning restrictions, near community shopping center and good transportation.
detr_influences: None

source: See explanation
name: Haddon Heights, N.J.
desc_terrain: Rolling land containing many large homes on large plottages.
favor_influences: Adjacent to Haddonfield where residential land values are highest in south Jersey. Excellent transportation and Marked pride of ownership.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Bus, executives and professionals, County officials

source: See explanations
name: Barrington, N.J.
desc_terrain: Rolling land- laid out in 40 x 125 plots and improved with modest homes.
favor_influences: Accessible to Blackhorse Pike, adjacent to Whitehorse Pike with Clementa Bridge Road running through center of town.
detr_influences: Distance from city proper

source: See explanation
name: Oaklyn- Audubon, N.J.
desc_terrain: Rolling land- laid out principally in 50 x 150 foot lots and improved with modest homes.
favor_influences: Room for expansion.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city.
inhab_type: Shipyard and navy yard employees, etc.

notes: Near Rural area where low land values prevail
source: See explanation
name: Ellisburg (Erlton Section)
desc_terrain: Level land improved with modern homes erected on small plots - shrubbery and lawns well kept.
favor_influences: Near Collingswood and near Haddonfield and enjoying their conveniences. Located on a main artery.
detr_influences: Distance from City.
inhab_type: Insurance Minor executives Young professinoal men

notes: New York shipbuilding corporation has a direct influence because of nearness of their plant.
source: See explanation
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Low level land solidly built with moderately priced row and semi-detached dwellings.
favor_influences: Good transportation and about 3 miles from center of Camden's commercial activity
detr_influences: Nearness and encroachment of industry

notes: Due to erection of Delaware Bridge, entire district has, and continues to, rapidly decline in northwestern section
source: See explanation
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level, solidly built up with old homes of similar design
favor_influences: In heart of city and industrial area
detr_influences: Many dwellings being torn down by vandals and others by owners to save taxes

source: See explanation
name: Camden (Whitman park Section)
desc_terrain: Level land solidly built up with small homes on small lots.
favor_influences: Occupied by a high type of Polish residents who have their own shopping area, schools, churches, recreation centers, etc.
detr_influences: Negro district on edge of this section, but splendid cooperation of all residents in this section will always prevent spread.

source: See explanation
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land with attractive outlook. this remains the most desirable residential selection in the city limits.
favor_influences: General convenience and location
detr_influences: Heavy traffic on the traversing arteries

notes: High speed electric line between Camden and Philadelphia has slightly improved this district.
source: See explanation
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land solidly built up with old residences and business structures.
favor_influences: Heart of City of Camden.
detr_influences: Surrounded by low class of colored and Italian inhabitants.
inhab_type: Merchants - skilled mechanics and office workers

source: See explanation
name: Camden (Cramer Hill Section) N.J.
desc_terrain: Low level land containing miscellaneous types of homes and irregular plots.
favor_influences: Good transportation and very good shopping center.
detr_influences: Necessity of passing through a Negro section.

source: See explanations
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land solidly built up and laid out in small lots improved with cheap dwellings and shacks.
favor_influences: Nearness to place of employment
detr_influences: Adjacency to freight yards.

notes: Due to construction of Crescent Boulevard, this section was left about 15 feet below grade of new highway which causes bad floods during heavy storms.
source: See explanations
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land sloping to low land containing moderately priced homes.
favor_influences: On two main arteries and near industry.
detr_influences: High bus fare and poor drainage

source: See explanation
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land, solidly developed, small lot sizes.
favor_influences: Eastern section of City of Camden possessing its own shopping area and with excellent transportation. Conveniently located.
detr_influences: Near large freight yard of Pennsylvania R.R.

source: See explanation
name: Merchantville, N.J.
desc_terrain: Rolling land divided into plottages of 50 X 150 lots
favor_influences: Good transportation and scattered shopping districts
detr_influences: Distance from places of business

source: See explanation
name: Delaware Gardens (Pensauken Township)
desc_terrain: Low level land, containing average plots 50 x 125
favor_influences: Close proximity to city of Camden and Philadelphia, good transportation
detr_influences: None

source: See explanation
name: Camden, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land laid out in plots of approximately 50 x 125
favor_influences: Eastern section of City of Camden possessing own shopping area with excellent transportation and conveniently located.
detr_influences: Heavy traffic highway known as Crescent Boulevard passing through center of area.

notes: High walls separates this section from the colored area to the south
source: See Explanation
name: Merchantville, N.J.
desc_terrain: High level land containing large homes on fairly extensive plottage, attractively landscaped
favor_influences: Zoning restrictions, near community shopping center, good transportation and marked pride of ownership
detr_influences: Negro section to the South but which should not spread.

notes: Known as "Homesteadville". It is 100% poor class Negros practically all on relief. A high wall, prevents their spread.
source: See explanations
name: Merchantville, N.J.
desc_terrain: Hillside. A small section of shacks and dalapidated homes built by Negro servants employed nearby.
favor_influences: Adjacent to better residential district of Merchantville.
detr_influences: Nature of dwellings and inhabitants.

source: See explanation
name: Pensauken Township, N.J.
desc_terrain: Hillside land more recently improved with moderately priced homes.
favor_influences: Adjacent to Borough of Merchantville with its shipping conveniences.
detr_influences: Nearness of airport and resultant noise.

source: See explanation
name: Pensauken Township, N.J.
desc_terrain: Slightly rolling land sparsely developed with small homes and bungalows.
favor_influences: Adjacent to Borough of Merchantville which is one of the highest rated boroughs from a real estate basis in south Jersey
detr_influences: High transportation rates.

notes: One of the worse sections in Camden county.
source: See explanation
name: Morrisville, N.J.
desc_terrain: Level land- poorly developed with cheapest form of construction
favor_influences: None whatever
detr_influences: Poor type of resident.

source: See explanation
name: Delair, N.J.
desc_terrain: Low land sparsley built up with many types of dwellings - most plots have large depths.
favor_influences: Newr Camden and possesses two large manufacturing plants that give employment to residents.
detr_influences: Colored district of Morrisville adjoins Delair although Delair has no Negro families and probably never will due to concentrated effort of its residents and business men to keep up the barrier.

notes: Financing is being done by seller. The neighborhood is attractive to foreign who want to be near friends in the vicinity. Better prices are obtainable from this type of buyers than other purchasers.
name: Morrellville, Johnstown, Penn
favor_influences: Near employment. Out of flood area.
detr_influences: Some smoke and dirt from mill. Many unpaved streets.

notes: Such demand as exists for properties in this section is from foreign born or of foreign percentage. Prices obtainable from this class of buyers are quoted, but in view of the short duration of their return to steady employment few are yet in a position to meet the down payment requirements for purchase. Rentals charged are in line with the income of the people and commensurate with their ability to pay. This is a fair third grade section.
name: Morrellville, Johnstown, Penn.
favor_influences: Near employment- good transportation. Fairly stable demand for units. A desirable section of foreign.
detr_influences: Some dirt and smoke from mills. Hodgepodge mixture of architecture and size of houses.

notes: This is one of the poorest sections in the Johnstown area. No financing is available under the most favorable circumstances. Housing is very poor and the section is desirable only because of cheap cost of living. Many houses have sufficient ground for truck farming.
name: Cambria Heights- Sub. Johnstown, Penn.
favor_influences: None. Out of the flood area. Fairly clean.
detr_influences: Isolated section of the very poor houses. Not readily accessible. No transportation.

notes: Although the houses in this section are similar in character to Morrellville properties, the section is not as desirable to the class of people, who want to live near the steel mills, as the other section. Development has, therefore, been very slow and sales demand is poor. Houses are well occupied because of the general shortage of quarters. Houses deeply inundated during the flood, can not be readily financed by local institutions.
name: Coopersdale- Johnstown, Penn.
favor_influences: Near employment. Transportation is adequate
detr_influences: In flood zone. Subject to smoke and dirt from mills. A very mediocre section.

notes: A very poor section of nondescript houses, many without conveniences. Section was badly flooded in 1936. Streets are unpaved in part and the general character of the neighborhood is not good, but there is good demand from foreigners who want to live in the vicinity of friends and clsoe to mills.
name: Cambria City- Johnstown, Penn
favor_influences: Near employment. Desirable to foreigners
detr_influences: Flood area. Poor housing. Dirt and smoke from R.R. and steel mill.

notes: A very small section isolated without transportation. Properties are built on steep hilside and are very poor. Values were never very high and shrinkage was as severe as possible in view of depreciation taken prior to 1929. Some original families are still living in section.
name: Johnstown, Penn.
favor_influences: Near employment
detr_influences: No transportation- smoke and dirt from mills. Partially flooded in 1936.

name: Johnstown, Penn.
desc_terrain: A sparsely settled section isolated at the top of the hill. The development is very poor and generally undesirable as a residential section. Approach to the area is very steep. Streets in the section are almost impassable. There are no sidewalks and sewer connections are not available throughout. There are less than 100 houses in this neighborhood.

notes: This section is isolated on top of a steep hill which is difficult to ascend in bad weather. Its reputation is only fair, although local residents are loyal to the section. There is not a vacant house in the area and 70 families were doubled up in September, 1937. This is a fair third grade section.
name: Brownstown- sub. Johnstown Penn.
favor_influences: Fairly clean section. No flood hazard.
detr_influences: Steep ascent into area. No shopping center. Some unpaved streets.

notes: There is little homogeneity of structures, the houses being a general mixture in size and architecture. Area is not desirable in point of health. Acid in fumes from mills is very hard on paint. Houses are concentrated principally near Ebensburg Road.
name: Prospect section- Johnstown Penn.
desc_terrain: Hilly- steeply up from the river.
favor_influences: Out of the flood area. Some remodeling of houses being done. Near employment at Cambria Steel Co.
detr_influences: Smoke and dirt from Steel Mills. Houses need paint badly. Steep ascent into area. Many unpaved streets. Sidewalks are largely lacking. Many houses have no sewers.
build_type: Singles predominate- some doubles and rows

notes: Many owners in section rent rooms to good tenants, some of which are used for light housekeeping. This is the older section of Westmont but character of the neighborhood is good. Some of the houses are not modern and the section is somewhat spotty. New construction is concentrated at southern end. Cheaper houses are at the northerrn end.
name: Westmont- Sub. Johnstown Penn.
favor_influences: Desirable section although somewhat old. Inclined plane for pedestrian traffic to commercial area. Out of flood area. Clean section.
detr_influences: Age of property. Changing neighborhood. Steep ascent up Mercher highway.

notes: Some new home being built for individual order at present. This section is a very high grade neighborhood and its character is the best, but the majority of the houses are larger than the demand is for and they are somewaht old, although in good repair. New construction is concentrated along Wayne Avenue.
name: Westmont- Sub. Johnstown Penn.
favor_influences: Highest class residential section of Johnstown. Good schools. Inclined plane for pedestrian traffic. Out of flood area.
detr_influences: Poor street car transportation. Steep ascent to section from down town commercial area.

notes: Section is attracting buyers from 8th ward. This is the newest development in the Johnstown area, but restrictions are very moderate and the area is rather spotty, although the reputation of the section is good. Financing is available on fair terms. There is no uniformity of architecture or trend in development.
name: Southmont- Sub. Johnstown Penn.
favor_influences: Good schools and transportation- fairly new section of good character. Taxes are moderate. No flood hazard.
detr_influences: Steep ascent into section. No shopping center.

notes: Western end of the area is inconvenient to schools. New construction is expected to improve the general desirability of the neighborhood but the contour of the ground is not conducive to high grade development.
name: Part of Ward 8- Johnstown Penn.
favor_influences: Out of flood area. Clean and not crowded
detr_influences: Many unpaved streets. Somewhat inaccessible in bad weather. Transportation is only fair.
