inhab_type: French, Polish & Greek, Italian shoe workers

notes: sparsely settled
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
desc_terrain: Flat. Low north of railroad tracks
favor_influences: Near schools and churches. Zoned for general residence.
detr_influences: Railroad tracks. Largely undeveloped except along Candia Road. Low and inclined to be swampy north of railroad tracks. Oil tanks and junk yards near Portsmouth Avenue.

notes: Portion west of Wilson Street is the poorest part of the area; poorer classes Polish people, congested rows old wooden tenements in poor condition.
source: Mr. Dennett & Mr. Lessard
name: Mansion, N. H.
desc_terrain: Gradual slope west from Beacon Street.
favor_influences: Close in. Near schools and churches. East portion high. Good street car transportation.
detr_influences: Western portion congested old buildings, some built over 60 years ago. Tenements. Many houses without modern plumbing and heating equipment

notes: Just West of Mammoth and Cilly Roads, E. M. Chase has built about 15 cheap brick boxlike singles on narrow lots all alike. On the other hand Sundeen Construction Co. has built 8 or 10 small frame singles of a much better character, near Mammoth Road and on Candia Road.
source: Mr. Dennett & Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: Gradually slopes from Mammoth Road and from Sunnyside Street toward Porter Street which is low.
favor_influences: Street car line continues to Mammoth Rd.
detr_influences: Low land around Porter Street where there is poor drainage. Unimproved streets.
inhab_type: shoe workers and small business people

notes: Within six months about 15 new frame single cottages have been built in the neighborhood of Roy Ave and also Vinton Street. Area sparsely settled south of Howe Street.
source: Mr. Dennett & Mr. Lessard
name: Machester, N. H.
desc_terrain: Gradual slope west from Hall Street.
favor_influences: Practically all zoned for general residence. Good schools and churches. Street car transportation 10 minutes to downtown. Generally pride of home ownership, especially East of Hall St.
detr_influences: Proximity to factories and railroad tracks.

source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: High point at South Beach and Gold Streets. Gradual slope North and East. Rolling country West of S. Beach St.
favor_influences: Near Pine Island Park. Mostly zoned for general residence. Street car transportation. School.
detr_influences: Near three cemeteries. Largely undeveloped, and unimproved streets.

notes: Poorer classes of people in cheap frame houses
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
desc_terrain: Gradual slope west to river. Rocky brush land
favor_influences: Mostly zoned for general residences
detr_influences: Largely undeveloped; unimproved streets below Brown Ave; away from schools, churches; transportation inconvenient

source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
favor_influences: Street car transportation; playground, 10 minutes walk to schools and churches; neighborhood stores; improved streets
detr_influences: Surrounded by industrial area; two through highways

source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: High and dry. Slopes East and West from Highland Street.
favor_influences: Sightly. Near Derryfield Park and Derryfield Country Club. Street car transportation on Lake Ave. Good pride of home ownership.
detr_influences: Traffic on Hanover St. which is a main highway.

source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H
desc_terrain: High point at Ashland St. Gradual slope west
favor_influences: Near grade and high schools and churches. Close in. Street car transportation.
detr_influences: Very old section. Houses not kept in good repair. A large number of old sheds and barns now abandoned. Irregular streets.
build_type: Conglomerate mixture of multi-fam. and cheap singles
lowprice: Impossible to determine because of presence of various types old obsolete buildings. Some remodelled. Rents would average $15 a month.

notes: Several old frame tenements in the area renting from $25_$35 a month per unit.
source: Mr. Dennett & Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: Slightly sloping to South and West. Fully built up, one of the old sections of the city.
favor_influences: Close in. Civic center around Beech and Concord Streets.
detr_influences: Large old singles. Traffic. Clubs and societies.

notes: In section bounded by Beech, Auburn, Chestnut, and Manchester Sts are to be found many vacant houses, partly boarded up and others which have not been painted in the last 25 years; inhabited by a mixture of foreign people.
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
desc_terrain: West portion level with a gradual rise to the east.
favor_influences: Civic center. 5 to 10 minutes walk to business center. Many schools and churches. Playgrounds and parks.
detr_influences: Congested houses in poor condition. Number of large old singles converted into two or more apartments.

notes: Best of the section is East of Wilson St. where small singles are in good repair and show evidence of prode of home ownership.
source: Mr. Dennett & Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
favor_influences: Close in. Schools and churches. Playground. Park. East of Wilson Street best of area.
detr_influences: Zoned for commercial use between Beech and Wilson Streets and zoned for apartments West of Beech. Incinerator and City Yard adjacent to the south.
relief_fam: many in E. portion, Few in W. "
build_type: multi family tenements and small singles

notes: There are three main streets in the area over which a considerable amount of traffic moves.
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: High along Belmont Street with gradual slope West towards river.
favor_influences: Zoned for general residence. Good streets. Close in. Good pride of home ownership. Good street car transportation.
detr_influences: Traffic. Webster Street a main thoroughfare through the area. State Orphan School corner Beech & Webster.

notes: Smaller units suffered less decline in value than the older large singles
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Machester, N. H.
desc_terrain: High and slightly along Union Street with gradual slope East and West.
favor_influences: Sightly. Not entirely built up but existing houses are of best construction. Grounds well planned. Good streets. Little traffic. No industrial noises or smoke.
detr_influences: None at Union St. River Road low. Railroad tracks at the river bank.

notes: 80% of structures in the area are on Arah Street. Balance of area now very sparsley settled. Most of building has taken place since 1929.
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: Gradual downward slope toward the East. Wooded land sparsely settled.
favor_influences: High. Adjacent to the best probable future development. Sightly. Freedom from noise and traffic.
detr_influences: As yet undeveloped. Only Arah Street is completed.

notes: These properties until 1936 were owned by the Amoskeag Mfg Co. and rented only to employes. Rents have been raised by Amoskeag Industries inc., the new owners. The northern part of this area is the best and newest, and tenements are rented from $18 to $24 per month per unit. Other buildings in the area are gradually being sold for business & some have been remodelled into office buildings.
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
favor_influences: Proximity to business center, schools and churches.
detr_influences: Adjacent to manufacturing section and main railroad line. Very old/mill houses in fair to poor condition brick

notes: Many of these cottages have been built by the owners themselves with no plan or design. Although several streets are shown on the map, they are not actually laid out.
source: Mr. Dennett & Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
desc_terrain: Low lying valley through which runs a brook, tributary to the Merrimack, although the brook is being piped by W.P.A.
favor_influences: Zoned for general residence
detr_influences: Almost entirely undeveloped. No transportation facilities. Unimproved streets. No schools. Only Eve St. built up

notes: Houses along Coolidge Ave average about $7,000 in value. These are frame singles about 10 yrs old in good condition set apart with lawns and shrubbery. Just below Coolidge Ave to the east the land drops off precipitously about 30 ft to Area D4 and is the location of a city dump
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: High level land. Sparsely settled north of Mason St. Partly rock ledges.
favor_influences: Rock Rimmon Park and municipal swimming pool. Street car and bus transportation adequate. Good schools and churches. Zoned for general residence.
detr_influences: Houses old congested closely built in the southern part of the area. 15-20 minutes' ride to down-town business center. Generally poorer classes on side of river.
inhab_type: French mill workers & small business men

notes: The northern strip of this area along the river bank is occupied by summer colonists in single frame summer cottages in good condition valued at an average of about $1,000. These are in a single line at the river edge. There are no other houses in this sector.
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
favor_influences: near mills. Schools. Churches
detr_influences: Proximity to manufacturing area and river and very sparsely settled. Unimproved roads. Exposed to flood damage. Near ice houses

notes: Amony St. is about 30 ft. above the adjacent "flats" to which it is connected by a cement stairway at Bartlett St. Access to the "flats" only from Blucker St. on the south; Putnam St. from the East or Bartlett St. on the North. Dubuque and Cartier are dead end streets coming up abruptly to a 40 foot sand bank.
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: Gradual slope south and east of Gossler Park. Low land west of the park known as "The Flats".
favor_influences: Good schools and churches, adequate transportation. Gossler Park an amusement center. West of the park zoned for general residence. Close to mills.
detr_influences: Flooded near the Piscataquog River in 1936. East of Gossler Park zoned for apartments and a great many 6 tenement houses are now to be found here.
inhab_type: Mixed foreign mill workers and cigar makers

notes: Wet wash laundry and a shoe shop near the Piscataquog river in area flooded Spring of 1936
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
desc_terrain: High near the center and sloping toward both rivers.
favor_influences: near West Manchester business center and high school. Good grade schools, churches and transportation.
detr_influences: Railroad and a considerable number of old houses in poor repair. One of the oldest sections of the west side.

notes: The best of this section lies between Mast and Boynton Streets where some professional people and business executives live with an average income of approximately $6,000
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N. H.
desc_terrain: Rolling country, gradually rising from the river. Largely undeveloped open fields to the southwest.
favor_influences: Quiet section. Not much through traffic. Schools and churches. Good street car transportation as well as bus lines.
detr_influences: Danger of floods near the two rivers. Oldest part on the West side. Many houses not equipped with modern heating and plumbing.

notes: A separate little community with its own stores, churches, schools and branch post office. Near Manchester's new airport. This is section is known as Goffs Falls. Fleischer Shoe Co. has a factory at this point.
source: Mr. Dennett and Mr. Lessard
name: Manchester, N.H.
desc_terrain: High along Brown Ave. Steep incline to river.
favor_influences: Street car transportation; adjacent to Pine Island Park, a summer resport, school, churches and business center in vicinity.
detr_influences: Exposed to flood damage

source: See explanations
name: Endicott- N. Y.
desc_terrain: A sparsely settled area of low priced homes ranging from shacks to cheaply constructed bungalos. Land is generally rolling.
favor_influences: Low taxes.
detr_influences: lack of restrictions and city improvements

notes: At th west end of this section, Endicott-Johnson Corporation is building a number of homes. Most construction in this section has been done by this Corperation.
source: See explanations
name: Endicott- N.Y.
desc_terrain: An are of medium priced one family residences comprimising a part of the former Town of Union. At the west end, the Edicott-Johnson Corp. is building a number of new hoems for their workers. Land is low and flats.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks and bus transportation. Supervision of the Endicott-Johnson Corppration.
detr_influences: Uniformity of design

source: See explanations
name: Endicott- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Ground rising from the river. A section of medium prived residences of one and one-half amd two story construction. Dwellings, both one and two family, are well constructed and a marked pride of ownershup is noticeable. Swampland to the northeast is being filled in by degrees.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks and bus transportation.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Skilled mechanics, minor business and professional men

source: See explanations
name: Endicott- N. Y.
desc_terrain: Lad is low in south but hilly in north. This section includes three areas of similar and identical characteristics; the development of which was undertaken at about the same time by the Endicott-Johnson Corp. for their employees. Condition of structures is mixed but reconditioning will be undertaken with improvement in economic conditions.
favor_influences: Good schools and churches. Nearness to work.
detr_influences: Cheapness of construction and sporrt pride of ownership.

source: See Explanations
name: Endicott - N.Y.
desc_terrain: An area of medium priced dwellings ranging from bungalows to two story homes well maintained and displaying a marked pride of ownership. This area is divided into five sections by an intervening business area. Land is generally flat.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks, city improvements and bus transportation. Nearness to places of work.
detr_influences: None.
inhab_type: White collar, skilled mechs business & professional men

notes: Very few rentals occur in this section as it is chiefly owner occupied.
source: See explanations
name: Endicott- N.Y.
desc_terrain: A small area occupied almost exclusively by executives of the Endicott-Johnson Corporation. The best residential section in the town and zoned for single family homes. Land is flat.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks and bus transportation. Pride of ownership well displayed.
detr_influences: None

source: See explanations
name: Town of Vestal- N. Y.
desc_terrain: An area of low cost houses which was started in teh boom of 1926, afiled and slightly revined this year. Land is flat and low
favor_influences: Low taxes.
detr_influences: Lack of improvements and restrictions, poor transportation and inconvenient to schools, churches and business.

source: See explanations
name: Township pf vestal- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Flat, low land forming a sparsely settled area outside the village of Vestal.This subdivision of low cost homes was started in 1926, went flat and is being moderately revived. Low priced land and cheap construction furnishes a price attraction.
favor_influences: Low taxes.
detr_influences: Lack of restrictions, subject to floods, cheapness of construction and lack of transportation.

notes: New construction is of the bungalow type @ $4,000
source: See explanations
name: Vestal- N. Y.
desc_terrain: An old, small, quiet, upstate country village built on rolling land.
favor_influences: Low taxes and nearness to the triple cities
detr_influences: Lack of city improvements and restrictions

source: See explanations
name: Johnson City N.Y
desc_terrain: An area of medium priced one and two family homes displaying a marked pride of ownership. In teh unprecendented floods of last year, this section suffered severely but future danger is being eliminated by a flood control project. Land is low but rises to north.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks, and bus service
detr_influences: Movement of foreigners from the south.

source: See explanations
name: Johnson City - N.Y.
desc_terrain: An area largely developed by the Endicott-Hohnson Corp. for their factory workers although there are a few scattered dwellings which were erected by individuals. Homes generally contain five to six rooms and though of plain design are of diversified architecture. Newer construction is taking place in teh sparsely settled area on rising ground. Land is other-wise low and flat.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and playground. Nearness of work.
detr_influences: Cheapness of construction and poorness in transporatation.

notes: There were fewer foreclosures in this area than in any other part of the city. That, plus a high degree of home ownershup, accounts for the stability in property values and rents.
source: See explanations.
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low land rising to the north. A section of one and two family low cost house into which both industry and business is making inroads. Condition of structures is but fair although considerable reconditioning is in process. There were fewer foreclosures in this area than in any other part of the city.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, playgrounds and bus transportation. Nearness to work and civic improvements.
detr_influences: Near and encroachment of industry.

desirability: Static- until flood condition is corrected.
notes: When flood hazzards are corrected, this area should improve materially is desirability. Increases in values and rents is largely in anticipation of early completion of the flood control project.
source: See explations
name: Binghamton - N.Y.
desc_terrain: An old section of the city developed with one and two family structures which are rapidly deteriorating. There is little evidence of any pride of ownership. The  land is low and has been subject to floods but this should be eliminated by a flood control project which is nearing completion.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and playgrounds, Nearness to work and center city.
detr_influences: Poor pride of ownership and danger of floods

notes: West of teh Bible School Park, off Rivereside Drive, teh Endicott-Johnson Corporation is building 50 new homes for their workers. Sameness of design is the only objectional feature.
source: See explanations
name: Johnson City - N.Y.
desc_terrain: Slightly rolling land. A newer development of medium priced homes largely erected by the Endicott-Johnson Corporation. Streets are landscared and dwellings placed on deep and wide lots. Pride of ownership  and general attractiveness is most noticeable.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks and bus transportation. Nearness to work yet far enough removed to be pleasant.
detr_influences: None.

notes: The small yellow section, which is occupied by Germans, is not quite so desirable.
source: See Explanations.
name: Binghamton N.Y.
desc_terrain: Flat land sloping toward river. An older section of medium prived one and one-half and two story dwellings. Streets are landscaped and properties well maintained by save in the small yellow area where houses are in need paint repairs.
favor_influences: Good parks, schools, churches and bus transportation. Civic propection and improvements.
detr_influences: None.
inhab_type: White collar, office workers business and professional men

notes: Main street is one of the main arteries through to the west
source: See explantion
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: An old section of the city in which the trend is toward conversion of old, large homes into boarding houses and apartments. Pride of owership is very spotty. Land is generally low though rises in the west.
favor_influences: Good schools, parks, churches and bus and trolley transportation. Civic protection and imrpovements.
detr_influences: Trend to rooming houses and infiltration of Jews.
inhab_type: Skilled laborers and white collar class

notes: There is a small tract at the extreme west end of the section of from $10,000 to $18,000 homes now being constructed. There are about ten of these homes either built or under construction at present and there is no difficulty in selling them.
source: See explanations
name: Bingamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land inclining toward the river. One of the best and most desirable residential sections in the city. Zoned for single family homes with well landscaped streets and properties, it contains many of the newer and more moderately priced dwellings. Pride of ownership is evident.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, park and transportation. Well kept streets and properties.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Executives, high class business and professional men.

notes: There are very few rentals on this section and figures are based chiefly on anticipation.
source: See explanations
name: Binghamton - N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land is low and flat. An are zoned for single family homes and containing the highest valued dwellings in the entire district. Houses are generally large and on properties of substantial size. Pride of ownership is well displayed.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks and transporation. Well maintained streets and properties.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Exec, merchants, business and professional men

notes: At the extreme west end of this tract, near the golf course, there has been planned, and now in the process of erection, a development of small homes $5,000 to $9,000 that are selling well. This, however, has no influence on this section from the standpoint of reducing its desirability.
source: See explanations
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling land. A newer development south of the Susquehanna River zoned for singles family homes. It this, one of the city's best residential sections, are found a number of soundly constructed and well maintained dwellings.
favor_influences: Good transportation and well maintained streets and properties
detr_influences: Slightly inconvenient to schools, churches and the business center.

source: See explanation
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: As unrestricted area of old, cheaply constructed dwellings gradually developed into a business and shopping district. In the portion south of the city line, city improvements are lacking and cellars suffer from water seeping from springs in the surrounding hills. Land is low and flat.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and transportation.
detr_influences: Lack of pride of ownership.

source: See explanations
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: gradually rising land. An older section of moderately priced one and two family residences. Although sitated across Susquenhanna River, five bridges connect with the main portion of the city. The adjoining industrial section does not adversely affect this area and makes it particularly desirable to factory workers.
favor_influences: Good schools, park, churches and bus transportation. Pride of ownership is evident.
detr_influences: None

source: See explanation
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, flat land which is a sparsely settled section of cheaply built, incongruous homes. Paved streets exist only in spots and there is little attractiveness in the entire area.
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Low, flat land, no restrictions, cheap construction and lack of improvements.

source: See explantion
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Lowland subject to flooding and containing single and multi-family dwellings. many of which are badly in need of paing and repair. There is little evidence of any pride of ownership. A sharp rise in topography seperates this section from adjoing ones and prevens the spread of adverse influences.
favor_influences: Good to schools and transporation. Near to work.
detr_influences: Annual flooding, condition of structures and type of inhabitant.

source: See explanations
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: A very old, un restricted area containing a mixture of poorly maintained and cheaply constructed homes and multi-family dwellings. Nusiness is rapidly making inraods and will eventually absorb this entire section. Land is flat
favor_influences: Good schools and transportion. Nearness to business and shopping center.
detr_influences: Inhabitants and lack of pride of ownership.

source: See explanation
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: An older unrestricted section of one and two family dwellings and multi-family structures in the hreat of the business section . Along Court Street are a number of apartments and between Hawley and Court Streets, many tenement-like structures. Land is flat.
favor_influences: Good schools and proximity ti shopping district and places of work
detr_influences: Type of inhabitants and structures.

source: See explanations
name: Binghamton - N.Y
desc_terrain: An area of moderately prived singles and two family homes, displaying a good pride of ownership. Location makes this section most desirable to skilled laborers, office workers and railed road employees. Land is flat but becomes rolling in the east.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, playgrounds and transportation. Pride of ownership is evident
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Mechanics, R.R. workers & white collar class

source: See explanation
name: Binghamton- N.Y.
desc_terrain: Generally low land rising in the northeast and east. An area of low priced homes on each side of a large industrial and railroad section. There is little pride of ownership, and dwellings are generally in need of repairs and paint.
favor_influences: Good schools and transportation.
detr_influences: Neighboring factories and railroads

source: See explanations
name: Binghamton- N. Y. Port Dickinson
desc_terrain: Land is low, flat and in the west slopes toward the river. An area of medium priced home of mixed architecture. Older construction is generally two story frame but newer trend is towards bungalow type. In the north, the paralleling industrial and railroad sections do not affect the desirability of the neighborhoods.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks and bus transportation. Pride of ownership and city improvements
detr_influences: None.

notes: New area. Probably not over 50 homes built.
name: Richmond, Virginia
desc_terrain: Flat, with roll enough to drain

notes: An area of well planned, one family, detached dwellings situated on fairly small but well kept plots. Architecture varies but is harmonious and pride of ownership is everywhere in evidence. Mortgage lenders are greatly attracted to this area.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: An attractive and convenient location.
detr_influences: Possibility of smoke from nearby industrail area.

notes: This is a section which is bisected by an industrial area and bordering on the railroad yards. Homes are small, poorly built, lack any architectural variation and suffer from dirt and constant smoke. Many streets are unpaved and in all the area presents an unsightly appearance. One small portion of this area extends beyond the city limits. Lenders steer absolutely clear of this section and will sacrifice properties at any obtainable price.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Convenient to places of employment.
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood and occupant.

notes: This is an older section of the city containing small, cheaply constructed, one family homes, a number of which seem to be badly in need of repairs. Notwithstanding, this area presents fair housing facilities for railroad workers.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Proximity to places of employment.
detr_influences: Character of construction and smoke from railroad yards.

notes: An area of new, modern homes of varied but attractive architecture. Grounds are in proportion to the size of dwelling and are well landscaped. Throughout, there is a decided evidence of pride of ownership. Lenders consider this a prime area.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, flat land overlooking Niagara Gorge
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location and development as well as pleasant outlook.
detr_influences: None.

notes: This is an older section which still holds its attraction. Dwellings are modest in size, of a somewhat similar architecture but, because of narrowness of plots, built quite closely together. Lack of pride of ownership if the exception rather than the rule.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Convenient to center of city and places of employment.
detr_influences: Possible danger of infiltration of a less desirable element.

notes: This is an older section which once contained many large and attractive homes. These since have been converted into apartments, rooming houses and tourist homes because of their proximity to the "Falls". It has also become an area for hotels and apartments. *Desirability continues to decline but not intrinsic
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Nearness to the "Falls" and business section.
detr_influences: Deterioration.

notes: This is a newer development of attractive, small homes adjacent to a park on which considerable money has been recently spent. Plots are of fair size so that buildings are not too close together. Near the park there has recently been a sizeable amount of "jerry" building which lenders materially discount in making loans.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location and development.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city.

notes: This is a somewhat older section of the city all built at about the same time and in about the same type of construction. Plots are small and dwellings are close together. Its centralness of location makes it convenient to the several industrial areas and the shopping center; hence, its attraction to factory workers.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Convenient to center of city.
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood and inhabitant.

notes: This is a section which is divided into two similar portions by an industrial area. Dwellings are small, poorly and cheaply constructed and suffer badly from smoke and fumes emanating from adjacent chemical plants. Local sources refuse to lend in this area and whenever possible, will dump properties.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Proximity to places of employment.
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood and odors from chemical plants.

notes: This is an older, residential section where many of the leading citizens still reside and which has managed to withstand the trend toward tourist houses. Dwellings are of substantial size but of attractive and varied architecture. Smallness of lots gives a congested appearance. Because of size and age, there is no demand except at extreme sacrifice prices.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Conveniently located with pleasant outlook over the "Rapids" and above the "Falls".
detr_influences: Age and size of dwellings.

notes: Most of this area represents a new, speculative development of very small but attractive modern and inexpensive homes built on fair sized lots. The balance is slightly older and comprises a mixture of bungalows and slightly larger dwellings. Few streets in this area are paved. The new homes are reported to be "jerry" built and lenders are cautious in making loans on these.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of development.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city.

notes: This is an unrestricted area consisting of rather cheaply constructed, small, single family homes. Design is quite uniform and not overly pleasing. Lots are small and pride of ownership is very spotty. Very few streets are paved. That portion of the area to the west rates a higher "Yellow" and is more in favor among the lenders.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: None.
detr_influences: Distance to places of employment.

notes: This is an area of considerable intermingling. Some houses are mere bungalows; others are of fair size with plots sufficiently large so that there is no appearance of congestion. On the whole, pride of ownership is evident. Only the principal thorough-fares are paved.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
favor_influences: Atmosphere of a country town.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city.

notes: A fair sized island still only partially developed at the eastern end. This should have been a most desirable location but construction of homes has been indiscriminate with the result that there is a mixture of small bungalows intermingled with small and even large homes. Plots are narrow and houses are, for the most part, very close together. But few streets are paved.
source: See Explanations
name: Niagara Falls, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Flat island land which is well wooded.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city and lack of all civic improvements.

notes: These 6 areas contain about 35 houses, practically all of which are of modern construction.
source: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., McHugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.
name: Mobile, Alabama
desc_terrain: Level to elevated. Principal subdivisions known as Woodlawn (A-1), Beverly Hills (A-3), Du Broca Tract (A-4 ,5) and Roberts-Hunter Tract (A-6).
favor_influences: Proximity to $1,000,000 public high school; good transportation facilities, practically all streets paved, presence of neighborhood business center. All utilities in.
detr_influences: None

desirability: Static for next 5 years, then probably slowly downward with age of buildings
notes: These six areas contain about 175 houses. In the eastern portion of B-3 along the western side of Monterey Street to Lamar Street, there is an older type of property which is in poorer repair condition than that of the remainder of the section. (Should be given C rating).
source: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., McHugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.
name: Mobile, Alabama
desc_terrain: Level with some rolling. Principal subdivisions known as Park Terrace (B-3), Carlin Street East (B-4), Silverwood (B-5), Fearn Way (B-6), Blacklawn (B-7), and Westwood-Homewood Section (B-8).
favor_influences: Good transportation facilities. Near public high school, grammar schools, and Memorial Park. All utilities in.
detr_influences: None
inhab_type: Young business, clerical and professional men

notes: Old Folks Home (aged and destitute) located in C-2 on McGill Avenue; it is quiet and nicely kept, hence not detrimental. *Local lenders and insurance companies lend only on restricted basis while FHA makes no distinction. (See next page for continuation)
source: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., McHugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.
name: Mobile, Alabama
desc_terrain: Level. Principal subdivision known as Demouy, Bienville, West End, Macy Place, Monterey Place, Reed's and Florence Place subdivisions.
favor_influences: All utilities; C-2 all streets paved, C-4 no streets paved. Transportation facilities. Good type of citizens.
detr_influences: Zoning ordinance not strictly enforced.
inhab_type: Mixed: Good salaried workers, business and professional men

notes: *Lenders will lend only on a restricted basis. In C-6 along both sides of Government Street and the southern side of new Government Street and northern side of Myrtle Street, extending from the southeastern corner of Cherokee and Government Streets, extending westward to the railroad tracks, is located some well-kept, high grade residential property which should be classified as B property.
source: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., McHugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.
name: Mobile, Alabama
desc_terrain: Level. Principal subdivisions known as Delacroix Place, Du Broca Tract, West End, Fulton Homes, and Bon Air subdivisions.
favor_influences: All utilities in C-6; also community business center in this area.
detr_influences: No city sewerage in portion of C-5 which is outside the city limits. About 25% of the streets paved. Outlying portions of C-6 not served by street cars. No zoning. C-6 traversed by railroad.

source: See Explanations
name: Pelham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, but rolling and wooded land. An exclusive residential section of the highest type. Houses are large and of pleasing design. Grounds are extensive and beautifully maintained.
favor_influences: Everything.
detr_influences: Nothing.

source: See Explanations
name: Pelham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Undulating land which, for the most part, is well wooded. Development, which has been going on for some years, includes everything from the moderate to large dwellings and a few scattered apartments. Lots are in proportion.
favor_influences: Well and attractively located
detr_influences: None.

notes: Rental increases due to demand for small homes.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, flat land. This is an area of some age. North of the Post Road homes are of fair construction but those to the south are cheaply built. Plots are small and there is the appearance of congestion in the north.
favor_influences: None.
detr_influences: Obnoxious odors from adjacent sewerage disposal plant.

source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Generally flat land. A thickly populated section containing everything from singles to cheap apartments; all given over to a lower class.
favor_influences: Conveniently located.
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood and inhabitants.

source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land slopes downward to east and south. An older section of the city which is feeling the expansion of business and the poorer areas in the center and south. Trend is to apartments and conversion into rooming houses and small units. Plots are small.
favor_influences: Proximity to center of city.
detr_influences: Encroachment of business and infiltration of less desirable elements.
infiltration: Singles, doubles and a few appts.
build_type: Singles, doubles and a few apts.

notes: Demand has never cassed and there is a waiting list for vacant units. It seems a particularly desirable spot for Negros who desire to move from Harlem.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High land sloping to the east. An old section of the city now given over to Negros. Nearly all the dwellings have been converted into small units.
favor_influences: Conveniently located.
detr_influences: Type of inhabitants.

notes: In the northeast corner are a few Negros but well confined and not affecting the area. In the south, the railroad and vacant lots form the only barrier between this and the adjacent hazardous area. (\n) Lack of small, convenient, rental units has served to stabilize rents.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Ridgeland sloping to east and west. An older section in which singles predominate but which also contains some doubles. Lots are small and consequently there is not much space between dwellings.
favor_influences: Conveniently located.
detr_influences: Possible spread of less desirable element in central and southern portions.

notes: A steep, wooded hill separates this section from the less desirable ones to the west.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Wooded land sloping to the west. A new section of modern homes of fair size and of varied bu attractive architecture. Plots are small but well maintained.
favor_influences: Convenient and attractive.
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: Pelham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling and wooded land. An older section of fairly large homes located on sizeable plots which are well maintained.
favor_influences: Well and conveniently located.
detr_influences: Age of structures.

source: See Explanatins
name: Pelham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, hollow land. This is an older section now largely devoted to dwellings of from 2 to 4 units. Balance includes scattered tenements an singles.
favor_influences: Centrally located.
detr_influences: Deterioration of neighborhood and inhabitants.

source: See Explanatioons.
name: Palham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, flat land. An older residential section which now contains a mixture of single family homes of varying age and state of condition and a few multi-family.
favor_influences: Proximity to center of community.
detr_influences: Deterioration of neighborhood.

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High ridgeland sloping to the west and south. This is an older section developed by a local family. Improvements include singles, community row houses, a large hotel and a number of high class apartments.
favor_influences: Unusually convenient and quite attractive.
detr_influences: Trend to multi-family

notes: There were a number of foreclosures in this section accounting for the excessive decline in values.
source: See Explanations
name: Pelham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling and wooded terrain. A section of sizeable homes of fair age on lots of substantial size. Grounds are well cared for and show distinct pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Convenient for all purpose
detr_influences: Size and age of homes.

source: See Explanations
name: Pelham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling, wooded land. A somewhat newer section containing a wide variety of dwellings. For the most part, plots are of fair size and all well cared for. Pride of ownership is evident.
favor_influences: Convenience and attraction.
detr_influences: None.

notes: This neighborhood is considered particularly desirable because of its fine, modern high school.
source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, rolling ground. This section contains a mixture of the old and the new and includes singles, doubles and some high class apartments. Lots are of fair size and evidence pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Location
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Slightly rolling terrain. A somewhat older section originally developed by speculative builders and influenced by Bronx County to the south. Houses are similar in design and quite closely built.
favor_influences: Conveniently located.
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood.

source: See Explanations.
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low land adjoining and adversely influenced by Bronx County on the south. This is an old section of closely built two and three family homes now given over to Negros and low class foreigners. A slum clearance project was considered but abandoned.
favor_influences: None
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood and occupants.

desirability: Stable, unless there be a shifting of population from Bronx County.
source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low land which has been developed with small homes, many of the bungalow type. Although plots are small, they are well maintained and evidence pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Strong appeal to the modest income group.
detr_influences: Possible influx of less desirable element from the Bronx.

source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling land. This is an older section containing fair sized houses built quite closely together. Architecture is similar and of a vintage now out of vogue.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Age and size of dwellings.

source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Flat land. An old section of the city which is gradually going to business. Houses are quite large and many have been altered into small apartments and boarding houses.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Encroachment of business.

source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Flat land sloping downward to the west. An older section of the city containing a density of cheaply constructed small homes built close together. In the east is a small area of two blocks occupied by Negros.
favor_influences: Conveniently located
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood.

source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land high at the limits but sinking to low in bowl formation. A somewhat newer development ranging from the moderate to houses of fair size. Plots are small and dwellings built fairly close together. There are some scattered apartments.
favor_influences: Convenient location
detr_influences: Topography of the land.
inhab_type: small business men and white collar

desirability: Stable but to better class apartments
source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Slightly rolling land. A medium class residential section of moderate sized homes on small lots. Architectural design is varied and pleasing. Near the Fleetwood Station, along Gramatan Ave. and in the southwest corner, are several large, modern apartment houses.
favor_influences: Favorable location
detr_influences: Increasing apartment house construction.
inhab_type: Small business men and department heads

source: See Explanations
name: Pelham, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Valley land. An older section containing a variety of singles and doubles which, generally, have seen their better days. Pride of ownership is decidedly spotty.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Decline in type of inhabitant.

source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Ground slopes upward to north. An old section of the city which is feeling the encroachment of business. Homes are mostly large and many are being altered into multi-family units and boarding houses.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Encroachment of business and change to a section of multi-family dwellings.

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling land. A more recent development of small modern homes on small plots. Dwellings are of varied but attractive architecture, well maintained and evidence a decided pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Conveniantly located.
detr_influences: None

notes: Excessive shrinkage in property values was due to complete lack of demand for homes of this size.
source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y
desc_terrain: Rolling and well wooded terrain. This is an area of large, modern homes of varied but attractive architecture. Plots are large in cases approaching small estates. Landscaping is excellent and pride of ownership most marked.
favor_influences: Convenience and attractiveness of entire area.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Acreage and farm land gives promise of being ultimately developed in a manner waranting a "second grade" classification.
source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling and wooded land. With the exception of a few new homes recently constructed by their owners in the northwestern corner, the balance of the section comprises large, undeveloped acreages and farms.
favor_influences: Conveniently located
detr_influences: None.  (\n) THE FOLLOWING APPLIES TO THE FEW HOMES ONLY

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low land lying in a hollow. A congested section containing a mixture of singles, doubles and cold water flats, all of substantial age.
favor_influences: Conveniently located.
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood and occupants.

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High land sloping steeply in center to Main Street. A fairly congested section containing a mixture of old singles and doubles.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Character of neighborhood and inhabitants.

source: See Explanations
name: Mount Vernon, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Slightly rolling land. An excellent residential section containing modern homes of varied but attractive design located on well landscaped plots of fair size. South of Ellewood Avenue are several large, high class apartments. These eastern end of the section is only sparsely developed.
favor_influences: Good and convenient location. Marked pride of ownership.
detr_influences: None.

notes: In the southwest corner a wide street forms a natural barrier between this and the less desirable section. In the north, a sharp grade definitely separates 1st from adjoining areas of lesser attraction.
source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling, wooded land. A section of modern homes of attractive design on fair sized and well landscaped plots. The entire area is pleasant and shows marked pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Excellence of location.
detr_influences: None.

notes: The Bronx River Parkway acts as a barrier between this and its more desirable neighbor to the west. A wide highway similarly separates it on the south.
source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low land, well wooded. A section of old homes which has deteriorated substantially. Homes are of moderate size, plots are small and pride of ownership is lacking.
favor_influences: Convenience of location
detr_influences: Encroachment of business.

notes: This section is inconvenient to the center of Yonkers which is, in no way, detrimental. Residents consider themselves as living in Bronxville which adjoins to the west, use the Bronxville stores and station for commuting purposes as well as its Post Office and telephone exchange. In the extreme southeastern tip, there are a few, large, modern apartment houses which do not affect even the immediately adjoining properties. The less desirable and only sparsely settled section to the west is not an adverse influence as there is sufficient undeveloped territory between the two.
source: See Explanation
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A highly restricted, residential area developed of which occurred more recently. Improvements comprise single family homes of substantial size and attractive design. Plots are large and well landscaped. Land is rolling and wooded.
favor_influences: Character of occupants and improvements; zoning restrictions and attractiveness of location.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Although this section is at a considerable distance from the heart of Yonkers proper, this is not a detrimental influence. Residents are commuter to New York and use the Tuckahoe and Crestwood Stations and stores immediately to the east.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y
desc_terrain: Rolling and wooded land comprising a highly restricted area. Developed is more recent and improvements include only single family homes located on plottages of fair size which are well landscaped and evidence a decided pride of ownership. Central section as well as a portion to the west of Central Park Avenue is only sparsely improved.
favor_influences: Character of occupant and improvements, zoning restrictions and attractiveness of location.
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land slopes to the east. This is a sparsely settled section occupied mostly by laborers from the nearby stone quarry, who purchased small plots and thereon built homes; many of which are self-constructed.
favor_influences: Eventually, present structures will be demolished and this will be a portion of section "A-2".
detr_influences: General character of present neighborhood.

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, rolling land sparsely improved. Development has been recent but of a speculative nature. Homes are modern, of modest size but construction is cheap. Plots are moderate in size.
favor_influences: Attractive location
detr_influences: Inconvenient to stores and for commuting.

source: See Explanations.
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High ridgeland sloping steeply toward the river. Generally an older section containing dwellings of substantial size located on fairly large lots. Property is well landscaped and cared for.
favor_influences: Attractively and conveniently located.
detr_influences: None, save possible size and age of homes.

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High and rolling land. The majority of this section comprises a cheap speculative development of small homes on small plots.
favor_influences: Pleasant location.
detr_influences: Inconvenient for commuting.

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High land. An area containing a combination of old and new small homes on equally small lots.
favor_influences: None.
detr_influences: Inconvenient from every angle.

source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High ridgeland sloping steeply to the river. Section contains moderately priced homes generally on small lots, are well cared for and show decided pride of ownership. Between she railroad tracks and the river are nothing but large, modern apartments which do not adversely affect the section.
favor_influences: Convenient and attractive location.
detr_influences: None.

desirability: Will depend entirely upon eventual disposition of present properties.
notes: Because of stability of owners these properties never appear on the market.
source: See Explanations
name: Eastchester, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, wooded and well landscaped terrain. A section of old, large estates exactly maintained. There are two factories near the station but of a character and so located that their influence is not adverse.
favor_influences: Both attractive and convenient.
detr_influences: Acreages are too extensive and homes too large.

source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling and wooded ground. A slightly older section of small but modern homes of pleasing architecture. Plots are of medium size and well landscaped. Pride of ownership is evident.
favor_influences: Entire character of area.
detr_influences: Distance from stores, schools, churches, etc.

notes: A number of these estates will ulitmately be broken up and sold for development purposes.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: An area of large estates, some of which include small farms. Dwellings are equally large, though of varying age. Terrain is high, rolling and well wooded.
favor_influences: Character of area and its occupants.
detr_influences: Distance from stores and churches.

source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A newer and high type residential development. Ground is high and on well landscaped plots of fair size are large, modern homes displaying a decided pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Entire character of development.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city and stores.

source: See Explanations
name: Town of Mamaroneck, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, rolling and wooded land. A newer section containing modern homes of moderate size. Architecture is varied and pleasing. Plots are of fair size and well landscaped. Pride of ownership is most noticeable.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location and development.
detr_influences: Distance from schools, churches and shopping district.

desirability: Stable, unless replaced by more desirable homes.
source: See Explanations
name: Town of Mamaroneck, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, wooded land. This small section was built some years prior to development of the surrounding area. Houses and lots are small, cheaply built and in not too good condition.
favor_influences: Desirable location.
detr_influences: Slightly inconvenient.

source: See Explanations
name: Town of Mamaroneck, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, rolling and wooded terrain. Formerly an area of estates many of which have been broken up to permit the erection of moderately sized homes. Grounds are ample and well landscaped. Pride of ownership is evident. Several large apartments surround the Larchmont Station.
favor_influences: Attractively and conveniently located.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Vacancies are all in the upper brackets. (\n) Negros are confined to a few shacks on Palmer Avenue midway between the Larchmont Station and the New Rochelle line.
source: See Explanations
name: Town of Mamaroneck, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Level land. An area of homes of substantial size and age but, nevertheless, well kept up. Grounds are spacious and maintained in excellent condition
favor_influences: Accessible location
detr_influences: None, save age and size of structures.
inhab_type: Executives, artists and retired business men

notes: The only vacancies are new homes which remain unsold and these will doubtlessly be disposed of shortly.
source: See Explanations.
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, rolling and wooded land. A new development of modern homes of moderate size. Architecture is varied and attractive. Plots are of fair size and well landscaped.
favor_influences: Attractive of development and location.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Demand for small units has forced rents up.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land rises to the north. Generally an older section of moderately priced homes on plots of fair size. Dwellings are well constructed and maintained.
favor_influences: Proximity to stores and stations. Section contains school.
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, rolling and well wooded land. This is a newer section of the city containing modern houses of varying sizes located on lots of proportionate extent. Architecture is varied but pleasing and pride of ownership is everywhere evident.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location and improvements
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Generally flat land. An old portion of the city in which many of the homes are being converted into two and three family dwellings. Particularly in the north, structures are quite congested.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Deterioration of neighborhood and inhabitants.

notes: Rental demand for the type of home and unit in this area has permitted rental increases.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High, rolling land. Originally, a speculative development of moderatly priced homes. Though zoned for doubles. singles predominate. Lots are only of medium size.
favor_influences: Proximity to shopping center and station.
detr_influences: Cheapness of construction and possibility of deterioration.

notes: Demand for small units has resulted in rental increases.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High land sloping to the south and east. An area of small homes and bungalows built on equally small lots. Pride of ownership is only occasionally evident.
favor_influences: Adjacent to park and playground.
detr_influences: Character of improvements and inhabitants. Only fair transportation.

source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, rolling land. An older section containing many large homes located on sizeable plots. Notwithstanding their age, properties are well landscaped and evidence a decided pride of ownership. A few scattered and high class apartments have no adverse effect.
favor_influences: Conveniently located.
detr_influences: Size and age of homes.

notes: Demand for cheap quarters has held up rents.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, flat land. An area of cheaply constructed singles and doubles lacking any pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Adjacent park and playground.
detr_influences: Entire character of neighborhood.

notes: Demand for cheap quarters has held up rents.
source: See Explanations
name: Town of Mamaroneck, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, flat land. An area of cheaply constructed singles and doubles lacking any pride of ownership. Section is only sparsely settled.
favor_influences: Extremely convenient.
detr_influences: Character of improvements and inhabitants.

notes: Along the Post Road are several high class apartments.
source: See Explanations.
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, well wooded terrain. An old section containing homes of substantial size and age. In the north, some are being converted into two and three family units. In the south, many approach estates in size. Landscaping is good and pride of ownership marked.
favor_influences: Favorable and convenient location.
detr_influences: Size and age of homes.

notes: Lack of demand is due to the size of dwellings and their expensive upkeep.
source: See Explanations
name: Town Mamaroneck, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, flat land almost entirely surrounded by water. Homes and grounds are large, architecture is modern and attractive, landscaping is good and there is marked pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Attractiveness and convenience of location.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Vacancies are mostly in the largest houses.
source: See Explanations
name: Town of Mamaroneck, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, but wooded land. An area of old and sizeable homes built on fairly large plots. Despite their age, properties are well maintained and evidence pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Attractive and convenient location.
detr_influences: Age of dwellings.
inhab_type: Executives, artists and retired business men.

notes: Lack of demand is due to the size of dwellings and their expensive upkeep.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low, flat land almost entirely surrounded by water. Homes and grounds are large, architecture is modern and attractive, landscaping is good and there is a marked pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Attractiveness and convenience of location
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land sloping downward from Central Avenue to Bronx River Valley. Development has been more recent although generally of a cheap nature. Dwellings include singles, doubles and a few modern apartments. This section offers excellent commuting service and has its own shopping center.
favor_influences: Convenience of location despite distance from heart of Yonkers.
detr_influences: Cheapness of construction and trend to apartments.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Gently sloping land adjacent to the City of New York. Commuting facilities are very good and Mc Lean Avenue offers an excellent shopping center. Improvements are a mixture of one and two family homes together with apartments but, generally, construction is cheap.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Jerry building and influx of less desirable element from Bronx County.
infiltration: Less desirable type of native white

notes: That portion east of Seminary Avenue in the north lacks answers. Lee, Devoe and Kneeland Avenues, between Midland Terrace and Wendover Road, are decidedly more desirable. This, however, is not a sufficiently built up area at present to justify a second grade rating.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: This is a section of rolling land sloping from Central Avenue towards the Saw Mill River Valley. It has been more recently improved with one and two family houses and some apartments, but in the main, cheaply constructed.
favor_influences: Good transportation facilities as well as shopping center on Mc Lean Avenue.
detr_influences: Cheapness of construction and influx of less desirables from Bronx County.
infiltration: Less desirable type of native white

notes: Small, sparsely settled section in the north is slightly more desirable.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Terraced land sloping sharply toward the river and rising sharply in the east. Dwellings are of substantial age and sizes; many having been converted into two family homes.
favor_influences: Attractive view and served by two commuting stations on the New York Central.
detr_influences: Distance from stores as well as age and size of buildings.

desirability: Slightly down through influx of less desirable.
notes: Vacancy is almost entirely in extremely large homes.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High land sloping to the north. This section contains a number of attractive, though somewhat older, homes and is zoned for singles. Lots, although small, are well landscaped and indicate marked pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Convenience of location.
detr_influences: Possible future influx of less desirable inhabitants from Bronx County immediately adjoining to the south.

notes: Vacancies are mainly in large singles.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Hilly terrain adjoining City of New York. Houses consist of singles, old one family houses, which have been converted into two or more apartments, cold water flats and a few newer and better class apartments.
favor_influences: Proximity to New York City and to the Yonkers' shopping area.
detr_influences: Age of structures and infiltration of a less desirable type of population.
infiltration: Less desirable type of native white

notes: This section is convenient to Ludlow and Lowerre Stations of the New York Central, handy for shopping on South Broadway and Riverdale Avenue. Negros are found on Culver Street but are well confined and their presence does not seem to have any detrimental effect upon the balance of the section.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: This was formerly one of Yonkers best residential sections containing nothing but single family homes located on plots of small size which are attractively landscaped and maintained. Ground slopes gradually downward to the north.
favor_influences: Conveniently located and general character of neighborhood.
detr_influences: Age of structures and influx of apartments.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Fairly low, flat land containing a majority of old, cold water flats. Many have toilet facilities on the back porch while others have toilets in the halls which are used by two or more families. Section is a slum area.
favor_influences: Nearness to center of city and places of employment.
detr_influences: Age of buildings and character of occupants.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High land sloping steeply toward the river with cliff separating it from the industrial area below. This is one of the older residential sections restricted to single family residences which are well maintained. Plots are of fair size and well landscaped.
favor_influences: Attractiveness and convenience of location and view together with type of occupant and neighborhood.
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: An old section of the city sloping towards the river. New construction includes fair type multi-family houses and apartments. Old construction includes cold water flats and a number of larger houses which have been converted into two and three family apartments.
favor_influences: Proximity to center of city.
detr_influences: Trend to apartments.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Ground rising sharply to the east. Although there are some modern, heated flats, the majority are of the old, cold water type. There are also a number of singles and doubles. All are built close together.
favor_influences: Convenience to places of work
detr_influences: Age of buildings and character of occupants.

notes: This section is served by two stations of the Putnam Division of the New York Central Railroad.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling, wooded land containing modest, single family homes of fair age. Grounds are small but attractively landscaped and well maintained.
favor_influences: Convenience of location and pride of ownership.
detr_influences: Slow influx of slightly less desirable inhabitants moving north from Bronx County.

notes: Although this section is desirable from every point of view, age and size of the houses has had a detrimental influence on sales.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A somewhat older section located on high, rolling ground. Residences, which are all singles, are large and located on plots of fair size. Grounds are well landscaped and maintained in excellent condition.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location and neighborhood.
detr_influences: Size and possibly age of dwellings. infiltration of better class Italians in the extreme northern end.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: One of the highest hills in the city on the west side of which are several stone quarries. Homes are of non-descript design; many of which were personally constructed by the owners of waste materials from the quarries.
favor_influences: Nearness to places of work
detr_influences: Character of dwellings and occupants.

notes: Sharp rise in land and power house separates this from the "Fourth Grade" area to the south.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land is slightly undulated. Development has taken place in more recent years including a preponderance of small, single family homes. Dwellings are detached although plots are small.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location, being almost entirely bounded by golf clubs and parks.
detr_influences: Inconveniently located.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Small, more recent development of moderately priced homes located on fair sized plots. Land is rolling forming a crest along Fairview and Fowler Avenues.
favor_influences: Good bus service and pleasant outlooks.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city.
inhab_type: Minor executives and small business men

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land slopes upward from the Saw Mill River Valley to the east. This section is almost divided into two parts - Italian elsment lives in western section and the colored element lives from Wilson Avenue eastward. This Negro section comprises mostly Post Office clerks or New York City employees and many own their own homes.
favor_influences: Conveniently located for commuting purposes.
detr_influences: Character of occupants.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land is rolling and wooded. Development of the area by a company ceased with the depression and is now being recommenced. Dwellings are one and two family located on plots of 50 x 100.
favor_influences: Good transportation. Conveniently located for industrial workers.
detr_influences: Schools are located in the adjoining hazardous area and children must attend with colored and foreign born.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A sparsely developed section of low, flat land which contains a mixture of junk, lumber and coal yards together with dwellings which are mostly owner built used materials.
favor_influences: None.
detr_influences: Entire character of neighborhood and its occupants.

notes: Because of the generally low rents, there has been a good demand and made possible rental increases bringing them back to normal.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Low flat land formerly a separate community known as Nepera Park. Dwellings, comprising singles and doubles, are of no particular character and probably 50% of them were built by the occupants themselves on plots of mixed sizes.
favor_influences: Local railroad station and good transportation.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and distance from center of city.

notes: Abbott Avenue, Emmet Place and Bellevue Avenue are slightly more desirable than the balance of the area.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Rolling land which has been more recently developed with moderatly priced one and two family homes. Dwellings are locaated on plots with 25 and 50 foot frontages with an appeal to middle class homes seekers.
favor_influences: Newness of development and good transportation.
detr_influences: Distance from stores.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A section adjacent to the carpet works containing closely congested, old, obsolete, cold water flats some of which are being demolished by institutional holders.
favor_influences: Nearness to places of work.
detr_influences: Entire character of neighborhood and its occupants.
build_type: Cold water flats 1,2 or more fam.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: High land with attractive river view. This was formerly a most desirable residential section. Although still well maintained and on plottages of fiar size, homes have begun to lose their attractiveness because of age, size and lack of modern improvements.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location and evidence of pride of ownership.
detr_influences: None, save age of improvements.

notes: Due to the large houses and large land plots, excessive upkeep makes them hard to dispose of.
source: See Explanations.
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land is high in the east sloping abruptly towards the river. Plots are of substantial size, approaching small estates. This was formerly one of Yonkers most attractive residential sections and still would be were it not for the age of size of the improvements.
favor_influences: Attractiveness and convenience of location.
detr_influences: None, save age of structures and size of lots.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Hillside land rising from the river to the east. Dwellings include old, one family homes together with cold water and some heated flats. A number of the larger homes have been converted into rooming houses
favor_influences: Convenient to center of city and places of work.
detr_influences: Encroachment of industry and apartments as well as age of structures.
inhab_type: Dep't heads, clerks and factory workers.

notes: This was, and still is, almost a 100% owner occupied section. So few sales have taken place that it is impossible to determine fluctuations in values.
source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land is high, sloping steeply towards the river. Grade separates it from the less desirable area below. Improvements comprise modern, single family residences of attractive architecture. Plots, although not large, are well landscaped and show a district pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of location with excellent river view.
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: Yonkers, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Hillside land sloping towards the river formerly containing large, single units but not mostly boarding houses of a cheap grade.
favor_influences: Convenience to places of work.
detr_influences: Age and character of buildings.

notes: Unrestricted section of nondescript development. River front properties are not good housing. Undesirable people.
source: Rowland & Banister
name: Philadelphia
favor_influences: Suburban development - fair transportation.
detr_influences: Mixture of nondescript houses. No sewers- streets unimproved.

notes: Very sparsely settled section because of its distance from the center of the city, expected to take its general character from C-12 immediately adjacent.
name: Suburban Philadelphia, Pa.

notes: Valuations down do not include homes on Monument Square. A boarding house area with some very fine old homes still retaining considerable value around Mt. Vernon place. Ground rents range from $30-160. Ground rents on Mt. Vernon place up to $216. Charles Street properties are the central section includes some of the worst of some very good property.
source: Louis Kroner, property review appraiser H.O.L.C.
name: Baltimore
favor_influences: Central location. Conversion to business
detr_influences: Interspersed with business. Entire ward zoned for commerce.

notes: Most of this section comprises the commercial area of the city. Houses are intermingled with business. Ground rents range from $30-90. Average $60. Alley property is very bad.
source: Louis Kroner, property review appraiser H.O.L.C.
name: Baltimore
favor_influences: Central location. Conversion value for business expansion.
detr_influences: Heavy obsolescence of residential property. Business noises.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: An older section of the city and adjacent to both industrial and business areas. Land slopes upward from the river.
favor_influences: City improvements. Good churches and bus transportation. Accessible.
detr_influences: Obsoleacence of structures and poorness of surroundings.

source: Mr. McHenry HOLC Appraiser
name: Ewing Township
desc_terrain: An older and exceedingly mixed suburban residential section. Land is high and rolling.
favor_influences: Fair schools, bus transportation and neighborhood stores.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and other city improvements. Distance from city.

source: Mr. McHenry HOLC Appraiser.
name: Ewing Township
desc_terrain: A cheap speculative development with an appeal to those employed by the adjacent State Hospital.
favor_influences: Nearness to place of work.
detr_influences: Practically none.

notes: A steep hill rising in a northerly direction forms a topographical barrier preventing the adverse spread into area No.A-1
source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser.
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: A section of old homes, the larger of which are being converted into small apartments. Ground rises to the north.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, bus transportation, neighborhoo stores and city conveniences.
detr_influences: Age of structures.

source: Mr. McHentry HOLC Appraiser.
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: An old residential section which is rapidly becoming undesirable because of encroachment of business. Land values should increase, however, in anticipation that eventually the entire area will be used by the State. Land rises slightly to the north.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, bus transportation, city improvements and nearness to the center of the city.
detr_influences: Obsolescence of buildings and general surroundings.

notes: Area contains a mixture of homes ranging from bungalows to dwellings of substantial site.
source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Ewing Township
desc_terrain: Flat ground along the bank of the river. Area is sparsely improved but with a noticable pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Pleasant outlook.
detr_influences: Lacks city conveniences and accessibility.

notes: This southern portion is of older origin and contains some semi-detached and a few multi-family dwellings.
source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser.
name: Ewing Twonship & Trenton.
desc_terrain: This is the second best residential section. It is situated on rising and high ground presenting a pleasing outlook.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks and bus transportation as well as neighborhood stores.
detr_influences: None save lack of sewers outside the city limits.

name: Ewing Township
