desc_terrain: This section closely resembles area No B-5 save that only about 25% of the land has been improved with dwellings.

source: McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Ewing & Lawrence Township
desc_terrain: Semi-suburban sections of low priced homes situatied on generally high and rolling land and convenient to neighboring industrial areas.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and bus transportation
detr_influences: Poor surroundings and lack of sewers.

name: Ewing Township
desc_terrain: This sparsely developed section is similar in all respects to the nearby Area No. C-9. Only about 15% of the land is improved.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser.
name: Ewing Township
desc_terrain: Slightly rolling high ground. The development follows a main artary and a portion is adjacent to the State Teachars College. In general it is a good suburban ares
favor_influences: Good schools, fair bus transportation and limited churches. Small neighborhood stores.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and necessary utilities. Somewhat inaccessible.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Ewing Township & Trenton
desc_terrain: A section of moderately and low priced homes on high flat land lying between two industrial areas.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, bus transportation, parks and city improvements.
detr_influences: Poorness of surroundings.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: An older section of the city and adjacent to both industrial and business areas. Land slopes upward from the river.
favor_influences: City improvements. Good churches and bus transportation. Accessible.
detr_influences: Obsoleacence of structures and poorness of surroundings.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: One of the oldest residential section of the city bordering on the business and industrial areas. Land is flat.
favor_influences: Fair schools, good bus transportation and churches, parks, water frontage and city improvements.
detr_influences: Obsolescence of buildings and surroundings.

name: Ewing & Lawrence Township
desc_terrain: A sparsely developed suburban residential community closely resembling Area C-2. Only about 15% of the land has been improved.

name: Lawrence Township
desc_terrain: This section closely resembles Area B-2 save that it is sparsely developed. Only about 20% of the land is improved with homes.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Lawrence Township
desc_terrain: Suburban section of low priced homes on high flat land convenient to the industrial area.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and bus transportation.
detr_influences: Poor surroundings and lack of sewers.

source: Mr McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Lawrence Township
desc_terrain: A good suburban residential section on high ground sloping toward the lakes and lowland and amid attractive surroundings.
favor_influences: Good schools, bus transportation. Limited church facilities.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and parks. Distance from center of city.

source: McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Ewing & Lawrence Township
desc_terrain: Semi-suburban sections of low priced homes situatied on generally high and rolling land and convenient to neighboring industrial areas.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and bus transportation
detr_influences: Poor surroundings and lack of sewers.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: An older section of the city and adjacent to both industrial and business areas. Land slopes upward from the river.
favor_influences: City improvements. Good churches and bus transportation. Accessible.
detr_influences: Obsoleacence of structures and poorness of surroundings.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser.
name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: A semi-suburban residential section located on low flat land and completely surrounded by an industrial area.
favor_influences: Good schools and fair bus transportation but only a few utilities.
detr_influences: Lack of churches, sewers, and general surroundings.

name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: A sparsely settled section exactly like Area No. C-4. Only about 10% of the land is improved.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Lawrence Township
desc_terrain: Suburban section of low priced homes on high flat land convenient to the industrial area.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and bus transportation.
detr_influences: Poor surroundings and lack of sewers.

name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: This section is exactly similar to the adjoining area No. C-6 save that only about 15% of the land has been improved and it is slightly less desirable.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: A fair suburban residential section. Land is flat.
favor_influences: Good schools and bus transportation. Limited churches and neighborhood stores.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and parks as well as distance from the cetner of city.
build_constr: Type of Construction.  Frame, some brick and stucco.

source: Mr McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: A good suburban residential section. Land is flat and has been attractively developed.
favor_influences: Good schools and bus transportation. Limited churches and neighborhood stores.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and parks as well as distance to center of city.

source: Mr McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: Flat land which has been improved with low priced suburban homes but only sparsely settled.
favor_influences: Good schools, some churches and fair bus transportation.
detr_influences: Unattractive architecture, lack of parks and sewers together with most utilities. Distance from city.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township & Trenton
desc_terrain: A section of moderately and low priced working mens homes adjacent to the industrial area. Land is flat.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and bus transportation.
detr_influences: Lack of parks and sewers outsdie city limits. Unattractiveness of architecture.

notes: Stection B-8 is of newer construction and has been improved with small single family homes.
source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: Flat land within the city limits containing moderately priced homes.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks, bus transportation & neighborhood stores. Near places of work.
detr_influences: None

notes: Beyond city limits construction is newer.
source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township & Trenton
desc_terrain: An older section of the city given over to moderatly and low priced homes. Land is flat.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, bus transportation, parks and community business sections.
detr_influences: Age and obsolescence of dwllings.

source: Mr McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township & Trenton
desc_terrain: Flat land partially in the city limits and partially in Hamilton Township which has been improved with moderately priced dwellings.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, bus transportation and neighborhood stores. Near places of work.
detr_influences: None.

notes: Stection B-8 is of newer construction and has been improved with small single family homes.
source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Trenton
desc_terrain: Flat land within the city limits containing moderately priced homes.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, parks, bus transportation & neighborhood stores. Near places of work.
detr_influences: None

name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: This section differs from area C-12 only in that but 20% of the land is improved.

source: Mr McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: A good suburban residential section. Land is flat but attractively develped.
favor_influences: Good schools, churches, neighborhood stores and fair bus transportation.
detr_influences: Lack of parks and sewers and distance to center of city.

source: Mr. McHenry, HOLC Appraiser
name: Hamilton Township
desc_terrain: An area of small cheaply constructed homes. Land is somewhat rolling
favor_influences: Good schools, churches and fair transportation.
detr_influences: Poor development and lack of both city improvemtns and accessibility.

notes: Unlikely to develop as a residential community because of comparatively remote location but a more desirable area than C1 or C2
source: W.C. Nye Willaim Carroll
name: Brockton, Mass
favor_influences: Bus line near- 12 minutes to downtown. N. Pearl Street an improved through way. Zoned for residence.
detr_influences: Sparsely settled. Improved streets. Cemetery. Traffic along North Pearl and St. Oak St,
inhab_type: native born shoe and clerical workers

notes: Although a sparsely settled section containing some olda nd obsolete farm houses, it appears that these will in time give way with the growth and development of Area Al. New houses along Pearl St. near Torrey St. are of sound construction and indicate the trend. The majority of residents show pride of home ownership.
source: Milton Smith, C.E Coeoran
name: Brockton, Mass
desc_terrain: Level, high, wooded; elevation about 235' as compared with 76' in the downtown section.
favor_influences: Quiet. Near school and churches. Accessible. Adjacent to the best new development. Zoned for residence. Pearl St. and improved through way.
detr_influences: Largely undeveloped. No nearby shopping center. Dump 1/4 mile to the west of Rockland St. subject to obnoxious odors from filter bed to the south, but this infrequent.
inhab_type: Middle class business people and small farmers

notes: Best of the section around Braemoor Road which is to be continued northward. Beautiful landscaping here, and values $15,000 to $30,000. The small area south of Torrey St. is a new development of 7500 singles. A rocky underledge toward the north makes drainage difficult.
source: Wm. C. Nye, Chas. E. Cocoran, Milton Smith William Carroll
name: Brockton, Mass.
desc_terrain: High. Slightly rolling. Elevation 235' as compared with 76' in the downtown business section.
favor_influences: Thorney Lea Golf Club. Restrictions. Easily accessible in that main highways (Pleasant St. and Torrey St.) are ar either end. Quiet.
detr_influences: 2 miles from business center.

notes: Dampness and wet cellars result from low ground and inadequate drainage. Obnoxious ordors from filter beds often present due to prevailing winds from southwest.
source: W.C Nye and Milton Smith, Wm Carrroll.
name: Brockton, Mass
desc_terrain: Level and lower than surrouding area
favor_influences: Belmot St. bus line 10 min to dowdntwon
detr_influences: Largely underdeveloped. Unimproved streets. Low and inclined to swampy in places making cellars wet. Filter beds to southwest.
inhab_type: native norn clerks and show workers

notes: obnoxious odors sometimes noticeable from filter beds to the West due to prevailing wind from the southwest.
source: W.C. Nye
name: Brockton, Mass
favor_influences: Quiet, little traffic. Zoned for residence
detr_influences: Largely undeveloped. Umimproved streets. Not near bus transportation.From 1 to 2 miles to businesss center. Filter beds to the west. Fair grounds. Flaggs pond
inhab_type: Native born small business men and clerks

notes: Good, sound, middle class citizens, many of whom are Swedish. A few old houses not in good condition and some newer homes of below the average value are to be found here and there, but for the most part residents display good pride of home ownership.
source: Wm. C. Nye, Chas. E.Cocoran, Milton Smith, William Carroll
name: Brockton (Campello)
desc_terrain: Level for the most part - gradual slope up toward the west.
favor_influences: Good streets, bus transportation, schools, churches, shade trees, Lawns and gardens. Brockton Country Club.
detr_influences: Older section. Some houses below the average value and style.
inhab_type: Native born business people, clerks and Jr. executives.

notes: The Irish concentration is north of Forest Ave and the Swedish concentration is in the southern half of the area. This is one of the older sections of the city.
source: W.C.Nye, Milton Smith, Wm. Carroll
name: Brockton (centerville)
favor_influences: Close in. Convenient to busses, schools and churches. Improved streets. Zoned for residence.
detr_influences: Congested area. Many old houses - some 3 to 6 families. Considerable traffic.

notes: some two and 2.5 story frame houses east of Belmost Ave. Many fine old homes elsewhere in good condition and surrounded with well kepy grounds and old shade trees.
source: W.C Nye, Milton Smith, Wm. Carroll
name: Brockton, Mass
desc_terrain: Level- Gradual slope up toward the West.
favor_influences: Best of older residential sections. Adequate bus tranportation Near schools, churches, and neighborhoods stores. Playground. Fine old trees, Good pride of home ownership.
detr_influences: Encroachment of business section. Some fine old single houses being used for clubs, clinics etc. Pleasant St. xoned for business.
inhab_type: native born business executives and professional

notes: Somewhat older than area A1 but very desirable and closer to downtown Brockton. Shows stability and good pride of home ownership.
source: W,D,Nye, Chas. E/ Cocoran, Milton Smith William Carroll
name: Brockton, Mass.
favor_influences: Schools and churches easily accessible. Thorney Lea Golf Club. Good bus transportation nearby.
detr_influences: Considerable traffic on West St. and W. Elm Street.

notes: An adjacent to 30-acre pond in Field Park may someday be desirable because of this favorable influence but now small single old frame houses are scattered through the area. Near Oak St. is the home office and plant of Dutchland Farms which supplies ice cream and food stuffs to 100 or more large roadside stands throughout New England. A tack factory formerly occupied a plant near Prospect and Pleasant St., now unsightly, being partly demolished and partly occupied by a bakery.
source: W.C.Nye, Milton Smith and  Wm. Carroll.
name: Brockton, Mass
desc_terrain: Slightly rolling country - farm land but partly wooded.
favor_influences: Bus transportation. D.W.Field Park. Oak Ridge Gold links (municipal) Zoned for residence.
detr_influences: Sparsely settled. Unimproved streets.
inhab_type: Native born shoe workers, clerks and small farmers

notes: Berkside Ave. & Hillcrest Ave near the Avon town line contain single homes built within 5 years of unusually good quality for this type neighborhood. Part of this area around N. Main St. was once an aristocratic section and still has some fine old homes and estates.
source: W.C. Nye, Milton Smith
name: Brockton (Montello)
desc_terrain: Level in the main. Gradual upward slope west.
favor_influences: Good streets. Convenient to bus transportation schools and churches. D.W.Feild Park.
detr_influences: Gravel pit near Holdbrook line north of Howard St. Zoned for business along N. Main St. and for industry near the railroad.
inhab_type: Native born clerical and factory workers

notes: Polish and Lithuanian residents keep mostly to themselves. Considered thrifty. Many are shoe workers employed in nearby factories.
source: W.C.Nye and William Carroll
name: Brickton (Montello) Mass.
desc_terrain: Gradual slope upward toward east. Hilly in the northeast portion.
favor_influences: Bus transportation. Schools, churches, and factories near.
detr_influences: Many unimproved streets. Dump between Claremont & Oscar Aves. Rairoad freight yards. A number of streets unimproved.

notes: Encroachment of business and manufacturing, junk yards etc. Irish south of Crescent St. Greeks and mixture of undesirable foreign element and poorer classes north of Crescent St. Negroes between Lawrence and Center Sts.
source: Wm. Carroll, W. C. Nye and Milton Smith
name: Brockton, Mass.
favor_influences: Close in. Improved streets.
detr_influences: Dump northwest of Calvary Cemetery. Gas works near railroad tracks and E. Union Street. Congested area of old houses. Practically the entire area zoned for industry. Cemeteries. Factory smoke. Railroad tracks.

notes: Very sparsely settled from the center eastward
source: Wm. Carroll, W.C.Nye and Milton Smith
name: Brockton, Mass.
desc_terrain: Level in the main, but gradually rising toward the east.
favor_influences: Bus transportation, schools, churches, and factories convenient.
detr_influences: A number of streets unimproved especially in the east portion. City piggery and Poor farm adjacent to the south.

notes: Some parts of this area, especially along Leydon St. might be worthy of a better classification because the houses are of sound construction in good condition, and show pride of home ownership, but they are located on the wrong side of the tracks. People who live here are content to remain because they were born and raised here.
source: W. C. Nye, Milton Smith, Wm Carroll
name: Brockton, Mass.
favor_influences: Bus transportation, schools and churches. Zoned for residence.
detr_influences: Sparsely settled; many unimproved streets. Abbatoir (used occasionally) toward the south at Bridgewater line.

source: W.C.Nye, Milton Smith and Wm. Carroll
name: Brockton, Mass.
desc_terrain: Level and dry but comparatively low.
favor_influences: Convenient to bus transportation, schools and churches. Zoned for residence.
detr_influences: Traffic along Main St through highway Route 28. Sparsely settled. Dump about the cetner off Alpine.

notes: Increasing demand for cheap quarter has made possible rental advances.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Land rising from the river to wast and west. The oldest section of the city now given over to closely built tenements which are occupied by a low class of foreigners.
favor_influences: Nearness to places of employment.
detr_influences: Age and condition of structures and noise from the railroads.

source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Rolling land. A section of old and new workingmen's homes including singles, doubles and three family. Area to the east is only sparsely developed.
favor_influences: nearness to places of employment and good parks.
detr_influences: Nearness of industry and age of most dwellings.

source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONNECTICUT
desc_terrain: Land rises sharply to the west and then becomes somewhat rolling. This is a section of workingman's homes ranging from singles to multi-family. Area is only sparsely developed in the south and southwest.
favor_influences: Nearness to the parks.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and other improvements in sparsely settled portion. In all, character of architecture and cheapness of construction.

source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: High rolling ground. A newer development of moderately priced homes on fair sized plots with well landscaped streets and grounds.
favor_influences: Zoned for one family houses. Attractiveness of architecture.
detr_influences: Inconveniently located. Lacks schools, churches and stores.
inhab_type: Minor executives and small business men

notes: In the higher brackets this is not a profitable rental area.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY -  CONN.
desc_terrain: Land rising to the west and becoming plateau. A slightly older section containing a mixture of one, two and three family homes. Plots are of fair size.
favor_influences: Pleasant outlook and fair pride of ownership.
detr_influences: Inconveniently located.
inhab_type: Minor executives and small business men

notes: Properties in this area when rented generally do not show a fair return upon investment.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Land rising to the west and becoming a plateau. A comparatively new section containing mostly singles. Plots are of fair size.
favor_influences: Pleasant outlook and pride of ownership.
detr_influences: Inconveniently located.
inhab_type: Minor executives and small business men

source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Flat land rising to the west. A small manufacturing center containing a mixture of workingmen's homes of various sizes
favor_influences: Nearness to places of employment. Own schools, churches, and shopping center.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city and lack of sewers.

notes: Values are single family homes only.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Rolling terrain. A section predominatly devoted to medium priced, single family homes but containing some doubles and three families. To the east, area is only sparsely developed. This was largely a speculative development cheaply constructed.
favor_influences: Good park system and convenient to industry.
detr_influences: Lack of sewers and distance from center of city. Sewer system contemplated this year.

notes: Along East Main from North Main out are a number of combination stores and dwellings of higher property value because of desirability for business purposes.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBERY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Land rises in north to high ground. Though slightly newer in the extreme north and there limited mostly to singles, the balance is a mixture of singles, doubles, three family and small apartments. Eastern section is only sparsely developed.
favor_influences: Conveniences of location and nearness to places of work.
detr_influences: Expansion of blighted areas, encroachment of industry, age and obsolescence of structues.
inhab_type: Skilled and semi-skilled factory workers & laborers

notes: Increasing demand for cheap quarters have driven rents up to their 1929 levels.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Land rising steeply to the north. An old section of closely built houses with a predominance of multi-family homes now occupied by Negros and poor class foreigners.
favor_influences: Convenience.
detr_influences: Age and obsolescence of buildings. Character of neighborhood and occupants.

notes: There are a few homes on the southern edge which exceed the values given above.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Steeply rising to high land in the north. An older section of large homes which still retains its desirability. Plots are large and well landscaped.
favor_influences: Conveniently and attractively located. Marked pride of ownership.
detr_influences: None.

notes: In this area rents do not show a fair return upon investment. There are one or two exceptional homes which have greater values than those given above.
source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: High rolling ground. This is the finest residential section of the city. Streets and grounds are attractively landscaped/ Plots are of fair size.
favor_influences: Convenience and attractiveness of location. Marked pride of ownership.
detr_influences: None.

source: See Explanations
name: WATERBURY - CONN.
desc_terrain: Low land rising to high in the northwest and southwest. A small manufacturing center containing homes of working men.
favor_influences: Nearness to places of employment.
detr_influences: Cheapness of construction and distance from center of city.

source: See Explanations
name: LACKAWANNA, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A small somewhat poorly located section of modest homes.
favor_influences: Nearness to employment.
detr_influences: Proximity to industry.

notes: A housing shortage exists in this district due to activities in the nearby steel mills.
source: See Explanations
name: BUFFALO & LACKAWANNA, N.Y.
desc_terrain: The most desirable residential section in South Buffalo containing an assortment of homes for varying classes.
favor_influences: Well stabilized as to type of occupant and with all advantages.
detr_influences: Smoke and dirt from nearby plants.

source: See Explanations
name: BUFFALO, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A section of small cheap workingmen's homes.
favor_influences: Nearness to places of employment- steel mills and railroads.
detr_influences: Distance to city's center and quality of buildings.

source: See explanations
name: BUFFALO, N.Y.
desc_terrain: An area nearly surrounded by industry which has been given over to the laboring classes.
favor_influences: Nearness to steel and other plants where inhabitants can walk to work.
detr_influences: Age and condition of buildings and encroachment of industry.

source: See Explanations
name: BUFFALO, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A thickly populated, old section of workingmen's homes
favor_influences: Proximity to center of city and places of employment.
detr_influences: General downward trend through infiltration of lower income groups and foreign born.

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, N.Y.
desc_terrain: An old residential section now entirely occupied by an undesirable foreign element.
favor_influences: Nearness to nearby mills and transportation, schools, etc.
detr_influences: Age and condition of buildings and encroachment of industry.

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, N.Y.
desc_terrain: An extremely old section which has been taken over by Italians and Negros of a poor type.
favor_influences: Nearness to main business cetner, schools, churches, etc.
detr_influences: Age and physical condition of buildings, type of occupant and encroachment of business.

source: See Explanations
name: BUFFALO & CHEEKTOWAGA, N.Y.
desc_terrain: An older section of the city still only partially developed containing homes of factory and daily workers.
favor_influences: Nearness to places of employment.
detr_influences: Age and condition of structures and type of occupant. Distance from center of city.

source: See Explanation
name: BUFFALO, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A large area with notwithstanding has been improved with considerable similarity and which houses, particularly in th eastern portion most of Buffalo's large Polish and German population- in this case a substantial type of citizen.
favor_influences: Proximity to center of city and places of employment.
detr_influences: General downward trend through infiltration of lower income groups and foreign born.

notes: Attraction of railroad workers has materially increased rents.
source: See Explanations
name: Buffalo & Cheektowaga, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A section of moderately priced workingmen's homes.
favor_influences: Offers all advantages for type of residents.
detr_influences: Many cheaply built houses also surrounding industrial area.

source: See Explanations
name: Buffalo, NY
desc_terrain: A new though small development of moderately priced residences
favor_influences: Well restricted new section with all improvements.  Pride of ownership well displayed.
detr_influences: Distance to center of city

name: Richmond, Virginia
favor_influences: Restrictions and good transportation
detr_influences: None

source: See explanations
name: Township of Amherst
desc_terrain: A sparsely developed section on high ground containing homes of mixed architecture and price range.
favor_influences: All Streets improvements. New schools, churches and transportation nearby- away from city dust and dirt.
detr_influences: Distance from shopping area.

source: See Explanations
name: Village of Snyder, NY
desc_terrain: High ground sloping off to the north.  This is a section of fine homes and estates.
favor_influences: Well proptected by restrictions, and with pride of ownership well displayed
detr_influences: Distance from center of city, stores, etc

source: See Explanations
name: Township of Amherst, NY
desc_terrain: High ground containing several new residential developments varying from medium to high priced homes
favor_influences: Well protected by restirctions.  Good landscaping and market pride of ownership
detr_influences: Distance from center of city, stores, etc.

source: See Explanations
name: Township of Amherst, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A somewhat new development of moderately priced homes of varying architecture.
favor_influences: Near park, clean section, all street improvements, bus transportation to downtown Buffalo, schools, churches not too far away.
detr_influences: Distance from shopping center.

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo & Amherst, NY
desc_terrain: A more recent speculative development in the north with older construction in the larger southern portion.  Area contains a mixture of moderate and higher priced homes.
favor_influences: Desirable, clean location, good transportation, close to parks, churches, schools and local business center.  Good pride of ownership.
detr_influences: None

notes: Increased nearby industrial activity has resulted in substantial rental advances.
source: See Explanations.
name: TOWN OF TONAWANDA, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A new but cheaply built section of small homes as yet only sparsely developed.
favor_influences: Proximity to places of employment.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city and character of construction.

source: See explanations
name: Township of Tonawanda, NY
desc_terrain: An entirely new speculative and sparse development of moderately priced homes
favor_influences: Nearest desirable development to city - all street improvements.  Not far from schools, churches, stores, and bus service to downtown Buffalo assured.
detr_influences: Transportation not altogether adequate, at present.  Lack of landscaping.

notes: Considerable activity in this area at present, in the building of a fairly good class of homes.
source: See explanations
name: TOWN OF TONAWANDA, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A new and attractive development of single family homes. Section is well landscaped and shows marked pride of ownership.
favor_influences: Character of improvement and occupant.
detr_influences: Distance from shopping center.

notes: Many streets on west end of this district contain houses, practically all alike.  Values therefore have not increased in this end of district - east end of district contains much better grade of homes and here a few homes are being erected at present.
source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, NY
desc_terrain: Slightly rising ground containing moderately priced single and two family homes together with a few apartments
favor_influences: Nearness to local business center, good transportation, schools, parks, churches, etc.
detr_influences: Railroad traversing this district has slight detrimental influence

source: See explanations
name: Kenmore, NY
desc_terrain: A somewhat newer development of moderately priced homes of quite similar design
favor_influences: Nearness to shopping center, excellent transportation, schools, and general pride of ownership
detr_influences: Possible encroachment of less desirable neighborhood.
inhab_type: Office workers and small business men

source: See Explanations
name: KENMORE, NEW YORK
desc_terrain: A newer development of cheaply constructed workingmen's homes.
favor_influences: Proximity to good district on one side and industry (place of employment) on the other.
detr_influences: Cheapness and sameness of construction.

notes: Rental demand has been exceptionally strong in this area.
source: See Explanations
name: BUFFALO, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A small area which maintains its desirability because of location on both sides of an attractive parkway.
favor_influences: Well stabilized and offers all conveniences for its type of occupant.
detr_influences: Surrounded by districts of less desirability.

notes: The wide value and income range is largely due to the influence of one street in this area, Jewett Parkway, which differs radically in these respects from the surrounding territory, but which is not sufficiently large to resist the trend of the balance.
source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A well located area of older and moderately priced homes.
favor_influences: Well stablized as to type of occupants, and with all advantages
detr_influences: None

source: See Explanations
name: BUFFALO, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A small, old area occupied almost entirely by railroad porters and their families.
favor_influences: Nearness to stores, transportation, schools, etc.
detr_influences: Age and condition of buildings as well as type of occupant.

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, NY
desc_terrain: An older section of medium and high priced homes.  Area is sufficiently large and well bounded to resist outside influences.
favor_influences: Character of neighborhood and general convenience
detr_influences: None

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A section of homes of varying size which is protected by factory office buildings from the influence of the adjacent industrial area.
favor_influences: Parks, schools, churches and transportation.
detr_influences: Smoke nuisance from nearby plants

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo
desc_terrain: A well established section containing homes of some of Buffalo's wealthiest citizens.  Grounds are large and beautifully landscaped.
favor_influences: Pride of ownership, nearness to schools, parks, churches, etc., good transportation
detr_influences: None

desirability: South of Porter Avenue down- balance static
notes: The portion south of Porter Avenue is entirely occupied by Italians, the more prosperous of whom are gradually moving to the northern and slightly more desirable section. Today, from Forrest Avenue south, the area is predominantly Italian.
source: See Explanations.
name: BUFFALO- N.Y.
desc_terrain: An older section of workingmen's homes varying from singles to multi-family.
favor_influences: Accessibility to places of employment, center of city, etc., according to location in area.
detr_influences: Large foreign population, old buildings and overcrowding.

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, N.Y.
desc_terrain: A very old section of the city which has deteriorated into in a slum area.
favor_influences: Nearness to transportation, schools, stroes, etc.
detr_influences: Physical condition and age of most buildings. However, places are all occupied. Encroachment of industry.

notes: There is no market for the large homes in this section which are still maintained and occupied by old, wealthy families.  Ultimate demand will be for apartment house construction but such trend is materially retarded by extremely high land values.  In view of present occupancy, this section is considered as being "first grade".  As these old families die off it will decline in desirability from a strictly residential viewpoint; however, there is no indication that such a transition will occur for a number of years.
source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, NY
desc_terrain: An older section containing many magnificent homes on large plottages which are still being maintained by the leading families of Buffalo.
favor_influences: Pride of ownership and large, expensive lots.  Convenient.
detr_influences: Slight influx of apartment houses and clubs.  Main artery out of town with consequent noise and traffic.

source: See explanations
name: Buffalo, NY
desc_terrain: Land rising slightly from the river.  An area of better class workingmen's single and two family homes.
favor_influences: Nearness to industry, local shopping center, park and good transportation.
detr_influences: Distance from centre of city.

source: See Explanations
name: BUFFALO, N.Y.
desc_terrain: An area of substantial land values still containing many large, old homes but which is feeling the encroachment of apartments and gradual infiltration of an undesirable foreign element.
favor_influences: Accessibility.
detr_influences: Age and infiltration of mixed races

notes: Zoned "A" amd "B" residential, commercial and industrial (see introduction.)  This is a typical "across the tracks" neighborhood of lower income occupants.  Many of the homes have sizeable garden plots, and the Portuguese influence which dominates, tends to thrift.  This trait, however, does not express itself in maintenance.  This is not a slum district and is highly agricultural in its make-up, being bordered on three sides by farms and orchards.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of Santa Clara Bldg. Dept.
name: Santa Clara, California
favor_influences: Nearness to schools, shopping center and places of employment, good soil
detr_influences: Inharmonious racial concentration

notes: Zoned "A" and "B" residential. (See Introductory Remarks." This area, while old to the point of dilapidation in some spots, showed a distinct tendency to come back. For example, in the block bounded by Washington, Lafayette, Harrison, and Fremont Streets, several old structures have been demolished in the past several years and a number of modern, single-family dwellings, one costing as much as $15,000, have replaced them. Some residences with one and two acre garden or orchard tracts occupy part of the area.
source: W.T. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice. City of Santa Clara Building Department.
name: Santa Clara, California
favor_influences: Convenience to University and good schools of all grades. Nearness to transportation, churches and first class shopping centers. Homogeneous character of occupancy.
detr_influences: Heterogeneous nature of improvements.
inhab_type: Business, professional and white collar workers.

notes: While many of the dwellings in this area are becoming obsolete, there have been enough new residences erected in recent years to effect this declining tendency. However, the area is a very "low blue", and if it were not for the beneficial influence of Santa Clara University and those connected with it who live in the area, it would probably be graded third made.
source: W. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of Santa Clara Building Department
name: Santa Clara, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools and colleges of all grades. Nearness to good shopping centers, and transportation.
detr_influences: Improvements of heterogeneous character, both as to age and architecture

notes: Zoned "A" and "B" residential. While distinctly third grade at present, there is more activity in this section of Santa Clara than in any other part. There is some indication that the southern part of the city may in time become the most desirable residential quarter. In the north-central, or older part of the area, the improvements are inharmonious, some of the structures being quite old.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T.Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of Santa Clara Bldg. Dept.
name: Santa Clara, California
favor_influences: Convenience to University and schools of all grades. Nearness to transportation and good shopping center. In line with natural community growth.
detr_influences: Lack of uniform development.
inhab_type: White collar workers, teachers, mill workers and artisans.

notes: Zoned single-family resdiential with multiple dwellings permitted on The Alameda. Two small sections along Park Avenue and one half block on The Alameda are zoned for community trading centers. The northern and western sections are not as high grade as the balance of teh area. The "blue-hatched" section lying to the west and northwest of this area is at present uninhabited, being largely an orchard. However, it is said that negotiations are in progress for at least a part of this land for the purpose of sub-dividing it.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M.Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to educational institutions and high-class local shopping centers. Homogenous area of medium priced homes. Nearness to transportation
detr_influences: Adobe soil unfavorable to sound foundations. Termites are known to exist here.
inhab_type: Professional, business men, white collar workers.

notes: Zoned single-family residential with provision for shopping district at corner of Naglee and Park Avenues. The eastern part of area has been a choice residential section for a number of years. The western part from Park Avenue has been largely built up in the past five years and is the most popular residential section of teh city at the present time. What was formerly known as "Naglee Park"  has been recently transformed by the city into a municipal rose garden of great charm and beauty. The "green hatched" district west and north of this area is now an orchard but seems destined to become a part of this area, although it is at the present outside the city limits.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.F. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice. City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
desc_terrain: Level with good drainage. Approximately 40 feet higher than major portion of city.
favor_influences: Homogenous neighborhood of high income population and substantial homes. Convenient to schools and all business adn social centers.
detr_influences: None

notes: Mainly zoned single-family residential. Small apartment houses permitted on block facing the Alameda. Six blocks southeastern part zoned two-family residential, and provision is made for a small trading center on Park Avenue between Magnolia and Hester. The southern part of the area is built upon what was the old fair grounds. Property on Magnolia and Hester Avenues between The Alameda and Park Avenue does not enjoy as high a value as the rest of the district, as it is part of an older development and is inclined to be heterogeneous in its improvements.
source: W.L Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W. B. Rice, Ralphe E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Homogeneous neighborhood of moderate to high income inhabitants. Convenience to schools and all social and business centers.
detr_influences: Some residences in eastern part, while well-maintained, are getting old.

notes: Zoned two-family residential, with provision for trading center along east part of Emory Street. Districts immediately east of area are zoned for industry, and the southern Pacific Railroad runs through them. This area has a great many homes that would be a credit to a "blue" area, but it is also spotted with some very old homes that are poorly maintained. The heterogeneous nature of the area extends to inhabitants, who range all the way from junior executives to unskilled artisans. It is a "buffer" area between the high grade districts bordering The Alameda and industry. Some blocks and parts of single streets might be accorded a "blue" grading, but the area as a whole is distinctly third grade.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M.Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools of all grade and shopping centers. Good soil and drainage.
detr_influences: Proximity to Southern Pacific Railroad and industrial districts. Inadequate transportation to city center in northern part. heterogeneous developement, with liberal sprinkling of very old dwellings which lack proper maintence.
inhab_type: Business men, railroad men, white collar workers & artisans.
build_type: Large old dwellings, some duplexes and modern, 5 and 6 room, 1 story

notes: This area is really a part of the business and industrial district end is zoned for light industry and business. However,  a majority of the structures are single-family residences, and for that reason it was thought that the area should be graded. The single-family residences shown above were built on Clinton Street last December, and the improvement was undoubtedly misplaced. It is thought that the district will steadily drift into a business and industrial district.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools and all social and business centers.
detr_influences: Heterogeneous neighborhood
build_type: Heterogeneous mixture 5 room-old 12 room; houses, boarding houses, etc.
lowprice: Land values dominate prices to such extent that comparisons are worthless

notes: Zoned for multifamily dwellings in the eastern section and two-family residences in the western section. Regardless of this zoning, the whole area is 90% made up of single-family dwellings and is looked upon as being a desirable residential district. The predominating sales values shown above are predicated upon a location in the eastern section where lots are selling for approximately $20 per front foot. Land values in the western section, which contains a large American-born Italian population, are considerably less. Were it not for its location, the eastern part of this area would have been segregated from the western portion and given a higher rating.
source: W.L.Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools, transportation, social and business centers.
detr_influences: Proximity to inharmonious population and industry.
inhab_type: Jr. executives, office workers, skilled mechanics.

notes: This area lies wholly outside the city limits and has neither zoning nor deed restriction. The area was predestined, when it was subdivided some thirty years ago and lots placed on teh market at "a dollar down and a dollar a week," Improvements in the area are mainly of teh cheaper types, some of them being what is known as "mud still" construction, and are rapidly deteriorating. The location and topography of the district are distinctly favorable, and it lies in teh general direction of teh highest grade of development in the city. A site for a large high school was recently purchased just to the north of this area, and when this is built, it will have a favorable effect. it is stated that the "red hatched" district immediately to the south was recently optioned with the idea of subdividing and developing it into a high class, medium priced district. This, however, it is thought, has been deferred owing to the rapid rising building cost. Taking all factors into consideration, it is believed that this area in the course of time will develop into a higher grade.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, city of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: convenience to transportation, schools, shopping center and employment. Good soil.
detr_influences: Outside city limites; no zoning restrictions; no sewers. Low percentage of street improvement. Heterogeneous development low income of population. Distance from churches & amusements. Danger of industrial encroachment.
inhab_type: Skilled and unskilled laborers, white collar workers, orchard & cannery employees

notes: This area is outside the city limits and is no protected by either zoning or deed restrictions. It is largely inhabited by foreign and American-born Italian and Slavonian families, many of whom are employed as cannery and orchard workers. The area is sparsely settled and seems to be in the path of the undustrial development. That part south of Auzerais Avenue is largely undeveloped, being occupied by orchards and garden tracts. This particular section of the area may in time develop into a high grade. The section lying between Park Avenue and Stevens Creek Road contains a number of boarding houses and other places of low resort and is more or ess of a "red light" district. It is locally designated as "Little Tijuana"
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Good soil. Convenience to transportation, schools, shopping center and places of employment
detr_influences: Outside of city limits, no zoning restrictions. Danger of industrial encroachment. Lack of sewers, utilities and street improvements.
inhab_type: Skilled & unskilled laborers, service employees & cannery & orchard workers.
build_constr: Frame with some frame and stucco

notes: Zoned single and two-family residential with provision for trading areas aiding Spring Street.  This is a low income district, containing a large number of Italians of the laboring class.  The northern part of the area is sparsely settled, and many of the streets are unpaved.  Owing to the scarcity of low rental properties in the city, rental demand is good, as the area is given over very largely to small, low-priced single-family residences.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.P. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools of all grades.  Walking distance to employment centers.
detr_influences: Heterogeneous development.  Half of streets unpaved.  Inadequate sewage system.

notes: Zoned one and two-family residential, with provision for apartment houses on the half block facing First Avenue and trading centers in the North-central and extreme southern part. There are many old homes in the southern part of the area, some of which are highly maintained. The extreme northern part is very sparsely settled. The "hatched" area to the north is zoned single-family residential and may develop into a higher grade than the "yellow" designation given.
source: W.L. Atkinson, N.Arnerich, David T.Bunker, /W.B.Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools, social and business centers and transportation.
detr_influences: Heterogeneous mixture of old and new construction.
inhab_type: Small business, white collar workers, railroad employees.
build_type: Some large, old houses 5-8 rooms, 1 & 2 story

notes: Zoned two and multi-family. However, the pattern of the areas is so strongly established as a single-family district that the building of apartment houses will probably be confined to northern and western boundaries. There are but three small apartment houses in teh area at teh present time. The northern half of this area is what is known as the Vendone Hotel tract, which was subdivided in 1930 subsequent to the destruction of the hotel by fire. Improvements in this area are of such a character that, if it were larger and differently located, it would be graded "high blue" or "low green". It is a popular neighborhood, and it is believed that its progress will be slowly upward on account of the convenience of its location.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Established district of better grade single-family dwellings. Convience to schools of all grades, San Francisco transportation, and downtown districts.
detr_influences: Proximity to industrial districts and inharmonious racial elements

desirability: Northern part upward, southern part downward.
notes: Zoned two family and multi-family residential with provision for trading center extending two blocks along Mission Street east of St. John's Square. There is a new Jr. High School located in the area just north of St. John's Square. The northern part of the area will probably develop into a high grade, single family district. It is at present outside the city limits but has been covered by deed restrictions. The southern portion along First, Second and Third Streets is rapidly developing into a multi-family section, and already a number of small, three-story apartments occupy this section.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Grade and Junior High School within district. Walking distance to city center. Adequate transportation, convenience to shopping centers. In line of city's indicated growth to north.
detr_influences: Proximity to industrial section and inharmonious racial concentration in "D-3".
inhab_type: Teachers, white collar workers, some retired.
build_type: 1 & 2 story, 1 & 2 family dwellings & small apt. houses

desirability: Upward for some years to come.
notes: This area is zoned two-family residential, but improvements are almost wholly single-family residences, which are occupied quite largely by third generation American born Italians, many of whom are of the junior executive and professional type. Were it not for its location, this area would be entitled to at least a "blue" designation.
source: W.L.Atkinson, M.Arnerich, David T.Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E.Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Homogeneous neighborhood of good, medium-priced homes within convenient distance from city center, schools, transportation, etc.
detr_influences: Proximity to inharmonious racial elements in "D-3" and "D-4" and threat of unfavorable developments in surrounding areas.

notes: Largely zoned for two and multi-family units, with ample provision for trading centers. Industry and commerce are permitted in the northern part and along the Southern Pacific Railroad, which traverses the area. This is typically an Oriental and Negro center and contains the alrgest concentration of these races in the city. It was originally known as "Chinatown", but the Chinese have been more or less crowded out. The imporvements in this area are extremely heterogeneous, some of the older houses being mere shelters, while some of teh newer structures are modern and substantial. A Negro church is located in the south-central part and a Japanese church in the north-central part.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, DAvid T. Bunker, W. B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice. City of San Jose BLD. Dent.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Close in. Schools nearby. Walking distance to city center. Transportation fair. Near center of employment.
detr_influences: Facial elements. Industrial plants close by. Traversed by railroad.
inhab_type: Laundrymen, gardeners, merchants, service employees, laborers

desirability: Downward for single-family, upward for apartments
notes: Zoned two and multi-family residential with four or five scattered blocks in eastern part zoned full commercial. The area is becoming popular as an apartment house district and already contains ten or more apartment buildings of from four to ten units. For this reason, land values are increasing in the area, one vacant parcel of 70 x 100 feet recently having been sold for $5,000.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnarich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to main shopping center, State College, Schools, churches and places of amusement.
detr_influences: Rising land values have tendency to increase taxation. Presence of numerous rooming and boarding houses.
inhab_type: White collar, service employees, small business men, some retired people.

notes: Largely zoned two-family residential, with small apartment houses permitted along 13th street. The area is mainly populated by Italians of the lower income class, and some sections give evidence of slum conditions. The extreme northern part, which is outside the city limits, is very sparsely settled, and the houses are characterized by large garden tracts. While some of the mortgages institutions make loans upon limited terms in this area, a majority of them refuse to entertain loan applications.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to work in industrial plants, walking distance to downtown business center. Nearness to schools.
detr_influences: Proximity to industry. Heterogeneous population.

desirability: Upward for some years to come.
notes: This area is zoned two-family residential, but improvements are almost wholly single-family residences, which are occupied quite largely by third generation American born Italians, many of whom are of the junior executive and professional type. Were it not for its location, this area would be entitled to at least a "blue" designation.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M.Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Homogeneous neighborhood of good, medium-priced homes within convenient distance from city center, schools, transportation, etc.
detr_influences: Proximity to inharmonious racial elements in "D-3" and "D-4" and threat of unfavorable developments in surrounding areas.

notes: Zoned single and two-family residential with provision for trading center at Taylor and 21st. The greatest density of population is in the southern portion of the area, and the northern part contains many small chicken ranches, garden tracts, and orchards of one and two acre dimensions. There are two automobile camps within the limits of the area, and the district just north of it outside the city limits is extremely heterogeneous in character, being inhabited largely by low-class Italians, Portuguese, Slavs, and some Mexicans. This condition puts a blight upon both this area and the "yellow-hatched" district to the northeast.
source: W.L.Atkinson, M.Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: New improvements indicate rising tendency in neighborhood. Fair transportation facilities. Good soil.
detr_influences: Somewhat isolated. Inharmonious racial elements just outside city limits on north. Lack of proper sewage and street improvements. Distance from schools of higher grade.

notes: Zoned two-family residential north of Santa Clara Ave., multi-family between San Fernando and Santa Clara. Regardless of zoning, this is a one-family residential district, and so far could be observed, contains only residences of that character. Most of the homes have garden plots, and the area is said particularly to appeal to those who work in the city and desire more "room".
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to grade schools, transportation, and shopping district. Good soil.
detr_influences: Distance from city center and high schools. Proximity to industrial development.
inhab_type: Small business men, artisans cannery workers, white collar workers.

notes: While this area is zoned two-family residential, improvements so far have been single family dwellings, all of which are provided with small garden plots and orchard tracts. The area is known as "Darlheaven" and was subdivided and placed on the market during the past few years. Owing to the flood threat and instability of soil for building purposes, mortgage funds for the area are somewhat limited. Improvements that have taken place are homogeneous, and when proper drainage is installed it is believed that the area will advance into a better security grade, as it is somewhat more favorably located than C-10. This will be particularly true when the proposed development of 35th Street as part of the State Highway System takes place.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Good soil. Nearness to grade school, transportation, and shopping center.
detr_influences: Danger of flood. Distance to city center. Unimproved streets will mean future assessments.

notes: This area, while zoned two-family residential, so far contains only single-family dwellings, most of which are provided with ample garden space. In years of heavy rain fall this area is subject to flood. For this reason, although a newer district, it is less popular and of a lower grade than C-9.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to grade schools, transportation and shopping district. Good soil.
detr_influences: Subject to flood. Proximity to lower grade groups and industrial development.
inhab_type: Small business men, white collar workers, cannery workers and laborers.

desirability: Probably upward. *refers to part of area in city limits, which is zoned two-family.
notes: Zoned two-family residential with provision for a trading cetner in The southern part of the area lies on the outside of the city limits and is without the protection afforded by zoning or deed restriction. This section contains the largest concentration of Mexicans in the community. The northern section within the city limits is largely populated by a lower stratum of Italians & Portuguese. From a racial standpoint, this area is extremely undesirable. Almost all the homes in the area have one or two acre garden tracts, and for that reaon, have a certain appeal to foreign laborers as sustenance homesteads. In wet years the land is subject to overflow.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Good soil. Nearness to transportation, grade school and shopping center
detr_influences: Inharmonious racial elements. Unimproved streets. Distance from city center and high schools. Heterogeneous development subject to flood in wet years.
inhab_type: Chicken ranchers, laborers, farm hands, mechanics.

newconstr_type: $3500 to $6000 in garden tract and outbuildings.
notes: Mainly zoned two-family residential and light industry permitted in the South-eastern along the railroad. Owing to the difference in size of lots and been difficult to arrive at values which can be used comparatively. The figures used have been set up on the basis of a typical size lot of 40 x 130 feet dimention. The tier of blocks west of 24th Street between San Fernando and San Antonio might almost be accorded a "yellow" grading. In fact, the whole area should probably be thougth of as "high red."
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Nearness to grade school, shopping center and transportation. Good soil. Utilities all in.
detr_influences: Unimproved streets. Inharmonious racial elements. Distance from city center and high schools. Heterogeneous development.
inhab_type: White collar workers, merchatns, RR workers, cannery & orchard helpers
build_type: One story single & 2 family 4 to 6 rooms

desirability: Upward for next ten years, then static
notes: Zoned single-family residential and protected by deed restriction. This and Area A-2, which it surrounds, is known as the Naglee Park District. The two areas are identical except for percentage of land occupany and age of improvements. Conformity is uniform, and structures are sound and well-maintained. The district has great charm of appearance and an atmosphere of dignity. Land values run around $60 per front foot. While the area is graded "high blue" on account of average age and high percentage of the development it has all the characteristics of a "green" area, and highest term loans can be safely negociated on the newer structures. The "blue Hatched" district directly south may easily develop into an "A" area. The new high school recently purchased six or seven blocks south will greatly enhance the desirability of this entire section of the city when the school is built and in operation
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralphe E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Harmonious development of single-family dwellings. High grade neighborhood. Convenience to schools of all grades.
detr_influences: None

notes: The area is zoned single-family residential and is also protected by deed restrictions. Together with Area B-5, with which it is is closely identified, it is known as Naglee Park. This is believed to be the most stable area in the city, and while room for development is limited, it is believed that it will be "tops" for many years to come (See Clarifying Remarks B-5)
source: W.L. Atkinson, David T. Bunker, M. Arnerich, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Harmonious development of single-family residences, convenient to schools of all grades. High grade neighborhood in every respect.
detr_influences: None
build_type: 1 and 2 story 5 to 8 rooms (some mention type)

notes: Zoned two-family residential, with provision for apartment houses in the north-western part and two small trading centers along Virginia Street.  This old and at one time high-grade district is still a substantial neighborhood.  The class of occupancy, which had been slowly changing to lower income groups, has shown a recent tendency to change this trend.  The recent purchase of a new high school site one block to the south of the area and the possibility of the development of a high-grade residential area on the eastern boundary has had a beneficial effect upon the area, and it is thought may in time increase the grade of its eastern part.  The area's natural advantages and the general tone of the whole district is comfirmatory of this opinion.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
desc_terrain: Level with gentle slope to east.
favor_influences: Convenience to schools, transportation and shopping centers.  Nearness to city center.  Zoning limits improvements to two-family dwellings.
detr_influences: Nearness to industrial development in western part of area.
inhab_type: White collar workers, professional and public employees.
build_type: 1&2 story, 5 to 7 room (some large, old mansions)

desirability: Static for some years and then slowly downward.
notes: Zoned to permit apartment houses, with provision for small community trading centers at four scattered points in the area. This area is considered the best apartment house section of San Jose, and land values affect the price of single-family dwellings. Fifty foot lots range in price from $2,000 to $3500, with a few sales running as high as $100 per front foot. Many of the substantially built, old homes have been are are being converted into apartment and rooming houses. The State College, which is located in this area, increases the demand for such residential units. It is considered a very respectable and high-grade residential district, and some of the older mansion type homes are well maintained and would be harmonious in a first-grade area.
source: W.T. Arkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools of all grade and State Normal School; nearness to city center and shopping districts.
detr_influences: Heterogeneous improvements, poor transportation.
build_type: 1 & 2 story multi-family & Apartment houses. 5 to 10 rooms

notes: Zoned multi-family residential, industrial and business. This is one "Italian Town" and contains the slum section of San Jose. There are, however, many isolated blocks on secluded streets where the improvements and immediate surroundings would justify a "B" or "C" grading, but ine very direction within a stone's throw of such spots will be found industrial...contains many apartment houses and hotels. The extreme southern part of the area lies outside of the city...serious subterranean situation, possibly a quick sand formation, which has caused much damage to street paving and building foundations. The seven blocks along Keys Street in the extreme eastern section of teh area is not affected by many of the conditions set forth, and as it is zoned two-family residential, it probably in time will be entitled to a higher grade. The area as a whole contains many thrifty families and soundly improved prperties, and applications for loans should not be rejected without investigation.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to schools, shopping centers, and transportation.
detr_influences: Heterogeneous population and improvements. Mixture of residences, business and industry, with single-family residences greatly predominating.
inhab_type: Skilled and unskilled laborers, Mill, cannery & orchard workers, truck drivers, etc.
build_type: Residential of every type. Largely 5 to 7 rm.; 1 & 2 story single-family
price1929: *Land values make grading impossible. Good loans can be made in area, based upon rigid appraisal, but extreme caution is urged. (see 14)

notes: Zoned single-family residential.  (See Clarifying Remarks under B7) Area B5, which is surrounded by this area, is one of the most charming residential sections of the city and is a stimulating influence to adjacent portions of this area.  The recently purchased new Junior High School site located four or five blocks to the south of this area will, when constructed, be a constructive factor in the development of this section.  It is felt that in time parts of this area will develop into a higher grade.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to transportation, grade school and local shopping center.  Zoned single-family residential.
detr_influences: Nearness to heterogeneous area on north and east and industrial district on west.  The Western Pacific Railroad traverses southern and western part of area.  Distance from high school facilities.  Many streets are unimproved.

desirability: Upward for next ten years, then static.
notes: The southern part of this area was part of what was known as Willow Glen, a separate municipality which was recently annexed to San Jose. The recent recasting of a mattoon district bond issue, which affected this portion, has favorably influenced it. If it were not for its location and high percentage of development this area would be accorded an "A" classification. Palm Haven Avenue is a highly charming residential thoroughfare and compares favorably with any street in this section. The proposed new junior high school to the south will, when erected, affect this area favorably.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Homogeneously developed area of great charm. Nearness to transportation, grade schools and shopping center. Zoned single-family residential.
detr_influences: High percentage of development preculdes much further expansion. Nearness of heterogeneous area to north and east and industrial area to northwest.
inhab_type: Professional and business men executives & retired high income people
build_type: 1 and 2 story and 5 to 8 room single

notes: Zoned single-family residential with provision for small trading centers and multi-family dwellings along Lincoln Avenue and Willow Street east of Lincoln.  The three blocks in the extreme northern portion are outside of the city limits and unzoned (See Clarifying Remarks under B7) A considerable portion of the area is protected by deed restrictions.  Real estate selling in zone of the area's subdivisions was evidently of a "high pressure" type and left such to be desired.  Recent developments and sales efforts, however, have been along more ethical lines and indicate a tendency to better the general tone of the area.  When area is better stabilized, a re-grading will undoubtedly result in so according to higher classification to some parts of this area.
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.P. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Bldg. Dept.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Convenience to transportation, grade schools and shopping center; zoned single-family residential, with provision for apartments along Lincoln Avenue
detr_influences: Evidence of some "Jerry building" in parts of area.  Distance to high school facilties.  Streets not fully improved.
inhab_type: White collar workers, tradesmen, Jr. Executives, Skilled artisans
build_type: 1 and 3 story, 5 to 7 room single-family homes

notes: Zoned single-family residential with provision for two-family residents thoroughfare in the extreme southern portions. This area together with C-15 was a separate municipality until it was annexed by the City of San Jose in September in 1935. Since annexation, a "matoon" district bond issue, which constituted a general alien upon most of the land in Willow Glen, had been retired by an exchange of local improvement bonds, which are a limited obligation based upon assessed benefits. This "matoon" issue, while not large nor extremely burdensome, constituted
source: W.L. Atkinson, M. Arnerich, David T. Bunker, W.B. Rice, Ralph E. Prentice, City of San Jose Building Department.
name: San Jose, California
favor_influences: Homogeneous development. Zoned single-family residential. No social or racial hazards. Sewers in process of installation. Shopping centers in proccess of development.
detr_influences: Part of area lacks adequate transportation. Distance from city center and high school facilities. Many streets still unimproved and while sewers are being installed, it will be some time before all properties in area will be served

desirability: Christian Pk. Sec. Slightly increasing; South Irvington Sec. Static.
notes: New Boulevard along Pleasant Run Parkway and around Christian Park helping to develop that particular neighborhood. South Irvington section affected by cheaper type houses and extreme older type residences; future - static.
name: INDIANAPOLIS Christian Park and South Irvington Section
favor_influences: In west section development is newer type semi and modern bungalows for wokring-men types. Good trasnportation, near Washington Street - business district.
detr_influences: Lack of complete city facilities in extreme south of west portion. Lack of good transportation except Washington St. Number of older type houses in east portion. Small negro development in south portion; also negro influence in extreme northeast section and center Irvington section.
build_age: Christian Park Sec. 18 yrs. Irvington Sec. 30 yrs

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: A poorly located section of bad character which is sparsely settled with shack type houses. Any additional building would likewise be of low grade nature.

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: A summer cottage development primarly with some few very good homes interspersed through the area. Some concentration of houses is centered along West Lake Road and West 12th Street. Development will be slow because of the location, although for summer cottages some activity may be anticipated. The vacant ground not presently built on is being farmed. Area is outside the city limits of Erie. Mortgage funds in this area are limited as to type of structure and very little high-class construction of a permanent home nature is anticipated.

name: Sub. Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: An outlying section which has not recieved much enthusiasm. Practically no development has taken place and it is very questionable that any additional housing will be better than third grade.

name: Westminster - Sub. Erie
desc_terrain: A section well outside the city limits which was well planned and well laid out. Only three or four houses have been built to date, but the section appears to be of fairly good grade. Development will necessarily be slow because of the distance to the city. Mortgage financing should be conservative.

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: Level ground which has been surveyed for improve-ments, but which is practically vacant of housing. Its location and general desirability appear to be questionable for any other than third class devlop-ment.

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: A sparsely settled section with few houses scattered throughout. The majority of the housing is concentrated along 26th Street. The balance of the section, although surveyed, is practically all being farmed at present. Development will be very slow, but of fair character when such happens. Section is outside the city limits of Erie.

notes: Section is somewhat spotty with many original owners still living in section. Sales are poor but have improved since early 1937.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good Schools and transportation - convenient to shopping area.
detr_influences: Inflex of foreign element.

notes: A promotion which never took hold. Housing is concentrated south of 23rd Street between Geist and Haybargh Avenues.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: good transportation
detr_influences: Low-lying land

notes: Good demand for houses by Italians.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Near employment and schools- central location
detr_influences: Concentration of foreign- congested area- Housing in poor condition

notes: Property south of 26th Street is considered to be more desirable than that on the norht. There is considerable business on the dividing street. Hazel and Maple Streets re not good with foreign coming in. From Myrtle Street to Peach Street south of 26th, properties are below par of the section.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good schools and transportation
detr_influences: Some business encroachment on 26th street.

notes: An old Gernman section well located with the bulk of the property very well held.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good location - schools, churches and transportation.
detr_influences: Obsolescence

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: Although surveyed or development practically no housing has been built at this date. The area is however, the natural place for expansion of the section immediately to the norht. It is reasonable to assume that such development will be of fairly good character.

name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Restricted residential section of fairly new houses of good character. Near park. Good view.
detr_influences: Not convenient to schools.

notes: Continued building activity may be anticipated in this section - probably the most active of any area in Erie.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Near schools - Homogenous development of good character. Restricted section well-planned with good elevation.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Section is building slowly with fairly good houses.
name: eire, Penn.
favor_influences: Desirable residential seciton with good elevation
detr_influences: Schools are lacking and children must pay tuition in city schools or commute to county schools.

name: Sub. Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: An outlying section sparsely settled principally by Italians. The few houses in the section are on fairly large lots affording gardens and small farm activity. The section has never taken hold and any additional development will probably be third grade also.

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: Located near a new school, the development of this section will undoubtedly be of a nature similar to B-10. At present only scattered housing has been built but the area is well locted to high grade development.

notes: Considered a high class medium-priced neighborhood which is favorably affected by the adjacent Glen-wood Park section.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good transportation and schols and churches. Desirable residential section of good character.
detr_influences: Nominal

name: Erie, Penn.
