desc_terrain: An isolated section with a few scattered shack type houses. Values are questionable and the area has a poor reputation. Little additional building will come into this area.

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: Three streets lying close to the railroad tracks below section B-4. Only scattered housing has been built and the area is not looked upon favor-ably for additional developments. Values are indeterminable and slowly declining.

notes: Favorably affected by proximity to section A-1 and A-2.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good transportation and schools - Close to an industrial section nearby within walking distance.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: The majority of the homes are priced under $15,000. Considerable rivalry exists between this section and A-3 and A-4 for choicest development.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Desirable restricted residential are of high class homes - good transportation and schools.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Poperty values taper off as they recede the lake shore. Lincoln Ave. is a very old street but very desirable with homes up to 40 years of age. One man owns and controls a large percent of the properties in this section. On Maryland, south of Superior Ave. Shenly and Beverly Streets are new modern brick and frame cottages not quite up to the standard of the balance of this section.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good transportaion and schools - restricted secrion of modest character.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: One of the first sections of Erie.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Central location- lake frontage- convenient to employment- schools and churches
detr_influences: Low class neighborhood

notes: Section close to business center is going into a boarding house section
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Close to employment- central location- Good schools and churches
detr_influences: Mediocre neighborhood threatened with expansion from the north

notes: 12th Street is almost solid negro with houses in poor condition, although industry dominates the street and values for such use are good.
name: Erie, Penn
favor_influences: Near employment. Central location
detr_influences: Mediocre neighborhood threatened with slight Negro encroachment from 12th Street

notes: Considerable business of small nature scattered throughout section. Many wealthy people are moving out. Section is very spotty but retains its desirability as a residential area. Many good modern apartments in this section. Graded second grade principally because of location and stable demand for porperty. 6th and 10th were originally developed with very high grade homes which are still in excellent condition.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Central location - only good downtown residential section
detr_influences: Somewhat old - heavy traffic through section

notes: One of the first sections built in the city. Property east of railroad is the worst in the section
name: Erie, Penn
favor_influences: Near employment- central location- near Government property on waterfront.
detr_influences: Gas tanks- pest hospital- smoke and noise from industry

notes: Has never been a good section and market fro housing is limited to foreign.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Near schools- employment on east side
detr_influences: Concentration of low class populace- poorly built houses- many unpaved streets

notes: Dunn and Lighthouse Streets are slightly better than the balance of the section.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Central location. Near employment- schools- churches.
detr_influences: Between two foreign sections of poor character

notes: Negro concentration along railroad tracks adn on 13th to 15th Streets. Some low class Jewish on 17th and 18th Streets from French to Parade.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Central location- near employment- good schools and churches
detr_influences: Congested area- near railroad tracks

name: Erie. Penn.
desc_terrain: This section is also surveyed for development but only very scattered housing has been built to date. Because of its location there is little possibility of the section ever being improved with better than third grade housing.

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: Level to rolling in western end.
favor_influences: Good transportation - schools - chruches
detr_influences: Possible encroachment from section C-12

name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Nice clean desirable residential section of good character.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Properties fronting on the lake are very good.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good location - good transportation - only new northeast side residential section - convenient to east side plants - homogenous high class development
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Low class Jewish coming into western end of section. Foreign encroachment in eastern end.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good location
detr_influences: Very mediocre neighborhood of lower class people

name: Sub, Erie
desc_terrain: A sparsely built area which is expected to develop into a good section. Located along the lake shore it is one of the few good lake front locations avail-able for high class building. the reputation of the are is fine and developmet will undoubtedly be of high calibre.

name: Erie, Penn.
desc_terrain: Three very poor streets sparsely settled with shack type housing in poor condition. Values are questionable. The land is practically all swamp ground of little value.

notes: Property on Elm Street is the best. Buffalo highway properties are also fairly good with the balance of the section very mediocre.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Near east side employment
detr_influences: Railroad tracks- Unpaved streets- low lying ground- heavy traffic on Pike

notes: Developed by G.E. for officials of the company. Section is outside city limits of Erie.
name: Lawrence Park - Sub. Erie
favor_influences: Desirable residential development of good houses. Near golf course. WEll-planned section.
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Development is allayed because of encroachment of undesirable surroundings. 26th, 27th, and 29th Streets are very poor although development is scattered. Housing is concentrated in the first two blocks paralleling the Buffalo Pike, the balance of the area being sparsely settled.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Good transportation- suburban atmosphere
detr_influences: Heavy traffic on Buffalo Pike- low lying land- Proximity to railroad tracks.

notes: Developed by G. E. during war time. Outside the city limits of Erie. This section has concentration of row houses with from 6 to 10 units in a group. Sales of these units have been very good in early 1937.
name: Lawrence Park- Sub. Erie
favor_influences: Suburban atmosphere. A modest development fair character. Near employment
detr_influences: Nominal

notes: Most of this section is outside Erie city limits. These few streets are distinctly newer and better than the remainder of the area.
name: Wesleyville - Sub. Erie
favor_influences: Quiet surburban section of modest character. Fairly new development.
detr_influences: Nominal

name: Wesleyville- Sub. Erie
desc_terrain: Although apparently laid out, the section is practically all farmland. Such scattered housing that exists is of only fair character and any additional development will undoubtedly be slow. Expansion of General Electric would probably encourage new building in this section, but such appears remote at this date.

notes: This is a very old town depending for growth on G. E. or other industry in the area.
name: Wesleyville- Sub. Erie
favor_influences: Near employment locally. Good transportation- schools- churches
detr_influences: Nominal

name: Parkway- Sub. Erie
desc_terrain: Surveyed land now being farmed with only very scattered housing of third grade character

notes: The section is being taken over by doctors and dentists. Many large houses are being converted to apartments and boarding houses. Section enjoys a good reputation and values have held up very well. Some fine old houses are still occupied by original owners.
name: Erie, Penn.
favor_influences: Central location. Immediate conversion to semi-business
detr_influences: Obsolescence- Inflex of small business

notes: Best portion along Chapel Hill Road and part of James Street
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: All city conveniences, fair transportation
detr_influences: Cemetery on north, and old amusement park

notes: Eastern side of this area lies immediately adjoining area occupied by white people, and the same is true of the northern side. A large ditch is on the eastern side. Northern portion most desirable.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N. C.
favor_influences: Adequate Transportation, city conveniences
detr_influences: Adjoining cemetery, ditch through part of area

notes: Best portion on west is Erwin Road and on south Duke University Road - Chapel Hill Street, Burch Street, and west end of Wilkerson Street.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: All city conveniences, adequate transportation in eastern portion
detr_influences: Railroad and industrial development on north, also inadequate transportation in western portion

notes: In this section are located the homes of some of the wealthiest families in the city, mostly on Duke Street and Hill Street.  That part of the area along Vickers Avenue, Shepherd Street, and Arnett Avenue consists of the lower priced homes.  The desirability of the section is largely maintained by the presence of these higher-priced homes, and it is hardly possible that any future development will be other than in the medium to lower-priced dwellings.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Close to main business district.  All city conveniences.  Close to schools, adequate transportation.
detr_influences: Undesirable approach from three sides.

notes: Northern part is gradually being taken over by negroes.  Southern part along Duke Street is considerably better.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Close to main business district.  All city conveniences
detr_influences: Industrial development along north and east.  Inadequate transportation

notes: There are only four houses in this area.  It is a recent development occupied by doctors.  The homes are on very large lots, and are of the expensive type - $12000-$20000.  It adjoins the new Duke Univeristy grounds.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Adjoining Duke University - all city conveniences - zoned for single family
detr_influences: Inadequate transportation - distance from business center

notes: This is a section composed largely of cheaply built shacks - very poor class of tenants
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N. C.
favor_influences: Close to school
detr_influences: Inadequate transportation, railroad track along north, un-paved streets

notes: Toward the river front there are a number of homes worth $50,000 and upward. One home in Retheay sold at $85,000. On one a life insurance company owns a mortgage at $30,000.
name: Richmond, Virginia
desc_terrain: Windsor Farms rolling, except on the river where it is hilly. Retheay is hilly
favor_influences: Most desirable area in or about Richmond.
detr_influences: None
build_type: Brick on 100 ft. lots up to 10 & 15 acre estates

notes: White population largely on McMannen Street for about 2 blocks South of railroad and some on South Street, and on McMannen Street are several fairly nice homes. This was formerly a good white residential street but negroes are gradually taking up the area.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N. C.
favor_influences: All city conveniences, adequate transportation, schools located in area, also community business center.
detr_influences: Industrial area along railroad tracks on North and West.
build_type: Small singles and some large singles

notes: In this section live most of the negroes with better incomes.  There are some nice residences in the area but where you find one good one there is likely to be adjoining it on either or both sides a house of much lower grade in quality.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Adequate transportation, all city conveniences, negro college located in area.
detr_influences: Lack of uniformity in properties, unpaved streets
inhab_type: Negro professional men, insurance men, mechanics, laborers

notes: No houses have been lately offered for sale in this area.  The surrounding section is not much built up.  The eastern side has a rather steep slope.
source: Leon W. Powell
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: All utilities, bus transportation, close to city park, zoned for strictly residential single family.
detr_influences: None

notes: The area is fairly uniform and occupied by a good type of substantial middle-class citizen.  Cause for increase in predominating values is the fact that the past few years has seen quite a lot of new building in this area
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Has all city conveniences, paved streets, close to schools and community business center, walking distance of main business district.
detr_influences: Nothing particular; surrounding properties are old.  Tendency to industrial development along railroad in area to the east.

notes: New construction along Roxboro Road and Club Boulevard, these two streets being about the best in the area.
source: Leon W Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Adequate transportation, western part adjoins Junior and Senior High School.
detr_influences: Railroad track through southwestern part and industrial activity along the track.  Large low-lying tract between railroad and Duke Street.

notes: The southern part of this area is the older part and the section was started about 30 years ago.  It is continuing northward-it being adjacent to the Women's College of Duke University is considered in its favor.  Many of the faculty members of the college own homes in the area and others rent.   There are several apartments and duplexes in the area and several duplexes have recently been built, but this has not had any detrimental effect on the area.  The area probably has as little sales resistance as any in the city.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Adequacy of every utility - schools - college
detr_influences: None
build_type: Singles & Duplexes & apts. to Urban St. Beyond Urban zoned for singles
sales_act: None for sale except vacant lots

notes: There are two cotton mills located along the railroad tracks and probably 50% of the residences in the area are owned by the mill people and rented to their employees.  This applies largely to the western side of the area, west of Broad Street.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Adequate transportation, community business center located on 9th Street near the railroad trach, schools and churches in area.
detr_influences: Cotton mill located in area, railroad track adjoins on south.
inhab_type: Cotton mill workers, mechanics, clerks, etc

notes: This area occupied by negroes mostly of lower class. There are a few fairly decent houses on Club Boulevard.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N. C.
favor_influences: Adequete transportation, city coveniences
detr_influences: Ditch running through area, trash dump located in area

notes: Type of construction fairly uniform.  The area to the south is largely made up of mill houses of cheap construction.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: All city conveniences, adequate transportation, close to small park, paved streets
detr_influences: South of the area is occupied largely by cotton mill properties and people

notes: The better part of the area is that part extending from Maryland Avenue to Hillendale Road, along Club Boulevard.  That part of the area on 9th Street and on Club Boulevard fronting Watts Hospital not quite as desirable as other part of area.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Large lots, quiet, all utilities, school on 9th St, adequate transportation, park close.  In direction of city trend.
detr_influences: 3 miles from center of city - truck traffic? (There is an indication that the future may see East and West bound through truck traffic routed along Club Boulevard)

notes: There is a golf course, well kept, almost adjoining this area.  There has been quite a bit of activity in sale of vacant lots here in the past few months.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: All utilities, adequate transportation, close to park
detr_influences: Unpaved streets, distance to schools and community center

notes: Western part of area close to main business district.  Many old large houses.  Properties on Cleveland, Roxboro, Markham, and Holloway is better portion.  Eastern part is in East Durham and not thickly populated.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Adequate transportation - all city conveniences - school in area - also community business center.
detr_influences: Cotton mill on Maple Street on western side of area - industrial development along railroad trrack in center of area and also on western side - unpaved streets.

notes: This is one of the older good residential sections with many large homes.  Encroachment of business district, however, will gradually change the grading.  The type of adjacent neighborhood is also against it.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Close to main business distrcit, schools, all city conveniences
detr_influences: Negro section joining on south, encroachment of apartments and rooming houses and commercial district.

notes: This is an area of only two blocks in length and extending along Hyde Park Avenue.  Its main objectionable feature is the surroundings; however, it is far ahead in value, desirability, and appearance of the adjacent neighborhoods.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Close to schools and community business center, all city conveniences, adequate transportation
detr_influences: Surrounded by cotton mill section and undesirable neighborhoods.  City not building in its direction.

notes: Best part of the area is the western part around Dowd Street and on it.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N. C.
favor_influences: All city conveniences, adequate transportation
detr_influences: Railroad track through center of area, many unpaved streets

notes: Northwest part of area occupied by negroes. At junction of Angier and Main is lare cotton mill. Mills also located on railroad track north of Main Street.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N. C.
favor_influences: All city conveniences, adequate transportation
detr_influences: Cotton mill and other industrial plants located on railroad

notes: This is one of the best residential sections in Durham and has enjoyed a very healthy activity recently.  The population is substantial and is composed of those with good incomes.  Its distance from schools and business center does not detract from it.
source: Leon W. Powell, Realtor
name: Durham, N.C.
favor_influences: Public park, restricted covenants and deeds, adequate utilities, zoned for single family, minimum lot 75 feet wide
detr_influences: Distance to school, inadequate transportation, gas only in part
inhab_type: Professional men, business Executives, college professors

notes: The only vacancies are those remaining unsold.
source: See Explanations
name: New Rochelle, N.Y.
desc_terrain: Land is high, rolling and well wooded. This is a brand new development which still continues. Houses are of moderate size on small plots which are well landscaped. Architecture is varied but pleasing.
favor_influences: Character of development.
detr_influences: Distance froms tores, schools, churches, etc.

source: See Explanations
name: WATERTOWN - CONN.
desc_terrain: Rolling and hilly land. A small country town containing the well-known Taft School. Grounds are large, well landscaped and maintained. In the eastern corner is some industry and there, trend is slightly less desirable.
favor_influences: Attractiveness of a small town and pride of ownership.
detr_influences: None.
inhab_type: School teacher, retired business men and executives

notes: Industrial employment increases have resulted in substantial rental advances.
source: See Explanations.
name: OAKWILLE - CONN.
desc_terrain: Land rising to the west. A small manufacturing town actually a continuation of Waterbury. This section contains various sized homes of working men.
favor_influences: Nearness to places of employment. Own schools, churches and shopping center.
detr_influences: Distance from center of city. (Waterbury)
